loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dutse Village. Musa joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Musa suffered from poor crop yields that crippled his ability to repair his house or move into a bigger home. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Musa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Musa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre con 20 años de edad, humilde y muy trabajador, luego de quedarse sin empleo durante varios meses, y pasar por duras situaciones económicas, inicio a laborar en la cría y venta de ganado, un medio que le genera muy buenos ingresos, con eso logra  cubrir la mayoría de sus necesidades.
Trabaja toda la semana durante 3 horas diarias.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el para poder comprar terneros y cuido al por mayor.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de progresar permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Diego is a 20-year-old man.  He is humble and hardworking.  After being unemployed for several months and passing through some difficult financial situations, he started to work raising and selling cattle.  This has given him a good income, and with that income he manages to cover the majority of his needs.

He works three hours a day, all week long.

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy calves in bulk and pay for their upkeep.  His positive attitude and his desire to make progress demonstrate in this man an immense urge to improve himself and, of course, a favorable answer to his request.

loans.use: to buy calves and pay for their upkeep

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 65 years old, married, and has one child. Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. 

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before requesting this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from retail sales of frozen foods.

Cecilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Felix Renato

texts.es: Felix es soltero tiene 25 años de edad se dedica a la produccion y comercialzacion de platano yuca y el dinero lo invertira para comprar abono urea para mejorar su cosecha quiere llegar a tener una estabilidad economica y le gusta hacer actividad deportiva
texts.en: Felix is a 25-year-old single man who earns a living through the production and marketing of bananas and yucca. The loan will be used to buy fertiliser and urea to improve his harvest. He wants to achieve financial stability and he likes to do sports.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and urea.

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar is 56 years old, from village Damiageurarkhi. He has wife, pensioner mother, son and daughter-in-law, who is a teacher and gets small monthly income. Khanlar's son is an assistant at the local restaurant. The family has small agricultural activity, in particular, they cultivate a plot of agricultural land and grow potatoes, cucumbers and strawberries.

Khanlar is a hard-worker, who sells the agricultural products seasonally and generates small income. He has great desire to make family-business and tackle with the financial difficulties. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Khanlar will open the local bakery in a good location of village and will sell the baked products among local people. The business will be the only in this kind of area and will has it's own loyal costumers.
The loan will greatly assist Khanlar and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: to open a bakery and make a stable source of income.

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en:
A $1,000.00 loan is offered to Teresinha to improve her business. She has a kiosk near where many people live and where many people come every day to make purchases. 

She will use this loan to buy some additional supplies including water, sardines, cooking oils, milk, ketchup, sauces, salt, biscuits, gambling cards, scissors, glue, soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She has been involved in business activities since 2013, using her own working capital. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can help her husband be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future, with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy water, sardines, cooking oils, milk, ketchup, sauces, salt, biscuits, gambling cards, scissors, glue, soft drinks and other things to sell

loans.name: Wikaash

texts.en: Wikaash once again thanks all his Kiva lenders for helping him with the rice production. With the profit of last season, he could save more money for purchasing his own rice plot. Wikaash could also pay for the studies of his son. To save more for his family and son studies, wikaash needs to continue with the rice cultivation and needs another loan of SRD 10.000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Denita Children's Centre School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Bernard. He is the Head teacher of Denita School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Gayaza in Wakiso with 300 students. Denita School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Denita School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Bernard ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; La socia continua con su negocio de venta de papa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “LOS ANGELES”; the bank is situated in the district of Cusco, in Cusco Province within the Department of Cusco.

The member is Gregoria and she continues to make a living selling potatoes. She has been running this business for some time and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts in everyday. The member is a responsible and hard-working person and this is how she gets her family ahead.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments. She is requesting a loan to buy potatoes amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy potatoes amongst other things.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elias de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la apicultura posee 70 colmenas se dedica a esa actividada desde hace 2 años, adicional a eso tambien se dedica a la ganaderia, comercializa sus productos durante todo el año y con las ganancias que pbtiene es como puede salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de azucar y vitaminas para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Elias is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his son. He works beekeeping and has 70 hives. He has worked in this business for two years. Besides this he also works raising livestock. He sells his product throughout the year and with the profits he makes allows him to get ahead with his family. He is requesting a loan to buy sugar and vitamins to continue with his work so that he can have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy sugar and vitamins.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 35 years old, married, and has two children who both attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Irish has a business in retail sales of rice in the Philippines. Irish requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more inventory of rice to sell.

Irish has been in this business for two years. In the future, Irish would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of rice to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 43 years old, married, and has three children.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before requesting this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mary Jean aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 33 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melodia has a business buying and selling oysters in the Philippines. Melodia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

Melodia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Melodia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sini Mousso Group

texts.fr:
Odette, est une femme âgée de 43 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont tous scolarisés. 

Elle exerce son activité depuis 19 ans. 

Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est la forte commande qu'elle gagne parce qu'elle fait très bien son activité, elle est dynamique et elle est à l'écoute de ses clients présente de beau motif de pagne après tissage. 

Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des files à tissé à 100 000 F ; acheter de la teinture à 100 000 F ; et les autre à 50 000 F. 

L’utilité du prêt de pouvoir renforcer son activité afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plus de 6 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Odette is a married woman, aged 43, mother of three children who all are or have been in school. She has been in her business for 19 years.

What makes her business do well is the number of orders she gets due to the fact that she does very good work. She is dynamic and always pays attention to her clients' desires. After weaving, her pagnes (African cloth) have beautiful patterns.

Odette wants this loan to buy thread for weaving for 100,000 francs, dye for 100,000 francs, and various other items for 50,000 francs. The usefulness of the loan is to allow her to expand her business so as to satisfy her clientele.

Odette has already benefited from more than six loans and has reimbursed them on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving for 100,000 francs, dye for 100,000 francs, and miscellaneous for 50,000 francs.

loans.name: Think Less, Live More - N14Tsơnđsơn Group

texts.en:
Thể is 51 years old and married with one child. 
She has been working in agriculture, growing pineapples for more than 10 years.
Thể lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in her village and the market need is low in this region. The output is unpredictable because it depends on many factors like seed, weather conditions, and how the farmers plant and take care of the crop.
The main hardship that Thể faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer to increase her output.
In 2014, Thể joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thể has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the leader of the Think Less, Live More - N14TSơnĐSơn Group which consists of three members.
With her business profit, Thể hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings and fertilizer to increase her output

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 56 years old. She is widowed with 8 children, and 2 of her children go to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cynthia has a personal care products business in the Philippines. She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more personal care products to sell.

Cynthia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 56 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Edna has a general store business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Edna has been in this business for two years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonel Alberto

texts.es:
Leonel, de 52 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, estudió hasta tercer grado, sin embargo es muy versátil, está felizmente casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tuvieron cinco hijos de los cuales 2 ya tienen su propio hogar y los otros 3 están bajo su dominio.

Leonel, trabaja desde hace 26 años en una cooperativa de exportación de semilla de marañón, que está ubicada cerca de su casa y hace 8 años lo nombraron administrador de la cooperativa; a parte de eso también se dedica a sembrar granos básicos en unas parcelas que han adquirido.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insumos como herbicidas, fertilizantes y abonos para la siembra de frijol y maíz, pues ya se estableció la época lluviosa y necesita aprovechar ese tiempo.

Leonel, sueña con continuar en la coopertiva y continuar trabajando la tierra, de tal manera que le pueda dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Leonel, 52 years old, is a hard-working man. He studied through the third grade. However, he is very versatile. He is happily married to his wife, a homemaker. The two had five children, two of whom already have their own home, and three who are in their care.

Leonel has worked for 26 years in a seed exportation cooperative, which is located near his house. Eight years ago, he was named administrator of the cooperative. Aside from that, he also works sowing staple grains in a few land plots that they have acquired.

The requested loan is to buy products like weed-killers, fertilizers and compost for the sowing of beans and corn, as the rainy season has already begun and he needs to take advantage of that time.

Leonel's dream is to continue in the cooperative as well as to continue working the land in such a way that he can give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies like weed-killers, fertilizers and compost for the sowing of beans and corn.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una campesina de Puerto Triunfo, a sus 41 años de edad, se desempeña como criadora de cerdos, actividad que aprendió de la mano de su padre y que ahora le permite generar recursos para solventar las necesidades del hogar. 

La producción es vendida en dicho municipio.
El crédito que solicita es una alternativa para fortalecer su actividad, ya que con el dinero desea comprar lechones y materiales para arreglo de cochera, con el ánimo de incrementar su producción y mejorar los ingresos, así podrá hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan.

Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su labor y aumentar su capacidad de producción mínimo con 20 cerdos, así podrá tener una estabilidad económica favorable y mejorará la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a farmer from Puerto Triunfo. At 41 years of age she works as a pig producer, a business that she learned from her father and now it allows her to generate resources to pay for the needs of her household. She sells her product in her municipality.

The loan that she is requesting is an alternative to strengthen her business as she wants to buy piglets and materials to fix her pigpen with the money. Her goal is to increase her production and improve her income and doing this she can face the challenges that occur.

Luz says that her greatest wish is to continue to consolidate her work and increase her production capacity to a minimum of 20 pigs. Then she would have a favorable economic stability and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and material to fix her pigpen.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a busy entrepreneur from Barangay Handamangan, Bacolod City in the Philippines. He specializes in screen printing using silk, which is a great opportunity to Filipinos who are arts enthusiasts. Silkscreen printing is the process of creating a stencil in a mesh screen, then using a squeegee and pushing the ink through the mesh onto the shirt or garment (this is what Joel is doing in the photo). He has his regular customers who request orders by piecemeal or in bulk, and they provide their desired pattern or design.This business earns Joel approximately PHP 5,000 each month.

His wife Jonah operates a carinderia (a local Filipino eatery selling and serving affordable viands for the masses). Together, they are working hard to sustain their everyday needs and cover business expenses. Their combined profit helps pay household bills and supports their children's education. Joel believes that education is the most effective weapon against poverty. Through their joint efforts and sacrifices in improving their business, he knows he could give his children the best education they deserve. 

To make this happen, he is requesting a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy more raw materials like paint, screens, and shirts needed for his silkscreen printing business. Part of the loan will also be used to buy ingredients and materials for their carinderia. Joel hopes that you will consider his request and promises to faithfully pay back your kindness.

He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like paint, screens, and shirts needed for his silkscreen printing business.

loans.name: Be Happy, Be Bright - N15T5Tdương Group

texts.en:
Xuyến is 42 years old and married. 
She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Xuyến lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in her village and the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because disease in poultry happens can be deadly leaving her nothing to sell, causing financial trouble.
The main hardship that Xuyến faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell.
In 2011, Xuyến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Xuyến has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the leader of  the Be Happy, Be Bright - N15T5TDương Group which consists of four members.
With her business profit, Xuyến hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en: Eduard is 28 years old, married and has two children. He offers motorcycle transport services to earn income. He wants to keep offering safe travel for his passengers and needs additional capital to maintain his vehicle. Eduard is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy gasoline and oil and to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and oil and to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana and her husband have been living together in their hometown in the Chouf mountains of Lebanon for 30 years. While her husband is a retired officer from the Lebanese Army, Joumana is passionate about lace making, a traditional practice she learned from her mother when she was younger. She is now 52 years old and has been selling her products to clients from neighbouring towns in the mountains for nearly 10 years.

The couple earns a monthly pension from the army, which is not always enough to cover their expenses. This situation pushes Joumana to continuously pursue her ambition and come up with new products to increase her sales. She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She believes that by taking this loan and buying silk and pearls, she will be able to create a new line of products, which will boost her sales and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy new material for her crafts.

loans.name: Llukman

texts.en:
Llukman is from a minority community. He is married and has a son (in the photo is his wife and son). Like all those living in his community, he is very poor and lives in substandard conditions. His wife stays home to care for the house and their child, while he works carrying materials in order to make a living. His salary is very low and often inconsistent.

For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a trailer. He plans to use the trailer to find his own work after he is done with his day job. This loan will help him to be able to generate more income for his family by giving him two incomes. His goal is to have his own business in the future and he is very happy for the opportunity from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer to find his own work after he is done with his day job

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas las integrantes están luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y a la vez poder ayudar a su familia. Son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Estela es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una modesta despensa que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido montar. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que lucha por sus seres queridos para poder darles una vida digna y sin necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos para poder surtir su despensa, y que le faltan para ampliar su despensa. Agradece por la oportunidad que cada una está recibiendo de poder mejorar en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Guapa is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group in which all of its members are striving to improve their living conditions while helping their families at the same time. These women are heads of household who are providing for their loved ones.

Sra. Estela is one of the members. She has a modest store that she opened after a great amount of effort and sacrifice. Estela is a determined woman who gives her best on behalf of her loved ones so that they can have a decent life without having to face the hardships that she endured.

Estela is requesting a loan in order to buy products for stocking her store since she lacks the resources to expand her inventory. She appreciates the opportunity that all of the members have received so that they can improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her store.

loans.name: G. S. La Superacion Group

texts.es:
G.S. LA SUPERACION ESTA CONFORMADA POR TRES INTEGRANTES, MADRES SOLTERAS CON SIETE HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, TODAS LUCHAN DIA DIA PARA SACAR ADELANTE SUS NEGOCIO Y FAMILIAS, Y CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO ES BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS, LA ESTABILIDAD QUE NECESITAN, Y HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS Y MEJORAS SUS VIVIENDAS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  DOMINGA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION COMO: BODY, PERFUMES, CREMAS, VANIDADES, RUBOR, MARBELLINES, ANTIOJERAS ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHOS HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE LOS CLIENTES, Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. G.S LA SUPERACION AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
G.S. La Superacion is made up of three members: single mothers with seven children under the age of 18. They come from El Sauce and are hard-working, responsible and looking to improve themselves. They all fight everyday, to get their businesses and their families ahead, and to realise their dreams and goals, such as providing their children with the stability they need, growing their businesses and improving their homes.

Dominga is the coordinator, thanks to her desire to get ahead. She makes a living selling cosmetics from her home, such as body lotions, perfumes, creams, vanities, blush, eye make-up and concealer. She dedicates eight hours to her business everyday, selling her products. With this loan, the aim is to invest in working capital (cosmetics), in order to meet customer demand and, as a result, increase her income in the near future. G.S La Superacion is grateful to Kiva investors for helping people with limited resources, in poor countries such as Nicaragua, to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as blush, eye shadow, body lotions, perfumes, eye make-up, concealer and moisturisers.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Marleni belongs to the “LOS ANGELES” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

She continues with her business selling natural products. She has been in the business for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She is a responsible person and she continues to sell her merchandise to her clients that request it. She wants to continue to work in this manner in order to continue to support her family.

Marleni is requesting the loan to buy natural products.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is heartened that she was previously able to get a loan to sustain her store, the income from which helped cover her family's daily needs. Her family may not have any luxuries in life, but it is enough that they are intact and love and support one another.

To compete with nearby mini-markets, she is requesting another loan of 35,000 PHP to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, canned goods, bread, instant noodles, eggs, oil, beverages, powdered milk, chocolate, and toiletries which she sells at retail. Offering more essential food and household items will attract more customers to her store and increase her sales. She thanks Kiva and CCT for their continued support for small businesswomen like her.

Emelyn's precious dream is for her store to grow and to see her children finish college. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell for the benefit of her family.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Born in 1992, Mohammad is a 23-year-old Palestinian refugee living with his parents and two sisters in a Palestinian camp located in North Lebanon. Mohammad's dad runs a fruits and vegetables shop and his mom works at the kindergarten of the camp. Mohammad grew up in the camp and has been working in interior decoration for 9 years, more specifically in gypsum and artificial ceilings.

In order to upgrade his equipment and buy new molds, which will be help him work in better conditions and take more projects, Mohammad is asking for a 2,569,000 Lebanese Pound loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa.

Mohammad is hoping that this small investment not only will boost his business and personal income, but also impact his community by recruiting young workers to help him in his new projects.

Mohammad is a very ambitious young man and is working on finishing his own house. He also owns a small fruit station that helps him earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy new construction equipment and gypsum molds.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 45 years old and from Tubigon, Bohol. To earn a living, Orlando has run a fishing business for the past three years. Orlando works hard to provide for his family. He is married with four adult children. One of his children is 20 years old and still in college. In the future, he dreams that his son can continue his studies and earn his degree.

Orlando is requesting a loan to buy fishing net to help him increase his catch. He also plans to buy additional fish to sell to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fish to sell.

loans.name: Miralyn

texts.en:
Miralyn used her prior loan to maintain her store, which helped to cover her family's daily sustenance. To be able to serve more customers, she is  requesting another loan for 35,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as canned goods, rice, instant noodles, eggs, oil, bread, biscuits, coffee, soft drinks, and toiletries. With a mini-store nearby she is now facing competition so it is necessary for her to offer more food and household items. 

Like any small store owner Miralyn's dream is for her store to grow and her income to increase so she can send her children to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from God.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Kossi est un homme marié résidant à Adidogomé avec quatre enfants à charge. Kossi est un marchand de moutons  et des céréales qui achète ses marchandises  au marché. Kossi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des céréales et gagner des bénéfices en vue d’utiliser pour réinvestir dans son activité et prendre bien soin de ses enfants.
texts.en: At 34 years old, Kossi is a married man who lives in Adidogomé and takes care of four children. Kossi sells sheep and cereals, and purchases his goods at the market. Kossi is asking for this loan to order cereals and earn a profit which he will use to reinvest in his activity and take good care of his children.

loans.use: to buy eighty bowls of rice and five bags of corn.

loans.name: Procoro

texts.en:
Procoro is a 46-year-old man from Tubigon, Bohol. He is married with four school-aged children, ages 19, 15, 8, and 3 years old. He is a fisherman and works hard to sustain the needs of his family. He has been doing this for three years.

Procoro needs a loan to help him increase their income. He is requesting a loan to buy fishing net and a boat for fishing. In the future, he wishes to send all of his children to college and earn their degrees.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a boat.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is 46 years old. She is married with 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felina has a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Felina has been in this business for 18 years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned good, and other groceries.

In the future Felina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Chirij Cruz Group

texts.es:
Isabel es  soltera de 35 años de edad, cuenta con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 13 y 18 años el mayor no estudia y los otros estudian en la escuela de su comunidad.
Isabel (la que se ubica en medio de la foto de blusa morada)  con el afán de brindarles lo mejor a sus tres queridos hijos desde hace dos año tomo la iniciativa de buscar una actividad que fuera más rentable, porque trabajar en el campo no le era muy beneficioso, por lo que eligió la actividad de la compra y venta de ropa típica por vivir en una de las comunidades donde la mayoría de las personas utiliza traje típico. Isabel gracias a su carisma, amabilidad y optimismo  ha logrado que mucha gente lo busque muy constantemente y a raíz de esto ella ve la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, comprando una variedad de güipiles, fajas, cortes y todo lo relacionado con la línea de crédito.
El gran anhelo de Isabel es tener una tienda que ofrezca a los clientes los mejores trajes típicos para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Isabel is single, she is 35 years old, and she has a nice family which included three children who are between 13 and 18 years old. The eldest isn't studying and the others study at their community school. 

Isabel (located in the middle of the photograph, wearing a purple shirt), with the urge of bringing the best to her three dear children, two years ago took the initiative to find a more profitable occupation, because working in the fields is not very beneficial. This is why she chose the occupation of buying and selling traditional clothing, because she lives in one of the communities where the majority of people wear traditional clothing. 

Isabel, thanks to her charisma, kindness, and optimism, has achieved having many people who constantly seek her out, and because of this, she sees the need of asking for a loan to invest in her business, buying a variety of guipiles (traditional tunics), belts, traditional cloth, and everything related with the line of credit.
Isabel’s biggest dream is to have a store that offers clients the best traditional clothing, to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is a strong and devoted woman who has been remarkably positive despite facing major challenges on a daily basis. She is the loving wife of Nicola, to whom she has been married for more than 50 years and who is a disabled United States Veteran. Diane’s husband is terminally ill, and in recent years, she has dedicated the majority of her time to ensuring that her husband receives compassion and quality health care on a weekly basis. Over the last few years, their home has had to be modified to accommodate Nicola’s wheelchair which includes railing, a lift, and ramps to ensure that the home is comfortable and accessible for him. Nicola’s quality of life is a major concern for Diane as his health continues to deteriorate, so she provides as much at-home care as possible so that he is in a familiar environment. Diane has tried her best to maintain the home during the past few years; however, the roof on the home has begun to leak and Diane is concerned that mold growth will further compromise Nicola’s already fragile state of health. Diane’s credit has been severely damaged due to falling medical bills accumulating when Nicola’s health began to decline in late 2012. Diane has since brought all of their accounts current, but the damage has hindered her ability to access affordable financing to make these necessary repairs. 

Diane hopes that SELF and KIVA can help her access an affordable  loan to replace the roof on her home so that she will not have to worry about the safety of her home, and her husband’s health being affected by mold.

loans.use: a new roof which will greatly improve the safety of her home as well as provide a more suitable living environment for her husband who is in a fragile state of health.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hard working single mother of three children. She has experienced many challenges within the past few years, and raising her children on her own has been a difficult journey. During these troubled times, Margarita’s resourcefulness, positivity and determination have helped her overcome these challenges. 

Margarita’s marriage ended abruptly, forcing her to suddenly have to support her household on only one income.  As she readjusted her life she did her best to pay all of her bills while downsizing and making her household budget more manageable. Unfortunately, for a few months, her household expenses were simply overwhelming, and she could not keep up with them. This caused major damage to her credit as most of the bills were in her name only. Margarita did not give up. She was able to bring all of her bills current, but due to the multiple late payments her credit was damaged. She now wants to finance a new air conditioning unit for her home with affordable payments. 

Margarita and her family are in desperate need of a new air conditioning unit while Florida experiences above average temperatures and in her home it is often hotter than outdoors. The current unit is no longer functional, and contains a large amount of mold, which is greatly affecting the health of her children. She is hoping that SELF and KIVA can help her finance a new air conditioning unit that will not only help improve her children’s quality of life, but also help her rebuild her credit.

loans.use: to improve the quality of life in her home for her children by replacing an old  air conditioner unit that is filled with mold, with a new high efficiency AC that will help her also reduce her energy bills.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more vegetables to sell from her food stall.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Siydash

texts.ru: Сийдаш, 62 года, вдова вот уже 20 лет, мать 3 детей, дети взрослые, старший сын живет с Сийдаш. У нее среднее образование, она положительная, трудолюбивая, целеустремленная. Свою трудовую деятельность начала 41 год назад, работала ткачихой, позже стала оператором на Почте, сейчас Сийдаш на заслуженной пенсии и занимается сельским хозяйством. Нна сегодняшний день есть 2 дойные коровы и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Сийдаш составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). Сийдаш обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для проведения ремонта в доме, часть средств будет направлена на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Инвестиция в бизнес в виде скота поможет развить бизнес и в дальнейшем улучшать жилищные условия семьи Сийдаш.
texts.en:
Siydash is 62 and has been widowed for 20 years. She is the mother of three adult children. Her oldest son lives with her. She has a high school education and is positive, hardworking and purposeful. She started working 41 years ago as a weaver and later worked for the post office. Now she is on a pension and works in agriculture. She currently has two dairy cows and 20 sheep with a monthly income of 13,000 KGS.

Siydash has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 85,000 KGS to purchase building materials to do home renovations, a portion of which will go toward purchasing a calf to increase her head count of livestock. Investing in her livestock business will allow her to develop it and in the future to improve living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house, and to buy a calf to invest in her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta manages a store for income. She is 53 years old and has two children.

Julieta sells grocery items daily. She would like to earn more income by selling more grocery items, so she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, breads, biscuits, noodles, and soap to sell. She would like to continuously extend affordable products and services.

In the future, Julieta would like to keep gaining good profits for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, biscuits, noodles, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a 50-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Clara has had a general store business for 10 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Clara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 47 years old and single. She is a very hard -working entrepreneur.

Eugenia has a business buying and selling oysters in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

Eugenia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

loans.name: Tazhihan

texts.ru: Тажихан, 57 лет, вдова, есть 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, сейчас на пенсии, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 27 овец, 2 лошади. На арендованном участке мерою 0,70 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход Тажихан составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому она решила развивать свой бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для разведения. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Tazhihan is 57 years old, widowed, and has four children. She has secondary education, is now retired, and engaged in animal and field husbandry. Thanks to her persistent hard work, today the farm has a cow, 27 sheep, and two horses. On a rented land plot of 0.70 hectares, she cultivates corn for on-farm consumption and sale. 

Tazhihan's monthly income is about 16,000 som (KGS), and this amount is disastrously insufficient for a satisfactory life. Thus she has decided to develop her business and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cows for breeding. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further increase of her number of livestock, and she wants to save to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is 48 and is married. She lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Suriya purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for many years, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well.

She wants to utilize her experience and generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to the upcoming Eid festival, the demand for bright clothing will increase. This is the reason Suriya showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of bright clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can increase her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

Note: Suriya stands with a raised hand in the picture.

loans.use: to buy bright clothes to sell among her locality's ladies, to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Hamdi is a 27-year-old single man from Rafah, which is both a city and a refugee camp in the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw for the past three years. Hamdi transports the goods and inventory between the traders in the city. Hamdi has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy new rickshaw. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

Note:
Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.en:
Filomeno is a 38-year-old man and a resident of Tubigon, Bohol, in which most of the community earns a living by doing fishing businesses.

Filomeno is in one of those communities and is involved in the fishing business to raise his family. He works hard through this business to provide and to sustain each day. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy fishing net to uplift his catch.

In the future, he plans to buy another boat for fishing to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leah dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jesusa has a business buying and selling oysters in the Philippines. She has requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

Jesusa has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Norma dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 38-year-old woman with five children, they live in Lahore, Pakistan.

Rehana's husband runs a general store to sell rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. He manages his household necessities from his own store and his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an impressive even tone and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and personality, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Rehana requested a loan to buy wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits. She hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way to cope with the demands of her family.

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy  wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 35 years of age. She is a young and energetic woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a garment shop in a nearby cloth market for many years and cherishing children. In fact, his father started him a new garments business. After his father, he is looking after all current affairs of the garment shop.

His shop is situated in the garments market and there are a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition it is very difficult to convince customers to buy with a profitable price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delighting colors of garments over other shops so he can maintain the rate of sales.

Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy fresh stock of delighting color garments. Shakeela hopes that her husband will purchase garments according to his desire on right time so that he can cope with the market competition and can grow his income as well. Shakeela thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy fresh stock of delighting color garments for her husband's garment shop, so he can maintain market competition.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina  ella es casada y tiene 60 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz,aceite, azúcar, leche y galletas.

El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio  permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Reyna del Carmen." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

One member is Señora Justina. She is married and is 60 years old. She has four children. She works in her grocery store business. She sells products of basic necessity, such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She wants to get ahead by means of her business. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is applying for the loan to purchase rice, oil, sugar, milk, and crackers.

The member's photo that is attached to the group photo was taken after the meeting because he asked permission for work reasons.

The other members work in businesses of selling clothing, selling bricks, grocery store, and restaurant.

This member [Señora Justina] is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, and crackers

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living growing vegetables and is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Meriam dreams to be able to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 46-year-old married woman with one school-aged child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Jane has had a scrap business for 5 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy scrap materials to sell.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old, married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Nenita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is 36 years old, married, with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lorelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Lorelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 62 years old, married and has nine children, one of whom is in school. Josefa is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Josefa requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josefa has been farming sugarcane for seven years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Josefa would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 22-year-old student at the Kenya Institute of Highway and Building Technology (KIHBT), this is his second year. He is pursuing a diploma course in Building and Construction.
He struggles to pay the school fees and related costs because his parents are financially unstable. He worked as a laborer for 3 years to save money to enroll in college classes.

He chose to study Building and Construction as a result of his desire to improve the infrastructure in his region. He plans to complete his studies and begin a construction company. He also wants to assist young people like himself from poor backgrounds to achieve their dreams. He requests a loan to help him pay for his studies and accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to pay school fees and related costs.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martin es amable, perseverante  y responsable, él tiene 43 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 3 y 16 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Martin para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, él trabaja como agricultor desde hace 25 años, él ha sido favorecido por vivir en una zona muy fértil que produce buenas verduras y legumbres, con esta ventaja Martin cultiva en varias zonas cercanas de su hogar. Martin solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono químico y semilla de cebolla, para que el en esta temporada pueda cultivar.
Su esperanza es conseguir el crédito para realizar la inversión en su cultivo y con ello obtener mejoras ganancias. Su gran sueño es construir una casa más grande para mejor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is pleasant, perseverant and responsible. He is 43 years old, and is married with a beautiful family of five children between the ages of 3 and 16. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá. To meet his family's needs, Martin has worked in agriculture for 25 years. He has had the good luck of living in a very fertile zone that produces good vegetables and legumes. With this advantage, Martin plants in different areas close to his home.

Martin seeks a loan to buy chemical fertilizer and onion seed, so that he can sow this season. His hope is to obtain the loan in order to invest in his crop, and thereby increase his earnings. His big dream is to build a bigger house so that his family will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and onion seeds.

loans.name: Elkin De Jesus

texts.es:
Un hombre humilde, trabajador y lleno de vida, así es Elkin, a sus 59 años de edad aun trabaja, realiza actividades de campo desde muy niño, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo.
Hoy en día es dueño de un gran cultivo con variedad de frutas, algo que genera muy buenos ingresos, con eso puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Con el fin de aumentar su cultivo y mejorar ventas, Elkin solicita un crédito con el que comprará semillas de fresas, abonos y riegos.
Elkin es un hombre lleno de sueños, su propósito es continuar trabajando para remodelar su casa, ya que su estado actual no es el mejor.

Los diversos factores que lo han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores, no son impedimento para intentar de nuevo y salir adelante con sus proyectos. Se le debe apoyar.
texts.en:
A simple man, hard-working and full of life: this is Elkin. At the age of 59, he is still working. He has done farm work since he was a little boy, thanks to the teachings of his parents, who did the same work.

Now he is the owner of a large farm with a variety of fruits, something that generates very good income. With this, he can cover the basic necessities of his household.

With the goal of increasing his crops and improving sales, Elkin is applying for a loan with which he will buy strawberry seeds, compost, and irrigation.

Elkin is a man full of dreams. His plan is to continue working in order to remodel his house, since its present condition is not the best.

The various factors that have brought failure on past occasions are not impediments to trying again and moving forward with his projects. He should be supported.

loans.use: to buy strawberry seeds, compost, and irrigation

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Augusta pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua  con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable , la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
The member is Augusta who belongs to the “LOS ANGELES” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

She continues with her grocery store business. She has operated her business for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her business each day. She is a responsible person and she continues to sell rice, sugar and milk amongst others to her clients who solicit them. She wants to continue to work in this manner to continue to support her family.

Augusta is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks and sugar amongst others.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and sugar amongst others.

loans.name: G. S. La Luz Del Dia Group

texts.es:
G.S. LA LUZ DEL DIA ESTA CONFORMADA POR TRES INTEGRANTES DOS HOMBRES Y UNA MUJER, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE FAMILIA, ORIGINARIOS SANTA ROSA DEL PEÑON, LOS CUALES SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA HACER PROSPERAR SU NEGOCIO, DARLES ESTABILIDAD A SUS FAMILIAS, Y CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS  COMO ES CONSTRUIR SUS VIVIENDAS.
LA CORDINADORA DEL G.S ES HIPOLITO Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, EL DEDICA UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS A SU ACTIVIDAD, EL CUAL TIENE CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTURALES, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES LA COMPRA DE UN LOTE DE CERDOS EN PIE PARA LA CRIANZA Y VENTA, PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. G.S LUZ DELDIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
G.S. La Luz del Día is composed of three members, two men and one woman, who are responsible, family people. They are from Santa Rosa del Peñon, the inhabitants of which are known to be hardworking, responsible people, with a drive to succeed. They currently strive to make their businesses prosper, bring stability to their families, and meet their dreams and goals, such as building their own homes.

The coordinator of the group is Hipólito, who makes a living raising and selling pigs. His business is located at his home. He spends eight hours a day working. He has both regular and occasional customers. The purpose of the loan is to buy an allotment of pigs to raise and sell, in order to meet the demand of his customers.

G.S. Luz del Día is grateful for the assistance that Kiva investors give to persons of limited resources from poor countries like Nicaragua, providing them a manner to work with dignity.

loans.use: to buy an allotment of live pigs.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en: Arsenio is a 54-year-old man with three children. He is a carpenter and has made furniture such as  chairs, tables, beds, dining sets, and cabinets for  eight years. Arsenio doesn't want to lose his business because it is his family's main source of income. Arsenio requests 20,000 PHP to buy wood, varnish, and nails to make furniture. His earnings will help him expand the business and meet daily needs.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, and nails to make furniture.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria and her husband earn a living from fishing for three years. Victoria is a 46-year-old married woman, with 4 children, from Tubigon, Bohol. She has one school aged child who is 18 years old.

Victoria plans to have enough money to let her daughter finished her degree in college. She requests a loan to buy a fishing net and boat.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and boat.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is a 47-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has four children. Her oldest is 25 years old while her youngest is 8 years old. To earn a living, Tita works as loom weaver.  She uses buri fiber (also known as raffia) to weave. Her husband drives the three-wheel motorcycle they own. They work together to provide for their children. In the future, they want to improve their business to have a sustainable means of living. Therefore, Tita is requesting a loan to buy buri fiber for weaving. She will also use a portion of the loan to pay for motorized tricycle maintenance.

loans.use: to buy buri fiber and pay for motorized tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 63-year-old married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Salvacion has had a peanut business for 20 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more peanuts to sell.

In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Maribelle

texts.en: Maribelle and her family lives in Tuguegarao. She is 33 years old and has four children who attend school. Her spouse is a motorized tricycle driver. Their income is just enough to cover their daily meals and school costs. Maribelle needs additional capital to invest in their transport business. She is asking for a 5,000 PHP loan to buy gasoline and pay for repairs and maintenance of the motorcycle. This will help improve their transport services, increase their profits, and help ensure good travel for all passengers.

loans.use: pay for motorcycle repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta's two children successfully finished their studies. She earned an income  raising hogs for 26 years, and was able to meet her children needs.  Julieta and her husband earnings from farming is enough to sustain their needs. But, Julieta wanted to managing her business for their future. Julieta requests 20,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 62-year-old married woman with seven children.

Linda has raised livestock for 11 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

She has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Linda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan Joselito

texts.es: Jonathan es de estado civil soltero tiene 18 años de edad, vive en el canton Echeandia vive en compania de sus padres se dedica a la compra venta de ganado, solicita el dinero para comprar melaza vitaminas para mejorar la calidad de los animales, el quisiera tener un negocio estable en echeandia, en sus tiempos libres realiza actividad deportiva
texts.en:
Jonathan is single. He is 18 years old and lives in the canton of  Echeandia. He lives with his parents. He buys and sells livestock. He is applying for the money to purchase molasses vitamins to improve the quality of the animals. 

He wants to have a stable business in Echeandia. In his free time he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy molasses vitamins.

loans.name: Don't Forget To Smile - N13T1Qgiao Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hải is 29 years old and married. She has operated a food stall selling alcohol at the market for six years.

Hải lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the income from this job belongs to the crop and is not high enough for her to cover the life costs and save money.

The main hardship that Hải faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary materials for making alcohol.

This is Hải's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standards. She is the group leader of "Don't forget to smile - N13T1QGiao", which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Hải hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for making alcohol.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Every entrepreneur is vulnerable to different challenges affecting their business. Like Julieta, a loyal partner of CCT for almost 7 years now, who has always been dedicated to growing and improving her mini-variety store year after year. She may have experienced ups and downs while operating her store, but discouragement has no place to break the strong-willed person within her.

The love for family consistently drives her to keep going and move forward toward her dreams. She has been running her business for six fruitful years already, and by carefully meeting the demand of customers, Julieta was able to gain more patrons and significantly increased her profit. As of today, her net earnings add up to almost PHP 12,000 per month, and she expects to further increase them in the next few years.

Julieta is again knocking on the door of your generous hearts to make this happen. She needs additional capital to stock her store with a wide array of new products from which her neighbouring customers can choose. She would buy assorted groceries, beverages and toiletries that are usually needed by families within their community. A loan amounting to PHP 35,000 will suffice for this, and she is thanking you in advance for whatever amount you will lend her.

She never stops looking for ways to improve their living condition. Aside from her variety store, Julieta now has her own pre-paid loading station for cellular telephone users and she also operates a 10-seater jeepney unit, both of which help add income for her family. She was able to sustain their daily needs and expenses, and these additional sources of income are a big help also for her husband, Lordjim, who is working abroad.

Julieta still regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecilyn

texts.en: Cecilyn is 33 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is a single parent with one infant. Cecilyn manages a cosmetics store that sufficiently provides for her family needs. She has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory of cosmetics for sale. Cecilyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Cecilyn hopes to expand her cosmetics business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mjeni operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over one year. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mjeni dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Rosa Evelia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a que sus padres no poseían la capacidad económica para ayudarle a seguir estudiando, actualmente está soltera y tiene cuatro hijos que viven con ella, dos de ellos estudian, uno trabaja y la más pequeña no estudia, con ella también viven sus padres y son los que dependen económicamente de ella.

Rosa, se dedica a vender tortillas desde hace 10 años, su mamá fue quien le enseño a ganarse la vida de esa manera, porque su mamá tenía un negocio de tortillas y ella desde que estaba muy pequeña le ayudaba, en la actualidad ella tiene su propio negocio con el cual se gana la vida honradamente y es la única fuente de ingresos que ella posee, en su negocio se involucra su mamá y la venta la realiza en la mediodía y en la tarde.

Rosa, utilizará el crédito para comprar maíz y leña, ella espera mejorar su negocio y así obtener ingresos mucho más elevados para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.

Rosa, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y con un buen empleo, con el préstamo espera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y tener satisfechos a sus clientes y ademas le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y por ende cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old. She went to school only until the sixth grade because her parents lacked the financial means to help her continue studying. She is currently single, and has four children who live with her. Two of them are in school; one works; and the youngest doesn't attend school. Her parents also live with her, and depend on her economically.

Rosa began selling tortillas 10 years ago. Her mother taught her this business, as she had a tortilla business, and Rosa helped her from a very early age. Rosa currently has her own business with which she makes an honest living. It is the only source of income she has. Her mother helps her in the business. Sales are made at midday and in the afternoon.

Rosa will use the loan to buy corn and firewood. She hopes to better her business and thereby obtain much higher earnings in order to improve her living conditions and those of her family. Rosa dreams of seeing her children become professionals with good jobs. With the loan she hopes to improve the status of her business and have satisfied customers. It will also help her to increase her income and thereby reach her dreams.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Ayikoélé

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Ayikoelé est une femme âgée de 44 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Ayikoelé est une marchande de produits alimentaire achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa propre boutique. Ayikoelé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs d’oignons afin d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit en vue d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en: The married mother of four, Ayikoelé is 44 years old and resides in Adidogomé. She sells grocery items and purchases her merchandise twice a month at the market. She resells in her own shop in her home. Ayikoelé is requesting this loan to order sacks of onions to have a significant inventory and to maximize her profit, so as to help out her children with their education, as well as to cover the family’s proven day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of onions

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: RUQIA is the age of 46, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe store in where he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them from his store. He has been selling gents shoes only, but now he wants to offer ladies shoes as well, according to customer’s demand, but the major problem is the lack of capital. Therefore, RUQIA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy ladies shoes as well. RUQIA is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ladies shoes for her husband's shoes store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 37-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
So, Saeed took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Saeed will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Saeed’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Saeed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Abdl-Raouf

texts.en:
Abdl-Raouf is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Abdl took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”.
