La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Los Angeles." She continues working at her grocery store. She has had this business for a good while, and does well at it, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is a responsible person.

She continues to sell rice, sugar and milk, among other products, to those customers who want them. In this manner, she is moving her family forward. She seeks a loan to buy sodas and milk, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sodas and milk, among other things.

loans.name: H.o.p.e - N03T5Ttrung Group

texts.en:
Mạnh is 27 years old and she is married. She has raised poultry for the past 6 years. Mạnh lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family lives in a village and her household is low-income. The market demand for poultry is low in her region. Also, the income from this business is unstable due to the possibility of poultry disease, which can cause her poultry to die and leave her with nothing to sell. This results in financial hardship. Mạnh's main challenge is lack of capital, so she is requesting a loan to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Mạnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mạnh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of "H.O.P.E - N03T5TTrung", which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Mạnh hopes to buy land of her own, to provide for her kids, and to support her family's health and happiness.

loans.use: to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has been running a her retail store for three years. She's earning well, and she was able to sustain her daily needs in working this business. With her generated income, she was able to pay her previous loan used for the business successfully.

Improving her business is easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more useful items to meet the needs of her customers in their local community. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more useful items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married, and has 3 children aged 8, 6 and 2. He has 1 additional dependent, to help him educate to tertiary level.  In 2010, Ibrahim established his used clothing business. He began his business to be self-employed.   His business is located in city center and his main customers are the general public.   Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL850000 every month from this business.   He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5000000.  Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy more 3 bales of used clothing for resale.   He hopes that this loan will help to maximize profit. . In the future, Ibrahim plans to be able to educate his children and help other family members.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more 3 bales of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Gelly

texts.en:
Gelly is 40 years old. She is married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living, she engaged in a buy-and-sell business. She buys useful items that will help and can be used by her loyal customers.

She wants to increase and expand her business, and now another opportunity was presented to her. With the help of GDMPC, she took a loan to buy more helpful items to sell to her customers.

In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy useful items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nodari

texts.en:
Nodari, who is 53 years old temporarily unemployed man, lives in village Mukhrani. He has wife, son and daughter-in-law. His wife and son are employed and get fixed salary. In order to make his bit to the family's welfare and get some income, Nodari decided to be involved in serving activity and start providing taxi business.

He lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 2800 GEL and start taxi business. He will purchase a car and will start working as a driver and serve local people. Nodari will get the chance to generate his own income and cover some family-costs on his own.

This credit will be a great support for the family. Noari is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start providing taxi business.

loans.name: Sao Ny's Group

texts.en:
Sao Ny is 42 years old, living in Kratie province and a married mother of three children, two son and one daughter.

She earns a living through cassava growing while her husband works as a paid worker to support the family. She has been in this business for 24 years and the current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to feed the family.

The price of her cassava is decreasing, and that is the main challenge for her business.

Sao Ny is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three who live in the same village to seek a loan. Sao Ny, who is the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his father and wife.
Together with his father, Narek runs a food market in the center of Vanadzor town. They have already been involved in this business for more than 10 years and working hard to sustain their store. They provide large variety of products in their store for customers.

Narek has applied for this loan to purchase new food supplies for selling in the store. He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Narek to be able to continue his business and sustain his family's business.

loans.use: to pay for new food supplies for selling in the store

loans.name: Bakoye Group

texts.en:
This group is called biakoye and has 5 members (all women) from the city of Accra, Teshie. The women are working hard to have better access to the capital, and to be able to give their families a better life. They are selling second hand clothing, cook bean and ripe plantain, grocery, ladies dress and hair dressing service.

Elizabeth is representing this group. She has been selling grocery for 6 years and have been very successful. Elizabeth is very good at what she does and has a large customer base as a result. Elizabeth is very hard-working and is fighting to move forward and help her family. She is married with two children andthe children are in school. This is her second loan from kiva and forth with ID-Ghana.

Elizabeth is applying for this loan in order to buy more grocery (rice, eggs, sugar, Milk, Milo and sardine) for her business, and thereby continue expanding it. She can thus give her family everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy more grocery (rice, eggs, sugar, Milk, Milo and sardine) for her business, and thereby continue expanding it.

loans.name: Radjin

texts.en:
Radjin is 49 years old, divorced, lives with his mother and a school- aged child in his ancestral home.
He does rice cultivation on a land of 10 hectares (leased land) and has a small tractor for his own use. In his spare time, Radjin works for others on the field. This gives him an extra income for his family. Radjin lacks finances for purchasing inputs for his rice production and applied for a loan of SRD 6.000.

loans.use: To purchase inputs for his rice production like diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Chiquito

texts.en:
Chiquito has been involved in business activities since 2013. He started with his own working capital of $500.

He is taking a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin. He will use the loan to buy additional supplies including cigarettes, biscuits, cooking oils, milk, detergent, noodles, sweets, pens, and other things to sell.

He is very happy when Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to him because he can use this loan to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies including cigarettes, biscuits, cooking oils, milk, detergent, noodles, sweets, pens, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Shanda Group

texts.en:
The beautiful, high quality products of Mercy have made her a well known tailor in her neighbourhood. She sews bed linen, curtains, sofa covers, scatter cushions and aprons. She lives in Waterfalls, a suburb in Harare. The consistency in quality of her products has made more people to be loyal to her. She aims to improve her business and develop it into a one-stop shop for all interior decoration needs.

Mercy is a mother of three children and a grandmother of four. She believes that working hard and being passionate about what you do is the answer for a better life for her family. She is a member of the Shanda Group, which consists of her other four colleagues who are also active in their businesses. Thrive Microfinance has managed to train them on group dynamics and effective financial management. Currently, Mercy is seeking a loan amounting $500 to help her buy more materials to sew her products. As a group, they are looking forward to a $1850 loan from Kiva to help them finance expansion of their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Airin

texts.en:
Airin is a married woman living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a motorcycle transport business. It is her main source of income and it is doing very well. She has become more interested in this kind of business because it is very profitable.

Airin wants to buy another motorcycle for her transport business. She has 2,000,000 UGX cash but lacks 800,000 UGX to get the full installment and buy a motorcycle. She is requesting money to buy another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.use: to buy a another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Dream It, Do It - N10T4Đminh Group

texts.en:
Đấu is 46 years old and she is married with 3 children. Đấu has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Her family lives in a village and is low-income. The market demand in this region is low and the income from her business is unstable because the price and quantity of fish depends on weather conditions. One of her most critical business challenges is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

This is Đấu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her standard of living. Đấu is the group leader of "Dream It, Do It - N10T4ĐMinh", which consists of 6 members. With her business profit, Đấu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sorayda

texts.en:
Sorayda, 49, is married and has six children, one of whom is still in school. For the past five years she has earned a living in the Philippines by buying and selling rice.

Sorayda has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell. She is saving her money to apply toward building up her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 62 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Narcisa has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Narcisa has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sumac Maki Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC MAKI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Deysi ella es casada y tiene 31 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Sumac Maki communal bank. It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Deysi is 31 years old and is married with 3 children. She works in her crafts business. She sells knit items, sweaters, blankets and woven items. She sells different woven items. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She has worked in this business for 8 years, and it is going very well.

She seeks a loan to buy knit items, sweaters and woven items. The other borrowers work at a business selling clothes, a business selling crafts, a grocery store business and a restaurant business. Deysi thanks those who take part in her dream in this way, and promises to comply with the required payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy knit items, sweaters and woven items.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 37 years old and he lives in Tuguegarao. He is single and runs a transport business as his source of income. Rolando hopes to continue to provide safe travel to all his passengers, so he is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy gasoline and pay for motorcycle maintenance. He hopes to improve his services to increase profits and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for his transport business.

loans.name: Armo

texts.en:
Armo is from Agarak town and lives with his wife. Their two children are grown up and live separately.

For three more years, Armo has been involved in reselling eggs. He purchases eggs directly from factories and resells in local food stores of Agarak town. Armo works hard to run a successful business and gather income for his family.

He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Armo to be able to continue his business and sustain his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for eggs (10,000), packages for eggs, and renovation of the car to transport to store and sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jorge Isaac

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre soltero con 20 años de edad, luego de quedarse sin empleo por varios meses, comenzó a trabajar en la cría y venta de  animales como cerdos y pollos, con esto ha logrado un gran avance, las ganancias son invertidas en sus estudios y aporta en su casa para la compra de alimentos.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar cerdos, alimento y medicamentos para los mismos.

Su meta es continuar trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su actual estado no es el mejor para habitarla.

La actividad que realiza este hombre para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y lo hacen merecedor de ayuda que solicita.
texts.en:
Jorge is a single 20-year old man. After being without a job for several months, he began to work in breeding and selling animals such as pigs and chickens. With this, he has achieved big progress. The earnings are invested into his studies and support his house to buy food. He works every day for 8 hours a day.

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy pigs, food and medicine for the pigs. His goal is continue working to improve the conditions of his house, since it was built a long time ago and its current state is not the best to be living in.

The work that this man does to be able to survive on his own is worthy of applause and makes him deserve the help he is asking for.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food and medicine for the pigs.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 39-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children in the Lahore area of Pakistan. Her husband works as a rickshaw driver in Lahore City, which is a very populated area. A few days ago he got into a road accident; he standing on the roadside looking for passengers, when a speeding car collided with the back of the rickshaw. He did not get any fractures but the rickshaw was seriously damaged and he needs to buy new one. Her son will help with the cost of a new rickshaw body, but he cannot cover the full amount.

Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw and can compensate for losses from the accident. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband so he can compensate for losses from an accident.

loans.name: Grupo Marquencitas Group

texts.es:
(La primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) Ester es casada de 34 años de edad, con una linda familia  que vive en una comunidad denominada el barrio ll de san marcos la laguna, tiene tres hijos de las edades entre 1 y 9 años, Ester con el afán de darle a su familia lo mejor desde hace 3 años trabaja como cocinera en un hotel que se ubica en su comunidad, pero también cuenta con un negocio propio de venta de pasteles  y todo tipo de materiales de repostería.  Ester tiene la ventaja de contar con la confianza de  sus clientes y por esa razón ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de más materiales de repostería  tales como; harina, huevos, panqueques entre otros, con esta inversión ella espera poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
Ester anhela algún día contra con su propio restaurante  para mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ester (the first to the left side of the photo) is 34-years old and married. She has a beautiful family who lives in a community called El Barrio II de San Marcos La Laguna. She has 3 children between the ages of 1-9 years old. With the aim of giving her family the best, 3 years ago Ester started working as a cook in a hotel located in her community. She also has her own business selling cakes and all types of baking materials.

Ester has the advantage of having the confidence of her customers and for that reason she is asking for a loan to buy more baking materials like flour, eggs, pancakes, and others. With this investment, she hopes to be able to better satisfy the needs of her customers. Ester longs to one day have her own restaurant to improve her income and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy baking materials like flour, eggs, and pancakes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for making cleaning products.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Natividad continua con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su comida a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, papas, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Los Angeles" ("The Angels"). The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member Natividad continues her food sales business. She is a responsible and persevering person. Natividad continues selling food to her clientele. As it is through these means that the member provides for her family, she is very thankful for the loan and she promises to complete the loan payments according to the payment schedule.

Natividad asks for the loan to buy oil, potatoes, meats, etc.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, meat, etc.

loans.name: Friendship - 02Thảihthanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lọc is 62 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has had a retail business trading scrap metal for more than 10 years. Lọc lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover this region often sufferes from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. So, it is really hard for them to cover the life cost and save money. The main hardship that Lọc faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more scrap metal to resell.

In 2008, Lọc joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lọc has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Friendship - 02THảiHThanh", which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Lọc hopes to maintain a successful business, to build a new house, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal to resell

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en el área de mantenimiento de un turicentro, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo 1 vive con ellos en casa y es la única persona que depende económicamente de ella.

Paula, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde en su casa desde hace 5 años y aprendió este trabajo atravez de un programa que llego a su comunidad, al no tener otra actividad que realizar más que los oficios domésticos de su hogar, decidió dedicarse a este negocio para ayudar a mantener a su familia, anteriormente había tenido venta de pupusas pero donde ella vive esta retirado del centro del caserío y no pudo mantenerse con esta actividad, en todas las etapas de la granja y la venta le ayuda su hijo y en sus tiempos libres su esposo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar de más pollos, concentrado, vitaminas, vacuna, granza y medicina para la crianza de pollos, lo cual mejorará sus ingresos y su calidad de vida al incrementar sus ventas.

Paula, desea seguir con su granja de pollo de engorde para ayudar en su hogar y conseguir que su hijo termine sus estudios y se convierta en un profesional.
texts.en:
Paula is 47 years old. She went to school until the ninth grade. She is married, and her husband works in maintenance at a tourist center. She has 3 children, one of whom lives at home with them, and is her only dependent.

Paula has had a broiler chicken farm at her home for 5 years. She learned this trade from a program in her community. Since she had no job other than taking care of her family, she decided to work at this trade to help support her family. Previously she had sold pupusas, but she lives a distance from the center of town and wasn't able to support herself with that job. Her son helps her in all areas of farming and sales, and her husband helps in his spare time.

The loan will be used to buy chickens, concentrated food, vitamins, vaccines, pellets and medicine for raising the chickens. This will improve her income and her quality of life, as sales increase. Paula hopes to continue with her broiler chicken farm in order to help out at home and ensure that her son finish school and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, concentrated food, vitamins, vaccines, pellets and medicine.

loans.name: Work Hard, Dream Big - Bsơnhphụ Group

texts.en:
Duy is 48 years old, married and has one child. She lives in Hoang Hoa, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is also the group leader of the "Work hard, dream big - BSơnHPhụ" group, which consists of seven members.

For more than ten years Duy has earned a modest income selling fish from her food stall. She faces certain problems, though, in that the market need for fish is low in this region and her income is unstable, as it is dependent on unpredictable weather conditions. For Duy, then, her main business difficulty is a lack of capital.

In 2010 Duy joined Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to access its loans, and she has taken out and successfully repaid five prior loans. She is now applying for a 80,000,000 VND loan to be apportioned among her group members. She will use her share to buy another fishing net.

With her profits Duy hopes to maintain a successful and prosperous business and be able to buy more supplies and equipment for fishing.

loans.use: to buy another fishing net.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married and she is a business woman. Every day she sees all the women are always dependent on their husbands. One day she thought to help her husband, so that her husband could feel a lighter burden to be responsible for the household. So, she began to open her business with her own working capital of $100.00. She has been involvied in business activities since 2013 and she makes her best of it.

She started with a small store so she is requesting a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy additional items to keep in her store including aqua, noodles, biscuits, candies, cooking oils, shampoo, hand and body soap and other things to sell. She will improve her management for her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy aqua, noodles, biscuits, candies, cooking oils, shampoo, and other things to sell.

loans.name: True Power - N09Kp5Đsơnbsơn Group

texts.en:
Hương is 56 years old and married with two children. 
She has had a manufacturing business, making wood furniture for more than 10 years.
Hương lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in her village and the market need is low in this region.
It is not easy to run this business because this job needs much capital and the carpenter must be really skillful. 
The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood for making chairs, tables, wardrobes,..etc...
In 2014, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the leader of the True Power -N09KP5ĐSơnBSơn Group which consists of three members.
With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase wood for making chairs, tables, wardrobes, etc.

loans.name: No Pressure, No Diamonds - N05Kp3Bsơnbsơn Group

texts.en:
Hợi is 64 years old and married with one child. 
She has had a retail business, selling dry food and general things for two years.
Hợi lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in her village and the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hợi faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase display cases and other furnishings for her business and more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.
In 2014, Hợi joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hợi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the leader of the No Pressure, No Diamonds - N05KP3BSơnBSơn Group which consists of five members.
With her business profit, Hợi hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase display cases and other furnishings for her business and more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: La Corona Group

texts.es:
Dentro de una pequeña comunidad dentro del Estado de México se integró en grupo llamado La Corona. Todos los miembros tienen las características que distinguen a su pueblo: son amables, trabajadores y muy alegres. La mayor parte de los habitantes se dedica al cultivo de maíz pues la tierra es muy rica en nutrientes. 
   Doña Juana es una persona quien siempre está sonriendo y su esfuerzo en el trabajo le ha brindado muchas recompensas encaminadas a cuidar de su hijo ya que es madre soltera. Desde hace 25 años decidió iniciar con la venta de ropa, anteriormente vendía artículos de fantasía sin embargo el dueño del local adyacente le ofreció comprar el lugar y ella acepto. Actualmente, con base en mucho esfuerzo, construyó paredes, azotea y colocó cortinas para implementar la venta de ropa. 
   Todos los días se le puede encontrar trabajando en el mercado municipal y siempre trata de ofrecer la mejor variedad de mercancía para complacer a sus clientes. Hasta el día de hoy su negocio ha despegado de tal manera que cuenta con clientela muy segura. Por lo anterior mencionado, sus ventas son muy buenas y con ellas puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Aunque es verdad que tiene competencia, se siente muy confiada ya que su calidad y variedad resaltan sobre los demás comerciantes.
Por otro lado, se encuentra muy agradecida con los préstamos que VFMéxico le ha ofrecido pues todos ellos los ha invertido para fortalecer su negocio, esta vez no será la excepción y comprará más ropa nuevamente. "Una de mis metas es hacer crecer mi negocio para seguir apoyando con los gastos de mi hijo aunque ya no estudia quiero lo mejor para él" comentó muy contenta Doña Juana.
   Los otros integrantes son Miguel Ángel y Vicente quienes invertirán en jarcería y Doña Magdalena, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada junto a las ovejas de Magdalena, Doña Juana es quien viste el suéter negro.
texts.en:
Inside a small community inside of the Estado de Mexico, a group called La Corona was formed. All the members have the traits that distinguish their people, that is, they are kind, hardworking, and very cheerful. Most of the citizens work in corn faming, because the land is very rich in nutrients.
Juana is a person who is always smiling and her effort at work has brought her a lot of rewards aimed at taking care of her son, as she is a single mother. Twenty-five years ago she decided to start selling clothing. Previously she sold novelty items, however the owner of the store next door offered to sell her the establishment, and she accepted. Currently, with a lot of effort, she has built walls, a roof, and she placed curtains to start her clothing sales. 
Every day, you can find her working in the municipal market, and she always tries to offer the best variety of merchandise to please her clients. Until today, her business has taken off in such a way that she has a very stable clientele. Because of this, her sales are very good, and with them she can settle some of her household expenses. Although it is true that she has competition, she is very confident, because her quality and variety stand out among the rest of the retailers. 
On the other side, she is very grateful with the loans that VF Mexico has offered her, because she has used all of them to consolidate her business. In this opportunity this will not be the exception and she will buy clothes, again. “One of my goals is to build my business to keep helping with the expenses or my son, although he no longer studies, I want the best for him,” said Juana.
The other members are Miguel Angel and Vincent, who will invest in cleaning equipment, and Magdalena, in sheep. 
*The picture was taken next to Magdalena’s sheep.
Juana is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 61 years old, married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eliza has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Eliza requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Eliza has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Eliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: Maria es soltera con tres hijos y 33 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura produciendo yuca, platano, naranja, cria de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes ella tiene el sueño de tener una estabilidad economica y le gusta a descanzar
texts.en: Maria, thirty-three years of age, is single with three children. She works in agriculture, growing yucca, plantains, oranges and she raises pigs. She asks for a loan to buy compost and fertilizers. She dreams of having economic stability. She enjoys resting.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Saquilla Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango, a city in western Guatemala, is a place well known for its colorful clothing and its bustling market. It is home to Mayan people from many different places, who speak the indigenous Maya language Kiché. 

Maria is a 21-year-old young woman on her second disbursement with Kiva. She was able to study through 5th grade in primary school and is now married, with 3 children. To support her family, she runs a successful business selling shoes for women, which are distributed within and outside of the  city. Maria is requesting a loan in order to increase the shoe inventory. She will buy different shoe styles, sizes, and brands. For extra income, in a similar manner she also buys and sells “cortes” (traditional Guatemalan skirts) in the town plaza, and sells pigs and chickens which she raises at home.

The Saquilla group of women is very happy working with investors who provide their businesses with the opportunity to generate greater profits, and allow the women the chance to gain knowledge of investment and saving through the monthly sessions they attend.

loans.use: to increase the shoe inventory.

loans.name: Mujeres Comprometidas Group

texts.en:
A very verdant and natural area in Guatemala’s northwest is the state of Huehuetenango considered one of the most beautiful in the country with its mountains throughout.  It has a variety of temperatures depending upon the time of year from hot, to temperate, to chilly.  The Maya here, both women and men, are well-known for wearing their traditional and colorful clothing. 

Nine women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Comprometidas” or “Committed Women” to empower themselves, increase their earnings, conserve their heritage, send their children to school and take care of their homes. This is a daily commitment they have made to themselves, their families and their community.Maria is 48 years old and has a productive business selling clothing, cosmetics and shoes in her very own shop. Her business has been successful for her and provides an income to maintain her household and send her four children to school all the way through the university.  Several are now professionals which makes her quite proud.  She is requesting a new loan to increase her inventory and buy more clothing, cosmetics and shoes.  

The ladies of the Trust Bank share that they have formed a real bond with each other. They feel valued, included and are so appreciative of the opportunity to support each other. They feel that their objectives are within reach and are committed to continue to pour energy into their businesses and themselves.  They want to see their community prosper with additional businesses and increased revenue. The women forge ahead on a daily basis selling cosmetics, clothing and shoes by catalogue as well as tortillas and books. One member has a convenience store while another has a pharmacy.The ladies are all so appreciative of the opportunity to secure a loan, empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. Kiva lenders are most appreciated in this effort. Thank you!

loans.use: to increase her inventory and buy more clothing, cosmetics and shoes to sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, lleva este nombre ya que sus integrantes buscan renacer en las actividades que hacen para mejorar sus vidas y ayudar a sus familias, se encuentran trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Nilda solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bebidas variadas para la venta, como ser vinos, gaseosas, cervezas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio de venta de bebidas. Nilda es una mujer muy trabajadora, reconocida en el grupo por su buena predisposición y positivismo en las actividades que hace. Está contenta por integrar este grupo y por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group named "Renacer" (To Revive) is in its third loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. The members chose this name because they are looking to boost their businesses so that they can improve their lives and those of their families. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program.

Sra. Nilda is requesting a loan in order to buy various beverages to sell such as wine, sodas, beer, and other products. This will allow her to continue her beverage sales business. Nilda is a hardworking woman and is known in her group for her pleasant disposition and positive attitude in all of her activities. She is pleased to be part of this group and is grateful to have this opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy wine, sodas, beer, and other products.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife has received financial support through Kiva numerous times and has never failed to repay her loans on time. Those loans have certainly helped sustain her store and support her child's schooling. Education is the top priority of her budget because it is her child's path to success.

Florife seeks a 40,000 PHP loan to restock her grocery store with items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles which she sells at retail. She values her  business as a major source of income to provide for her family's needs. Although there are times she encounters difficulty collecting her receivables, she maintains her faith and perseverance that she can get through life.

Florife's dream is to expand her small business into a big grocery store so she can acquire a lot and live a more comfortable life in her senior years. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Loma Bonita Group

texts.es:
Don Pedro es una persona criada en el campo por lo que su dedicación al trabajo es una característica que comparte con sus vecinos. De igual forma, siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a quien lo necesita y este valor lo ha transmitido a toda su familia integrada por su esposa Maribel y sus cinco hijos.
   Desde hace treinta años se ha dedicado a las ventas de artículos para habitación como almohadas, colchas, sabanas y edredones. Para él las ventas son una pasión y ofrece su mercancía de puerta en puerta; al inicio sólo cerca de su localidad y actualmente en comunidades aledañas. No obstante, desde hace 18 años adquirió un local en donde exhibe su mercancía, “ahora, con mi puesto seguro, no me canso y los clientes pueden observar mejor los productos” comentó. 
   Sin embargo, para dar variedad a su negocio, ha decidido adquirir productos de bisutería y artículos de papelería ya que en esta temporada son muy solicitados entre los alumnos de las distintas escuelas. La inversión inicial la piensa realizar con el préstamo solicitado a VFMéxico por lo que se encuentra muy entusiasmado y alegre. 
   Afortunadamente cada vez que inicia con una actividad obtiene buenos resultados a pesar de la competencia que suele aparecer. Por ahora su principal meta es trabajar más fuerte para continuar ayudando a su hija con el objetivo de que se gradué como educadora deportiva. Una meta secundaria es cultivar la extensión de tierra que conserva,  “son  tres hectáreas y cuando me toca sembrar, regar, cosechar o cualquier otra actividad son gastos fuertes para mí” dijo. 
   Al igual que Don Pedro los otros integrantes de su grupo se encuentran contentos con los beneficios del crédito. Ellos son: Martha Lilia quien invertirá en productos de jarcería; Catalina, en bonetería y mercería e Isain en productos plásticos. Cabe mencionar que todos viven en una comunidad muy tranquila del Estado de México, llena de vegetación y panorámicamente inigualable ya que es adornada por arboles enormes.
* La fotografía fue tomada en el quiosco del municipio, Don Pedro es quien viste el chaleco negro.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is a person who was raised in the fields. Because of that his profession is a characteristic that he shares with his neighbors. Likewise, he is always ready to help whoever needs it and he has passed on this value to his whole family, which includes his wife Maribel and his five children.

For the past 30 years, he has earned a living by selling bedroom items such as pillows, bedspreads, sheets, and quilts. To him, selling is a passion and he offers his merchandise from door to door, initially only close to his town and now in adjoining communities. However, 18 years ago he acquired a shop where he displays his merchandise. "Now, with my secure stand, I do not become tired and the clients can better see the products," he said.

To diversify his business, however, he has decided to acquire costume jewelry products and stationary because in this season they are often requested by students from the various schools. He plans to fulfill the initial investment with the loan requested from VFMexico, through which he has become very enthusiastic and happy.

Fortunately, every time he begins a business, he gets good results in spite of the competition that appears. For now, his principal goal is working harder to continue helping his daughter with the objective of graduating as a sports teacher. A secondary goal is cultivating the stretch of land he looks after. "There are 3 hectares and when it is my turn to sow, water, harvest, or any other activity, they are great expenses for me," he said.

Like Don Pedro, the other group members are content with the benefits of the loan. They are: Martha Lilia, who will invest in cleaning products; Catalina, in sewing supplies and haberdashery; and Isain is in plastic products. It is fitting to mention that they all live in a peaceful community in the State of Mexico, filled with vegetation and panoramas that are unparalleled because it is adorned with enormous trees.

*The photograph was taken at the municipal pavilion. Don Pedro is the one wearing the black vest.

loans.use: to acquire costume jewelry products and stationary

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 48 years old and married with six children, two in school. Norlita is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Norlita has a buy-and-sell seashell business in the Philippines. Norlita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seashells to sell.

Norlita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Norlita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seashells to sell.

loans.name: Danica

texts.en:
Danica is 24 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Danica has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Danica requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Danica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana opened a small grocery shop in Timor-Leste a few years ago with her own money. She did so because she doesn’t want the household to be overly dependent on her husband’s income for its maintenance.

Ana has applied for a 1,000 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Tuba Rai Metin to buy more groceries to sell, such as sardines, milk, noodles, candles, biscuits, eggs, salt, soft and hard drinks and other things to sell. Because she lives near a well-populated area, she has plans to open a bigger store that will keep in stock merchandise according to her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Life Goes On - N02Kp7Đsơnbsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phúc is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has operated a food stall selling noodles for more than 10 years. Phúc lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Phúc faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment like tables, chairs and materials for cooking.

In 2014, Phúc joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phúc has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "Life goes on - N02KP7ĐSơnBSơn", which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Phúc hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment like tables, chairs and materials for cooking.

loans.name: El Rincón Group

texts.es:
En una pequeña comunidad mexiquense se formó el grupo El Rincón, todos los miembros consideran a su lugar de origen una zona rica en cultura y recursos naturales. La mayor actividad productiva es la ganadería y agricultura. En cuanto conocieron la oportunidad que tendrían con VFMéxico se entusiasmaron ya que necesitaban un impulso así para mejorar sus actividades.
   Don Felipe es un hombre muy entusiasta conoce y realiza distintas actividades como la albañilería, plomería, herrería y cría de ganado. Sin embargo, guarda un especial cariño al trabajo de la tierra y él mismo se considera un “hombre de campo”. Actualmente es viudo y tiene tres hijos los cuales son independientes.
   Con el beneficio del préstamo decidió que invertiría en la cría de distintos animales ya que desea aumentar su producción, esta vez invertirá específicamente en borregos. La cría puede durar varios meses ya que obtiene los animales desde muy pequeños para asegurar su sano crecimiento y brindar la mejor calidad a sus clientes. “Normalmente se los ofrezco a los carniceros o a las personas que realicen alguna fiesta” comentó Don Felipe quien tiene clientela dentro y fuera de su localidad. En cuanto a las aves de corral, se enorgullece en contar con los mejores ejemplares en pavos los cuales son muy pedidos para navidad; de igual modo sus gallinas producen una cantidad plausible de huevos con lo que incrementa sus ingresos. Por ahora su meta es ahorrar lo suficiente para cuando decida retirarse ya que, cuando llegue el momento, podrá dedicarse a una actividad que requiera menos esfuerzos.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son José quien invierte en sabanas, cobertores etc., y Hortensia, en borregos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras justo en el centro del municipio, Don Felipe es quien viste la sudadera gris.
texts.en:
In a small Mexican community, the group "El Rincón" ["The Corner"] was formed. Each of the members consider their birthplace to be a zone rich in culture and natural resources. The major productive activity is ranching and agriculture. When they found out about the opportunity they could have with VFMexico, they were excited because they needed a catalyst to improve their activities.

Don Felipe is a very enthusiastic man. He knows and carries out distinct activities such as construction, plumbing, iron work, and cattle breeding. Nevertheless, he has a special affection for working on the earth and he considers himself a "man of the field." He is currently a widower and has 3 children who are independent.

With the benefits of this loan, he decided to invest in raising different animals because he wants to increase his production. This time, he will invest specifically in sheep. The raising can take several months because he obtains the animals when they are very small to ensure their healthy growth and to provide the best quality to his clients. "I normally offer the animals to butchers or to people who are having a party," said Don Felipe, who has clients in and outside his town. When there are birds in the pen, he is proud to have the best examples of turkeys which are ordered a lot for Christmas. Likewise, his hens produce a reasonable quantity of eggs with which he grows his income. For now, his goal is to save enough for when he decides to retire, so that when that moment arrives he will be able to make a living with an activity that requires less effort.

The other members of the group are José, who invests in sheets, blankets, etc., and Hortensia who works with sheep.

*The photograph was taken on the stairs exactly in the center of the municipality. Don Felipe is the one wearing a gray sweatshirt.

loans.use: to buy sheep

location.town: Santa Cruz, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: La Piña Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México residen personas muy alegres y especialmente muy trabajadoras; gran parte de la población se dedica a la cría de animales y al cultivo de maíz. Las tradiciones son importantes para ellos pues muchos preservan rasgos de la cultura indígena mazahua. 
   Irene es una joven alegre, amable y sus ganas de superarse son dignas de admiración. La motivación más grande en su vida son sus dos pequeños hijos a quienes planea brindar la mejor educación y cuidados.
   Gracias al apoyo de su suegra inició con la cría de ganado pues es un negocio con el que se obtienen ganancias favorables una vez que se venden los animales. Es necesario que los crie desde muy pequeños para que, de esta manera, esté al corriente de su sano crecimiento; si se llegaran a enfermar, ella cuenta con un veterinario de cabecera ya que su objetivo es brindar la mejor calidad a sus clientes. Del mismo modo beneficia a su comunidad ya que adquiere las crías con personas de su misma región y, llegado el momento, éstos la recomiendan con personas a quienes les vende el producto final. 
   Por otro lado, está muy agradecida porque esta es la segunda vez que puede obtener un crédito, “con mi nuevo préstamo comprare tres ovejitas y más alimento, aunque también aprovecho la hierba que me ofrece el campo” comentó muy alegre Irene. Una de sus metas es comprar un terreno en donde pueda construir una casa propia, ya que por el momento vive en casa de su suegra, y refiere: “deseo dejar un patrimonio estable a mis hijos para el día de mañana”. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Doña Martha quien invertirá en  becerros; María Engracia, en bordados artesanales y Doña Candelaria, en pollos y pavos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en quiosco del municipio, Irene es quien viste el suéter rojo y el pantalón de mezclilla.
texts.en:
In a Mexican community in the State of Mexico, live a very happy and especially hardworking people. A large part of the population makes a living raising animals and cultivating corn. The traditions are important to them in order to preserve as many characteristics of the Mazahua indigenous culture.

Irene is a happy, friendly youth. Her desire to excel is worthy of admiration. Her biggest motivation in her life is her two young children who she plans to provide the best education and care.

Thanks to the help of her mother-in-law she began raising livestock as it is a business that obtains favorable earnings once the animals are sold. It is necessary to raise them from an early age in order to be sure of their healthy growth. If they get sick, she checks with a head veterinarian as her objective is to provide better quality to her customers. Likewise it benefits her community, because the young livestock she acquires with those of the people of her same region, eventually, are recommend by the people who sell the final product.

On the other hand, she is very grateful because this is the second time that she is able to obtain a loan. "With my new loan I will purchase three lambs and more food, but also plants that provide fields," Irene says very happily. One of her goals is to purchase land where she is able to construct her own home, because at the moment she lives in her mother-in-law's home, and she relates: "I wish to leave a stable heritage to my children for tomorrow."

The other group members are Doña Martha who will invest in calves, María Engracia, in artisan embroidery, and Doña Candelaria, in chicken and turkeys.

The photograph was taken in the municipal kiosk. Irene is wearing the red sweater and the denim pants.

loans.use: to purchase three lambs and more food

location.town: San Jeronimo de los Dolores, San Felipe del Progre

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 63 years old and married with five children. 

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.ru: Мариям, 62 года, вдова, воспитала 3 детей. У Мариям - средне-специальное медицинское образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей канцелярскими принадлежностями и сладостями в магазине возле школы. Благодаря упорному труду Мариям, в обороте есть товар на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль составляет от 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мариям обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров (тетрадей, ручек) для продажи в преддверии начала учебного года. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Mariyam is 62 years old. She is a widow who has raised three children. Mariyam has a secondary vocational medical education. She sells stationery supplies and sweets in a shop near a school as the main income for her family. Thanks to Mariyam's hard work, she has goods in stock worth 100,000 som (KGS). Her monthly profit is upwards of 18,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Mariyam has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy goods (exercise books, pens) to sell on the eve of the start of the school year. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of the business.

loans.use: to purchase stationery such as pencils and notebooks for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
José es un hombre casado con 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo con 6 años de edad, se desempeña como criador de cerdos, actividad que aprendió de la mano de su padre y lo que ahora le permite generar recursos para solventar las necesidades del hogar. 
Trabaja toda la semana durante 5 horas.
Su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su labor y aumentar sus ingresos, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de cerdos de engorde y alimento al por mayor.
Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que el actual  estado de esta no es el mejor. 
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de progresar permiten ver en este hombre, unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Jose is a married man, 28 years of age, with a six-year-old son. Jose raises pigs, an activity he learned first hand from his father and that, today, allows him to generate the resources to pay for household necessities.

He works at this task every day of the week, at least five hours per day.

Jose's major desire is to continue to fortify his work and augment his income. That is why he is soliciting a loan, to buy pigs to fatten and, also, to purchase their feed at wholesale.

His dreams are many, but the principal one is to improve the conditions of life in his home, since actual conditions are not the best.

Jose's positive attitude and his desire to progress allow us to see that this man has an immense desire to advance himself and, of course, it also justifies his petition.

loans.use: purchase pigs to fatten and also their feed at wholesale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a farmer who lives with her husband and sons in El Encanto, a land cooperative in Campeche, a Mexican state where there are many communities that lack access to basic services such as electricity. The family has used candles and wood as a light source, which has been harmful for their health due to the smoke produced. 

Zenaida has now applied for a 5,931 MXN loan through Kiva's field partner ERES Energía Renovable to buy a solar energy system to light up her home for the hours after sunset. With the power generated Zenaida´s children will be able to do their homework while she connects to a radio or a fan.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system to light up her home for the hours after sunset.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita lives at Tuguegarao. She is 39 years old, married and had three children. To gain income, she involved herself into direct-selling business offering perfumes, cosmetics and clothes to her customers. Though she gains minimal income in her business, she patiently offers her products to gain income after doing her household chores. She is now asking additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy more products to sell. She will buy soap, cosmetics, perfumes, deodorants and clothes to sell. Carmelita will keep offering good and friendly services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy soap, cosmetics, perfumes, deodorants and clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
Jose tiene 39 años de edad,conviviente, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, con los cuales vive en el sector de Sector de Popan Alto, en una zona rural, en la provincia Chiclayo, Region lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jose se dedica a la actividad de crianza de animales menores con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, tambien se dedica a las labores de servicio agricola solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y comida para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor numero de ventas de animales.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old. He is a live-in partner who has three children in his care. He lives with them in northern coast of Peru in the Popan Alto sector, a rural area in the Chiclayo Province and Lambayeque Region.

Jose works breeding small animals, and he has more than five years experience working in the business. The business is located in his place of residence. He also does work in the agricultural service.

He asks for this loan to buy animals, as well as food for them. This investment will help him to be able to sell a higher number of animals.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of animals.

loans.name: Maria Hamiled

texts.es: Maria Tiene 50 años es casada con 4 hijos, se dedica a la comercializacion y produccion de cacao, platano, naranja, guineo Maria con el dinero lo destinara para comprar abono urea y herraminetas de trabajo para mejorar su productividad, ella quiere tener una buena estabilidad economica y le gusta ver la televicion en sus tiempos libres
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She produces and sells cacao, plantains, oranges, and bananas.

With money from the loan Maria will purchase manure, urea, and work tools, in order to improve her productivity. She wishes to achieve greater economic stability.

During her free time Maria likes to watch television.

loans.use: purchase manure, urea, and tools for farm work.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is 55 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lory has a vehicle repair shop business in the Philippines. Lory requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy tools and equipment for her vehicle repair shop.

Lory has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her vehicle repair shop.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 42 years old, married with two children. Both of her children are enrolled in school.

Marianita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marianita has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 12 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Marianita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 56 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is in school. Lani is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lani has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lani has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 49 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school. Mila is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mila has a manicure business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her manicure business.

Mila has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her manicure business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is applying for a loan of $1,000.  Her life is usefull to her business.  She has a kiosk  and she is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including noodles, coffee, cooking oils, detergents, sugar, candy and other things to sell.  She started her business in 2013 with a working capital of $800. With this loan she hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including noodles, coffee, cooking oils, detergents, sugar, candy and other things to sell.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta lives in Same. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop in the center of the market so many people come to buy at it. Augusta has been involved in business activities since in 2001. She started with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income from selling shoes so she is still happy to do her business. She is selling shoes and she also sells clothes, bags and other things. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more merchandise including shoes, clothes, bags and other things to sell.

loans.use: to add more merchandise including shoes, clothes, bags and other things to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercia y ganaderia mayormente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, Region lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Teresa tiene una bodega donde ofrece abarrotes,bebidas, y marcianos, su negocio se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes en general y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 64 years old. She lives with her husband in a rural area of Oyotun. Its residents work primarily in agriculture, business, and cattle raising. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the norther coast of Perú.

Teresa has a small store in which she sells groceries, drinks and popsicles. Her business is in her home. She seeks a loan to buy groceries in general, in order to grow her business to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Challenge Accepted - N03Kp7Đsơnbsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cấn is 57 years old, and she is married with one child. Cấn lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has a manufacturing business and has been manufacturing and selling machinery for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household. Moreover, the capital required to invest in this sector is large and the competition among rivals is strong. So she has to offer a reasonable price to attract customers. The main hardship that Cấn faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her business process.

In 2014, Cấn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Cấn has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "Challenge accepted - N03KP7ĐSơnBSơn", which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Cấn hopes for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business process.

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en:
Jolinda is 58 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jolinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Jolinda has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Urpi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth Nery ella es casada y tiene 41 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de editorial de graficos,la socia realiza trabajos como tarjetas de cumpleaños,carteles entre otros trabajos,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ditorial de graficos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tintas de colores ,cartulinas y papeles.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de fotocopiadora.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the URPI communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. Elisabeth Nery is 41 years old and married. She has a graphic design business. She makes birthday cards and signs, among other things. She has several years at this business, and it is going very well. She is a responsible, very hardworking person, who through her business is moving her family forward.

Her dream is to expand her graphic design business. She seeks a loan to buy colored ink, poster board and paper. The other borrowers work in a restaurant business, clothing sales business, grocery store business, and photocopy business. The borrower thanks those who take part in her dream in this manner, and promises to comply with the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy colored ink, poster board and paper.

loans.name: Stand In Faith - N04Kp3Bsơnbsơn Group

texts.en:
Hân, 60, is married and has two children. The family lives in Bim Son, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. She is also the leader of the "Stand In Faith - N04KP3BSơnBSơn" group, which consists of five members.

For the past ten years Hân has earned a modest income raising pigs. She faces some problems, though, in that the market for pigs is low in this region. Her income is unstable because if pigs catch some disease, they could die and leave her with nothing to sell. For Hân, her main business concern is her lack of capital.

In 2014 Hân joined Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to access its loans, and she has taken out and successfully repaid two prior loans. She is now applying for a 75,000,000 VND loan to be apportioned among her group members. She will use her share to buy pig food and baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Hân’s desire is for her business to do well and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy pig food and baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita, 41, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. For the past thirteen years she has woven and sold nipa (a type of palm) for roofing in the Philippines.

Amelita has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more nipa and other materials needed for her roofing business. She works hard in order to be able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more nipa and other materials for her roofing business.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with eight children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past one year, selling goat meat to the neighbors. Disease outbreak is a major challenge for the business she is in.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and produce meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and produce meat for resale.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg  is engaged in the manufacturing and repair of furniture in Geghanist village. 

He lives with his retired parents, wife Heghine and their two children: son Arman, and daughter Mariam. 
Gevorg sells his works mainly in nearby villages, but very often receives orders as well. 
He has now applied for this loan to purchase materials necessary for furniture production and renovation of the car needed for transportation of final product to customer. 
Gevorg has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for him to be able to continue his business, cover current orders and gather income for his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for materials necessary for furniture production and renovation of the car needed for transportation of final product to customer

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and mother in Gurjaani district. Zurab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a vineyard and produces wine for selling. This is the only source of income for his family.

As the income is only seasonal and not enough for covering all kind of family expenses Zurab decided to start additional business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 4000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase sheep and will start producing cheese to sell and generate income. Zurab is very hardworking man and will do his best to increase family income and improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and start producing cheese to generate income

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is talented baker from Masis town.
In her house, she cooks different types of cookies, birthday and wedding cakes. She receives orders from local people in the town and works hard to satisfy her customers.
Hermine works in her house, and dreams of having a workshop and enlarging her production volume.

She has now applied for this loan to ask lenders support her with renovation works to build a workshop for her bakery business. Hermine wants to build her workshop near her house, so she will be able to be near to her three little children and husband.

She has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Hermine to make her dream to come true and she truly hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation works to build a workshop for her bakery business

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is a 29-year-old married mother of one child. She works hard to support her family. She is a housewife. Even though the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of her brother’s education.

This loan of $1000 will allow Flaviana to send her brother Romeo to postsecondary school. She will use the loan to pay for registration and other expenses for him.

Flaviana loves her brother very much, and hopes that further education will help him to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for postsecondary registration and other expenses for her brother.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is 38 years old. He is married, has six children, and supports two independents. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 10 years. Right now his monthly income is KSH 7,000.

Micah is borrowing a loan of KSH 30,000 to purchase more animal feeds for milk production for sale as well as to meet family needs. This is his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya. His hopes and dreams for future is to educate his children, to open another business, and to create job opportunities for the community.

loans.use: buy animal feed

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is a married woman with ten children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Nadzuwa has operated a milk selling business for the past two years, selling to the neighbours. She mentioned seasonality as a problem in her business.

With this loan she is requesting Nadzuwa wants to purchase stocks of milk for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: buy milk to sell

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
37-year-old Ephraim is an agricultiuralist, who does crop farming and animal husbandry, but on a small scale. He is married and has three children who attend school. Together with his wife, he works on the land to cover the cost of household expenses and school fees.

Ephraim needs a loan to buy compost, pesticides, herbicides etc. so he can grow beans, cabbages and tomatoes for sale. His dream is to provide a good education to his children so that they are well prepared academically.

loans.use: to boost his agricultural business by buying farm inputs.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed, aged 55 years, is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband has been running a tailoring shop for many years. He takes orders from boutique keepers and sews ladies clothing with the help of his son.

Khursheed's husband has been facing tough time due to low income generated source. He cannot do any other business because he is not skillful in any other profession, so he decided to expand his current enterprise. He wants to buy his own over-lock machine for sewing garments and then directly selling to the customers.

Therefore, Khursheed requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy an over-lock machine for sewing garments. She seems happy after receiving the loan and thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy an over-lock machine for her husband's sewing business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
O senhor  Alberto de 36 anos de idade é comerciante, casado é pai de 3 filhos dos todos a estudar no ensino primário sustenta uma cunhada que vive com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo  pretende comprar  acessórios de telemóveis, tais como cartões de memoria, carregadores, celulares, lanternas e flash.
O seu sonho é  crescer no negocio, reforçar também o volume de mercadoria do salão de sua esposa e fazer um talho.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los faz também arrendamento de dependências na sua casa e que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
36-year-old Alberto is a businessman. He is married and the father of three children; all of them go to primary school. He sustains a sister-in-law that lives with him in a house he owns.

He says that he will use the loan to buy accessories for mobile phones, such as memory cards, chargers, mobile phones, flashlights and light bulbs.

His dreams are to expand his business, increase the stock levels of his wife’s salon, and open a butcher’s shop. 

He says that his biggest challenge is the lack of funding. He also rents out rooms at home in order to overcome it. He will apply for more loans in order to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy accessories for mobile phones, such as memory cards, chargers, mobile phones, flashlights and light bulbs.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
