Valentine is 31 years old, is married and surpports four members of the family. She has been running a retail shop for the last two years. Right now, her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She is borrowing KES 30,000 to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking fat and tea leaves for sale to meet the family's needs. She will use the anticipitated profit to repay the loan and to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have wholesale business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to  purchase, sugar, rice, tea leaves and cooking fat for sale to meet the family's needs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 34 years old and married with children. One of her children is in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Rosalie has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed many times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia built her house a few years ago, but her house has not been completed because the money she has is not enough to buy more materials for the house. She has plan to plaster and paint her house, and so she is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house.

She wants to buy more material such as sand, cement, ceramics, paint, a hand brush, roller brushes and other materials to use. She is very happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because with this loan, she can be complete her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, ceramics, paint, a hand brush, roller brushes and other materials to use.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has been doing well in her business which has expanded thanks to previous loans. She is requesting a new loan to buy chairs and tables for her premises.

Mariam hopes to attract more clients with the new face she is giving to her business premises as she aspires to a successful enterprise and family in the future.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her business premises.

loans.name: Migena

texts.en:
From rural southeastern Albania, Migena is a 37-year-old married mother of three children ranging from four to 15 years of age. Lately she has been feeling unwell and needs to see a doctor and undergo some tests. This is why she is requesting this loan from you.

Migena earns an income through agriculture, which she has been involved in since her early twenties. On the land that her family owns she plants potatoes, beans and wheat in large quantities and sells only potatoes and beans; the wheat is kept for family consumption. The annual income from potatoes is about $3800 and from beans $780. For health reasons her husband cannot work or help her in any way; he receives a disability income of $95/month.

loans.use: to pay for a health checkup

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Mère d’un enfant, Améyo est une revendeuse de savons, détergents et de couches bébé qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Améyo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paquets de couches bébé et des cartons de savons afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider son enfant dans son éducation.
texts.en:
Améyo is a married woman aged 32, living in Adidogomé. The mother of one child, Améyo is a small-scale retailer of bars of soap, detergents, and baby diapers who stocks up twice a month at a market and sells her goods out of her house and in nearby districts.

Améyo is asking for this loan to order some packs of diapers and cases of bars of soap so as to cater for the needs of her clients and have considerable financial autonomy to help her child with education expenses.

loans.use: to buy four packs of baby diapers and six cartons of bars of soap.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa’s business activities are agriculture/livestock and also transportation of people. He’s been doing both for about 20 years. Your financial help through this loan will be used to buy wheat seeds for his plantation and two new tires for his little mini-bus.

Most of the rural families secure wheat for their yearly consumption by planting on lands they own and then grinding it in primitive mills that other villagers own. Musa plants wheat and also fodder for the dairy cow he has, from which he sells a baby calf a year and also 15 liters of milk a day at a price of $0.40/liter at a nearby dairy farm.

Musa is a 42-year-old married rural father of a 15-year-old and a 12-year-old.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds & 2 new tires.

loans.name: Pascoela

texts.en:
Pascoela is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business. She lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she still happy to do her business.

Pascoela has been involved in this business since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital of $ 500. When Tuba Rai Metin offered this loan to her, she said with this loan she will improve her management for her business to run a bigger business in the future. She is taking this loan because she wants use to buy more gasoline.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en:
Esperanca has been involving in her business activity since 2014 with her own working capita of $ 300. She is married and she is a business woman. She is an entrepreneur and her business is selling pigs. Her husband also works in agriculture, so he is very supportive in selling the pigs.

Esperanca requested a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more pigs because she wants to change her business onto a big one. She was very happy with the loan offered by the Tuba Rai Metin because she can increase her income in the future.

loans.use: buy more pigs.

loans.name: Akouavi  Félicité

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 52 ans, Akouavi est une femme qui a six enfants à charge. Habitant à Adidogomé, Akouavi prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Kom » sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité. Akouavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et  des cartons de poulets, Akouavi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married and aged 52, Akouavi is a woman who is raising six children. Living in Adidogomé, Akouavi prepares and sells wrapped maize dough called « Kom » under a shed roof in front of her house, wishing to make a good profit.

Akouavi stocks up once a month at the market. So as to order some sacks of maize and cartons of chicken, Akouavi is requesting this loan to pay for her purchase, so that she can earn more income to deal with the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of maize and four cartons of chicken.

loans.name: Eddy Argentina

texts.es: Eddy es una mujer de 36 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de platos típicos, actividad que realiza desde hace 12 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos por su delicioso sabor y precios accesibles. Eddy habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos dos varones de 14 y 11 años de edad y una niña de 17 años de edad. La zona del lavadero de la vivienda de Eddy se encuentra bastante deteriorado, como se observa en la fotografía, además desea instalar agua potable en su vivienda, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, tuberías para instalar agua potable y mejorar el área del lavadero en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eddy is a 26-year-old woman who works selling traditional food, something she has done since she was 12 years old, and through which she has a large amount of customers who request her products for their delicious taste and affordable prices.

Eddy lives with her life partner and three children, two boys ages 14 and 11 and one girl age 17. The washing area in Eddy's home is found to be fairly deteriorated, as can be seen in the photograph. Furthermore, she wishes to install potable water in her home, for which she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: corrugated metal, wood, cement, and pluming to install potable water and improve the washing area of her home.

loans.use: to invest in: corrugated metal, wood, cement, plumbing to install potable water and improve the washing area in her home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 60 years old, and a married mother of three. The husband provides for additional income. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 9 years earning an income of KES 15,000 per month and enjoys her work.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops and the surplus will be used to add a dairy cow for milk production in order to sell to her customers and meet family demands as well. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children. She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops and add a dairy cow for milk production in order to sell to her customers and meet family demands as well.

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
Deborah is a member of the group God's time. She lives together with her husband and she has one child. She started her business with the first loan she got from ID-Ghana.

Deborah and her group are from the city of Accra, Teshie. which is the capital of the country. The area's economy depends mostly on trade and industry. The group members are micro-businesswomen in selling grocery, soft drinks, tea and bread, and second-hand clothing.

Deborah is receiving her 8th loan. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has made good investments. She is currently selling grocery, soft drinks, tea and bread. She is planning to use the new loan to buy more grocery, soft drinks, Milo, milk, bread to prepare Milo and tea which she will sell to her customers. She will save her profits, because she wants to increase her business, pay for her child's fees, and take care of her home. Her favorite pastime is to do business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make Milo and tea to sell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Binti has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With this loan she is requesting Binti wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice & flour to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 54-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children and equally responsible for all of them.

Nasreen belongs to an ultra-poor family and that is why she cannot afford their educational expenses so that most of her children are doing jobs as laborers for daily wages. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides the services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers.

Due to the increase in the price of iron, Nasreen's husband is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business. To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding materials.

Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Nasreen is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding materials for his blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 51-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children, and her son is engaged in a scrap material recycling business.

Her son needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, Zubaida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable Zubaida's son to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can earn a good profit from his recycling business.

Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy scrap material in bulk for her son's recycling business.

loans.name: Afi Elike

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Afi est une revendeuse des bassines et sceaux en plastiques qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de la route. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des unités de bassines et sceaux en plastiques. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Afi va pouvoir épargner et venir en aide à son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Afi is a married woman aged 33 who lives in Adidogomé. Afi sells plastic basins and buckets, and she stocks up once a month at the market, selling her goods under a shed roof beside the road.

Afi is requesting this loan to order some basins and buckets made of plastic. With the profit she will make, Afi is going to put aside savings and help her husband with the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy 15 plastic basins and eight plastic buckets.

loans.name: Ezau

texts.en: Ezau built his home a few years ago with his own working capital. Until now, he has not completed his house because his capital has not been enough. He is requesting a loan of $1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to his capital to buy more materials like paint, hand brushes, brush rollers, bars, windows, doors and other materials to use. He plans to complete his house, and he is very hopeful with this money he can finish completing his house.

loans.use: to buy paint, hand brushes, brush rollers, bars, windows, doors and other materials to use.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en: Ang’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang Province in Cambodia. Ang works as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Voeun's Group

texts.en: Voeun’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Voeun works as farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en: Vat’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie manages a hog raising business. She is also engaged in a retail and direct selling business. Rosemarie sells grocery items such as breads, canned goods, beverages, and rice grain. Rosemarie also sells fish, pork, and chicken. She is already a widow, doing her best to provide her three children with a better way of life. Rosemarie's goal in life is that her youngest child studies and will hold a degree. With this goal in mind, Rosemarie wants to extend the items she is selling. Hence, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more groceries to sell. She will also use the loan to buy meat and fish to sell. Rosemarie will prioritize her child's education through the income she will gain from the business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ardi

texts.en:
Ardi is 33 years old. Since he was in his early 20s Ardi has been operating a little bar/cafe in the city of his residence. 
Ardi got engaged about a year ago and the loan he is requesting will pay the tuition fees of his fiancee, who is studying nursing at a local public university. Ardi still lives with his parents as do a majority of adult children in Albania due to traditions and economic issues. While his father is unemployed, his mother works as a seamstress for a fixed monthly pay of (USD) $240 in addition to the money he makes from the bar/cafe.

loans.use: to pay for his fiancee's university tuition fees

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 50-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Her husband provides welding services in his community. 
He manufactures motorbike spare parts, and doors and windows for houses. He has been providing door-to-door service to weld broken items as well.
Recently, his welding equipment quit working due to overheating and needs to be replaced. He wants to buy new welding equipment but does not have any available cash due to lot of household expenses. 
Therefore, Yasmin has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy welding equipment for his business. Yasmin thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment for her husband's business.

loans.name: Jyoti Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
Sabitri, 30, is the featured borrower of Jyoti Shg A-2. She is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. She is a vegetable vendor by trade and works hard to meet the needs of her family.

Unfortunately, she does not have toilet facilities at her home. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and they fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month.

Therefore, Sabitri, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a new toilet. She will invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, a toilet and pipes to build a toilet and maintain her home and community sanitary.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Jyoti Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
Mina, 47, is the featured borrower of Jyoti Shg A-1 and is standing in the middle in the photograph. Mina has a family of four. She understands the importance of having a toilet at home. She leads a group with two other women who have come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick.

Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet for increased privacy.

loans.name: Awni

texts.en:
Awni is a 43-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12 to 16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, Awni earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
Because he is not able to save enough money, Awni took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that require either natural gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This solar heating system will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal is 41 years old, is married and has a wife who provides additional income.

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 9 years, earning an income of 15,000 KES per month, and he enjoys his work.

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for topdressing his crops and to use the surplus to purchase a dairy cow for milk production in order to sell to his customers and meet family demands as well.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to educate his children. He hopes to to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for topdressing his crops and to use the surplus to purchase a dairy cow for milk production in order to sell to his customers and meet family demands as well.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL EL PROGRESO ESTA CONFORMADA POR ONCE INTEGRANTES DIES MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, PADRES DE FAMILIAS RESPONSABLES  CON HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTA ESTUDIANDO, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SU PRODUCCION DE LECHE, QUESO, CUAJADA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PERSONAS RESPONSABLES, TRABAJADORAS, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMTEN POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD. EN LA ACTULIDAD LUCHAN POR SUPERARSE Y SACAR ADELANTE A SUS FAMILIAS Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA.
LA CORDINADORA ES  RAMONA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DE UNA OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS TORTILLAS A CLIENTES FIJOS, COMO ES UNA COMIDERIA Y TAMBIEN CLIENTE EVENTUALES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA  PARA ELABORAR LAS TORTILLAS COMO. MAIZ, LEÑA, CAL, GAS, COMAL, BOLAS PLASTICAS ETC. ELLA REALIZA SU ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE HA SIDO EL MEDIO DE BRINDARLES ESTABILIDA ECONOMCIA A SUS HIJOS. LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL EL PROGRESO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN  A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRES COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The group El Progreso ("Progress) is made up of eleven members, ten women and one man. They are parents of responsible families with minor children who are studying.
They are willow originators, a place characterized by its production of milk, cheese, cottage cheese. It is characterized by its responsible and hardworking people with the desire for self-improvement.

Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources they weren't able to go to school and it was seen as a necessity that they work at an early age. In actuality, they struggle for self-improvement and to provide for their families, and to afford them better opporunities in life.

The coordinator is Ramona, and her business is the production and sale of tortillas from her home. This woman's work routine is some eight hours a day making tortillas for regular customers, as it is an eatery, and occasional customers also. The aim of the loan is to invest in the purchase of raw materials to make tortillas such as corn, firewood, lime, gas, griddle, plastic bags, etc.

She does this with pleasure since it has been a way to provide financial stability to her children. The group El Progreso is grateful for the help of Kiva investors, who allow people of limited means and from poor countries (as Nicaragua is) to have a means to dignified work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make tortillas, such as: corn, firewood, lime, matches, griddle, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Angelita Noemi

texts.es: Angelita tiene 27 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos se dedica a la comercializacion de platano yuca papaya chanchos el dinero invertira en compra de cerdos para aumentar la crianza ella tiene el sueño de comprar un terreno y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a jugar con sus hijos
texts.en:
Angelita is 27 years old, She is married and has two children.

She earns a living buying and selling bananas, yucca, papaya, and pigs. She will invest the money in buying more pigs to raise.

Angelita dreams of buying a plot of land, and she spends her free time playing with her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Diogenes

texts.es:
Diogenes tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pimpingos que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Diogenes se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de varios años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cria de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, vituca). El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Diogenes espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Diogenes is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and their 3 children in a house they own, made of rustic materials. It is located in the Pimpingo district, which is in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district is tranquil; the inhabitants mainly work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Diogenes makes a living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee. He has several years of experience in the business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. He also makes a living by raising small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and growing food crops (yucca, banana, taro).

He will use the loan given to him to purchase compost and fertilizers in order to adequately maintain his coffee plantation, as well as to contract laborers for the harvest season. With this, Diogenes hopes to offer his customers a better quality coffee, which will have a positive impact on his level of income and therefore will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to adequately maintain his coffee plantation

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a hairdresser from the town of Kapan, in the region of Syunik. With the help of her husband, she opened a small beauty shop in Kapan, where she receives her clients and provides hairdressing services for them.

Lia is the mother of three little children, aged 5, 9 and 10 years old. She perfectly manages to take care of her house, while at the same time receiving many clients during the working day.

This requested loan is very important for Lia to purchase a special chair and hairdresser tools, as well as to cover renovation costs for her beauty salon. She has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Lia to be able to accomplish her goals and enlarge the beauty salon.

loans.use: to pay for a special chair and hairdresser tools, as well as to cover renovation costs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Kipailoi

texts.en:
Kipailoi is 33 years old. He is married with 2 children. He has had a livestock farming business for 2 years.

He will be using this loan to purchase goats and sheep and he hopes this will help him expand his business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep to help him expand his business.

loans.name: Dandela

texts.en:
Dandela is a Babban Gona farmer from Dutse Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Dandela no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to use to feed his family and children.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top of the range farm inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare - double the national average in Nigeria.

This will see him increase his income considerably. This season, Dandela has ambitious plans to harvest 25 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dandela now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata built her home a few years ago, with her own working capital. Although up until now she felt that her house was complete, she has new plans to install ceramic tile inside her home. However, she does not have enough money to buy the needed materials.

So, she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy materials including sand, cement and ceramic, among others. She is very happy with the loan Tuba Rai Metin has offered for her, because this loan can help her to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, ceramic and other materials to improve her house.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is a 27-year-old married woman living in Siem Reap province. She is blessed with three children, who are dependent on her. The older child is in school, while the other two are too young for schooling.

Sophea, along with her husband, grows rice as her main source of income. In addition, her husband works for others for a fee. Together, they earn about 6.5 USD per day to support the family. The challenge in the farming business is harvesting low yields, which are caused by a lack of rainfall.

She is now leading a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund, which will be her second loan cycle. The past loan had positive impact on her family as she could meet her family’s needs in a timely manner and buy school materials for her child. She will use this new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay for plowing, hoping that she can grow rice with high yields. She also wants to be able to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield so that she can earn more income to spend on her child's studying.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es: Gloria es de 51 años de edad soltera con 6 hijos se dedica a la agricultura crianza de vacas, pollos cerdos y luego los comercializa, ella invertira el dinero en la compra de balanceados para mejorar su crianza, el objetivo de ella es construir unas chancheras mas apropiadas, en sus tiempos libres ella descansa junto a su familia
texts.en:
Gloria, 51, is a single mother of 6. She works in agriculture, raising and selling cows, chickens, and pigs. She will invest this money in balanced feed to improve her animals.

Her goal is to build some better pigpens.

When she has free time, she relaxes with her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dutse Village. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Isiyaku suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isiyaku will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare - double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Isiyaku now has the opportunity to increase his yields and his income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL SAN JOSE ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERS Y UN HOMBRES MADRES Y PADRES DE FAMILIAS RESPONSABLES DE DIES HIJOS, TODOS MEJORES DE EDAD LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE SE CARCTERIZA POR LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS LACTEOS, ESTAN PERSONAS SON RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LAS CUALES HAN CUMPLIDOS CON SUS OBLIGACIONES DE PAGOS EN TIEMPO  Y FORMA EN LOS CREDITOS ANTERIORES.
LA CORDINARORA DE LA ASOCIACION ES HIPOLITA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE COSA DE HORNO, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION. ELLA DE DEDICA UNAS DIEZ HORAS  EN SU ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA DESDE LA ELABORACION DEL PRODUCTO HASTA LA VENTA DEL MISMO ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE HA SIDO SU FORMA DE VIDA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE COSA DE HORNO COMO: LECHE,CUAJADA, AZUCAR, VAINILLA,HARINA, CANELA, QUESO, ETC.PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DEL CLIENTE Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. SAN JOSE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIOD DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en: The San Jose Group is formed by eight members: seven women and a man, mothers and fathers responsible for ten children, all adults who are studying. They are native of Sauce, a place characterized by the sale of dairy products. These people are responsible, with great wishes of personal growth, who have punctually fulfilled their payments in previous loans. The Group's coordinator is Hipolita who works producing and selling oven products. She has this business in her house. She works ten hours in this activity, from the making of the product up to its sale. She likes working in this business because it has been her way of life. The purpose of the loan is to invest in work capital, in buying raw materials such as: milk, curd, sugar, vanilla, flour, cinnamon, cheese, etc. to make these oven products in order to satisfy her customers' demand and to have better income in a near future. San Jose is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they give people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as: milk, cheese, flour, cinnamon, sugar, etc. to make oven products.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
After 23 years of service as a soldier, Lito decide to retire. After retiring from the service, Lito chose to run a business. Now, Lito is in his fifties and still manages a lumber business. He also manages a farming business where he grows corn and rice. With the lumber business, he supplies furniture manufacturers and house builders.

With increased demand from his customers, Lito needs additional capital. For that reason, Lito is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy wood and to pay his laborers' wages. Lito believes that the loan will have a big impact on his business, improving it so that he can offer employment to more of his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy wood and to pay his laborers' wages.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
A local farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province, Lang is 53 years old and a widow. She has five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. For the past 35 years, Lang has been working hard as a rice farmer. She sometimes works as a paid worker to supplement her income. Lang’s business challenges include reduced harvest yields and reduced rice prices in the market. She can earn only about 4 USD per day. Lang has managed to save about 2 USD for her future needs. 

Lang is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her farm. This will be her first loan. Lang hopes that her rice will grow healthily and return high yields so that she can support her child's studies.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ilya

texts.en:
Ilya lives and work in Kapan town in the Syunik region. He lives with his mother and sister. Ilya works in an auto repair business that is located in the center of Kapan. He is an auto mechanic and has worked there for over two years. Ilya is successful because of his high quality work and he has many clients from the Syunik region. 

Ilya is requesting a loan to purchase tools and materials to repair autos. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF that provide start-up loans with soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit. It is very important for Ilya to be able to satisfy the needs of his customers and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials to repair autos

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small house. Talal is an employee in the public sector and his low income barely covers all of his family’s needs. He is unable to save money. 

Talal is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy a solar system to heat water. Gaza suffers from regular power outages from 12-16 hours a day. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gasoline or natural gas to heat water which can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient. Talal’s loan will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive, for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his family's house

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nidal is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income which barely covers all his family's needs. Nidal is unable to save money.

Nidal is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy a solar system to heat water for his family’s house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either natural gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient.  Nidal’s loan will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive, for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar water heating system for his family's house

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn works as a teacher. She has 3 children to provide for. She has been able to send her children to school, but the fact is, her income is not enough to support the needs of her family as well as her children's education.

Ailyn was given the opportunity to take a loan to engage in another business selling useful items. She offers and sells items to her co-teachers. She earns enough doing this, and she was able to repay her previous loan.

Ailyn joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 51-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and 6 children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Jamal took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Norp's Group

texts.en:
Norp, age 40, is a married woman and has four children who depend on her. Three older children are in school and the remaining one is under the age for school. Norp is also a resident in Kampong Cham province, where she has been growing rice as the main source of income with her husband. They also take the rest of their time to work as constructing workers for a fee to earn additional income. As a result, they can earn about USD 13 and manage to save about USD 8 after deducting daily expenses.

This is the first time for Norp requesting a loan from VisionFund. She is the leader of the three-member group and will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve the farmland. She hopes she can make more income to support her family’s needs timely and to buy school materials for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost her crop yield, as well as her income to support her family’s needs and to buy school materials for her children.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Young And Enthusiastic - N11T9Đminh Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is 22 years old and he is married with one child. He has been working in agriculture raising poultry for two years. He lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable, because when some poultry disease happens they can die, which leaves him nothing to sell. So he will be in trouble with finance. The main hardship that Ngọc faces in his business is the lack of capital.

He is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He hopes that this loan will improve his living standard. He is the group leader of "Young and Enthusiastic - N11T9ĐMinh", which consists of four members. With his business profits, Ngọc hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and for his children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn and her husband (both appear in the photo standing in their house) are farmers living in Kraing Skea village with 5 children, 3 of whom have started working as farmers already. Aside from farming, Yoeurn and her husband also sell charcoal.

Yoeurn wants a reliable energy source to run her business smoothly. She wants a sustainable energy source to provide bright light each night during charcoal stock preparation and packaging in her house since she needs to go farming in the morning. However, her current power won’t allow her to achieve her goal. It is both money and time consuming. She has to charge their batteries every 2 or 3 days.

After Yoeurn discovered that solar energy is the source she needs, she decided to apply for KIVA loan to pay for a good quality solar home energy system. She believes a solar home system can make her business run smoothly. Her family will also be able to live in comfortable conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Kraing Skea Village, Kraing Skea Commune, Toek Pho

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is the age of 33 and living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans, washing machines and troubleshooting the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well from his shop, such as bulbs, switches, sockets etc.

He wants to buy new inventories for his shop but does not have cash in hand. Therefore, Zahida has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can be empowered to buy electrical goods such as sockets, switches, bulb holders, tube lights and tube light rods to sell. Zahida thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for her husband's electrician shop and for electrical goods for repairing services.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old, single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Because he is not able to save enough money, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN.

With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old, lives in a high-risk zone, and has worked growing corn, beans, and bananas for eight years. She sells her products mainly to the neighboring community, since she does not produce in bulk. She now wishes to increase the production such that she can raise her sales and profits.

She has decided to apply for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 so that she can purchase manure, insecticides, and fertilizers, to be able to continue growing her crops to have a better economic income. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is a married woman who is 41 years of age, and she has 4 children, 2 of whom rely on her. She lives with her family in a small wooden house located in Kampong Cham province. Working as a construction worker is the main source of her family’s income and has been for 20 years already. Sometimes she also works as a wood chopper to earn fee to supplement her family’s needs.

Now, San has formed a group of 3 to request a loan from VisionFund. This is her first loan cycle, and she plans to use her loan to buy zinc sheets to renovate her old and broken house. She hopes that all of her family members can live safely in a better environment.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets to renovate her old and broken house so that her family members can live safely in a better environment.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Be Happy And Smile - N03T5Qgiao Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 49 years old, and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general items for more than 10 years.

Huệ lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family lives in a low-income household in their village. Moreover, the market demand is low in this region.

The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase cake, milk, sweets, and sugar to resell. In 2008, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid many loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Huệ is the group leader of "Be happy and smile - N03T5QGiao", which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, she hopes to help her children graduate from college. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase cake, milk, sweets, and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province, Nat is 39 years old and married. She has four dependent children, three of whom are still in school. She and her husband have been growing rice on a hectare of farmland as the main source of income for years. Additionally, sometimes they work for others for a fee and sell some grocery items in their village. The challenge to this family’s business is that recently the crop was destroyed by insect pests and produced low outputs. Now, Nat is leading a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund to save the business. She will use her entire loan to purchase organic fertilizer to support her farmland, hoping that she can afford to buy an additional plot of farmland and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield as well as her income so that she can afford to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 29-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Husam took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Solidarity - N02Clbdnghiệp Group

texts.en:
Hoàn is 33 years old and she is married with one child. Mrs. Hoàn has had a retail business selling electronics for eight years. She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hoàn faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

This is Hoàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standards. Hoàn is the group leader of the Solidarity - N02CLBDNghiệp, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell

loans.name: Vruyr

texts.en:
Vruyr is a construction worker living in the town of Kapan, in the region of Syunik. He provides different type of construction and renovation work for local people in Syunik. Vruyr lives with his parents and brother and the income he gets is very important for supporting his family.

He applied for this loan to purchase tools (drill, rotary hammer drill, etc.) necessary for providing construction works. Vruyr has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products.

This loan is very important for him to be able to satisfy his customers' current orders and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for tools (drill, rotary hammer drill, etc.) necessary for providing construction services.

loans.name: Chiguto

texts.en:
Chiguto is a married woman with two children, both of whom do not attend school. She lives at her house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Alianca

texts.en: Alianca lives in Maliana, and she is 42 years old. Most of her daily income is from the business that she does every day. She has a small business and her husband is very supportive of her doing the business. She is now applying for a loan of $ 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan  to buy slippers, soaps, sardines, cigarettes, notebooks, candies, detergents, soft drinks and other things to sell. She started the business in 2014 with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy slippers, soaps, sardines, cigarettes, notebooks, candies, detergents, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en: Nak, 49, is a widowed woman from Kampong Cham province. She has a school-aged son who still depends on her. Nak has grown rice on a hectare area of farmland for 30 years to support the family. Moreover, she is also selling some sweets and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. Improving the crop productivity requires additional working capital, so she formed a group of three to request a loan from VisionFund. She will use her entire loan to purchase organic fertilizer to grow her crop well. She hopes she can increase income and have enough capital to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to grow her crop well so as to increase income and have enough capital to expand her farming business in the future.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Bunchhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Bunchhoeun is a 28-year-old married man with a daughter who is too young to go to school. He sticks designed stickers on motorcycles to earn money and his wife sells porridge, to earn the main income to support her whole family. The daily income of this family is about USD 11 and they can save approximately about USD 2. Earning a small amount of income is the main challenge in the sticker sticking motorcycle business.
This is Bunchhoeun's fourth loan with VisionFund and the past loans helped him to improve the living conditions. As the leader of the two-member group, Bunchhoeun will use his loan to buy tape, stickers and others accessories to attract more customers. He hopes that his business will run smoothly and earn him more income.

loans.use: to buy tape, stickers and other accessories to attract more customers and earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops. He will use the surplus amount to add a dairy cow for milk production in order to sell to his customers and meet family demands as well.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 32-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives by hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells clothes for ladies and gents. He has been running this business for many years. It is his misfortune that he could not built up a good relationship among his customers; this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.

Now with the increase in family necessities, he considers it necessary to grow the business. But the lack of capital is his major problem. Therefore, Samina took a loan for her husband’s clothing business. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase a new variety of clothes to sell.

Samina thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of clothes for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Evelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Evelio  es un hombre con soltero con 53 años de edad, trabajador, humilde, responsable y lleno de vida.
Su labor es la cría y venta de ganado bovino, actividad que aprendió de la mano de su padre y que ahora le permite generar recursos para solventar las necesidades del hogar. 
Trabaja toda la semana durante 8 horas.

Su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues su estado actual no es el mejor.
Evelio solicita un préstamo con el que comprará ganado bovino y cuido al por mayor.
Desea continuar con su negocio, mejorar sus ventas, aumentar clientela y generar más ingresos.
Sus ganas de salir adelante son admirables, a su edad, las ganas de luchar no disminuyen, la actividad que realiza para sobrevivir es digna de aplausos y lo hacen merecedor de la ayuda que necesita.
texts.en:
Evelio, 53, is a single man who is hard-working, humble, responsible, and full of life.

His work is raising and selling cattle, an activity that he learned directly from his father and which now allows him to generate resources to cover the household necessities.

He works eight hours a day all week.

His greatest wish is to improve the condition of his residence which is not the best right now.

Evelio is requesting a loan with which to buy cattle and their care wholesale.

He wishes to continue with his business, improve his sales, increase his customer base, and generate more income.

His desire to get ahead is admirable. At his age, the desire to struggle doesn't diminish. The activity he pursues to survive is deserving of applause and makes him worthy of the help he needs.

loans.use: to buy cattle and their care wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a su familia en los gastos del hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, veneno, abono, etc. para asistir sus cultivos y asi seguir obteneiendo buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been pixelated because she is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has been working for 3 years cultivating corn and sorghum. She sells her products in different markets that are close to her home. With her earnings, she is helps her family with household expenses. The young woman lives in her own house with her family group.

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, manure, etc., to help with her crops and therefore continue earning good profits.

loans.use: for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Stalin

texts.es: Stalin es una persona de 28 años de edad soltero presta sus servicios como chofer en las unidades de transporte donde el vive canton echeandia el diniero necesita para la compra de cerdos y asi mejorar su calidad de vida, el tiene el sueño de estudiar mediante al trabajo que realiza, en sus momentos libres juega futbol con sus vecinos del sector
texts.en:
Stalin is a 28-year-old person, he is single, and works as a driver of transportation units where he lives in the Echeandia canton. He is requesting a loan to buy pigs, and thus improve his quality of life.

He has the dream of going to school by way of the work he performs. In his free time he plays soccer with his neighbors in the area.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Amjad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, rebar, gravel, and sand in order to repair her outhouse and in this way improve the hygiene of her home.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is a taxi driver from Kapan town in the Syunik region. He lives with his wife, son, and elderly retired parents. Suren is an enthusiastic and hardworking driver who does his best to sustain his family's living. Suren has requested this loan to pay for car renovation and purchase four new winter tires.

Suren has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products.

It is very important for Suren to be able to satisfy his customers' needs and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for car renovation and purchase four new winter tires.

loans.name: Badi

texts.en:
Badi is a 47-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses by machine in his nearby town. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work for daily wages. He also brings some material home for Badi, because she helps him in the completion of embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts.

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. For this purpose he requires some capital to buy desired inventories, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Badi made this humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan her husband would be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Jaser

texts.en:
Jaser is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Jaser took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 37-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 36-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Raed took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, por situaciones económicas no pudo seguir estudiando, ahora es agricultor y apoyar a su mamá, cuando él tenía cinco años sus padres se separaron y él es el segundo de tres hermanos y es el responsable de la manutención de sus otros dos hermanas.

Francisco, su negocio es trabajar en la agricultura como jornalero, junto a su mamá son quienes han sacado adelante a su familia, el trabajo lo realizan en una platanera que emplea 40 personas permanentes y está a dos kilómetros de la casa, él trabaja cinco horas diarias, pero también se ha dedicado a la crianza de cerdos, lo que les ha permitido llevar otros recursos e ir instalando algunos servicios básicos en su casa como luz y agua.

Francisco, necesita el préstamo para sembrar 3,500 metros cuadrados de plátanos, porque tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de este cultivo y así hacer realidad los planes que desde pequeño se hizo con respecto a su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Francisco, es que su platanera sea muy productiva y le genere buenas ganancias para poder construir su casa más digna.
texts.en:
Francisco, 20 years old, has a sixth grade education. For economic reasons, he could not continue studying. Now, he is a farmer and helps his mother. When he was five years old, his parents separated. He is the second of three children, and he is responsible for supporting his other two sisters.

Francisco's business is working as a laborer in agriculture. He and his mother have kept the family moving forward. They do the work in a plantain farm that employs 40 permanent people, and is two kilometers from their house. He works 5 hours a day, but he also works raising pigs. This has helped him bring in additional resources and install basic services, such as electricity and water, in the house.

Francisco needs a loan to plant 3,500 square meters of plantains, because he has a lot of experience with the maintenance of this crop. This way, he can realize the plans that he has had since childhood, regarding his quality of life.

Francisco's dream is that his plantain farm will be very productive, and bring him good earnings to be able to build a more dignified home.

loans.use: to plant 3,500 square meters of plantains

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en: Yuri is from Ijevan town where he lives with his wife and 8-year-old daughter. Yuri is a constructor. He provides cosmetic renovation services and different type of construction work for local people in the Tavush region. Yuri has now applied for this loan to purchase a stone-grinding machine needed for his work as a constructor. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for him to be able to provide high-quality work and receive additional profit for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the stone-grinding machine needed for construction work.

loans.name: Sedrak

texts.en:
Sedrak is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his wife, elderly retired grandmother and two kids. Sedrak and his wife have been involved in the clothing sale business for five years already. They organize the business from their house and over those years of hard work, Sedrak and his wife were able to gain a loyal client base.

Sedrak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Sedrak to purchase new stock of clothing for the autumn-winter collection and meet his clients' demands.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for the autumn-winter collection.

loans.name: Badreh

texts.en:
Badriah is a 31-year-old single lady from Deir Al-Balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. She lives with her family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, her father earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Badriah took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, she will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help her to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Metaqsya

texts.en:
This will be Metqasya's second Kiva loan and again she has plans of enlarging her bakery business in Gyumri town of the Shirak region. Metaqsya hopes that Kiva lenders will appreciate her ideas and finance her to realize them. With this loan she will buy eight packages of flour, five packages of sugar, and other raw materials for her bakery service. Metaqsya is very happy and proud of her first cooperation with SEF and Kiva and after paying her first loan responsibly on time, she decided to invest in her business activity one more time.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for flour (eight packages), sugar (five packages) and other raw materials for her bakery service.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Chino Village. Aminu joined Babban Gona to grow his  agricultural business for himself and his family members. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Aminu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Aminu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk lives with his retired parents in Gavar town. He is a construction worker. Manuk has received a big and long-term order of renovation work from one of his customers in Gavar town. That's the reason he has applied for this loan to purchase new tools and materials. The loan will help him to provide a better quality job and new tools will make his work effective.

Manuk has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for him to be able to provide a high-quality job to his customers and gather income for his retired parents.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials necessary for an upcoming long-term renovation job.

loans.name: Ahmadu

texts.en: Ahmadu is a Babban Gona farmer from Chino Vilage. Ahmadu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ahmadu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ahmadu would like to use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 20-year-old single young man from Bethlehem city. His mother works as a cleaner where she gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Ibrahim is a student in the university where he studies nursing. In the future, he wants to get a BA degree and find a job to support his family.

Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Ibraheem will be able to register at the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Ibraheem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos, y vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 5 años ella se ha dedicado al negocio de elaboración y venta de tabletas de coco, tortillas y actualmente venta de abarrotes como ser: frijoles, azúcar, churros, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo, arroz, refrescos y otros. Ha tenido varios préstamos en ODEF los que ha invertido bien en su negocio, con las ganancias a diversificado actividades haciéndolo crecer.  Ahora solicita otro préstamo por 27,000 lempiras para comprar productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería con refrescos, pan, churros, arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, huevos, productos de limpieza e insumos para hacer tortillas y tabletas de coco y obtener más ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. Sus metas son hacer crecer más el negocio, lograr que sus hijos se gradúen y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Norma is 37 years old, a single mother of 6, and lives in a village in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. For five years she has made a living making and selling coconut bars and tortillas as well as selling groceries such as beans, sugar, churros, bread, condiments, cleaning products, rice, beverages, and others. She has had various loans from ODEF which have been good investments in her business; the earnings have diversified her activities and made her business grow.

Now she is asking for another loan of 27,000 lempiras to purchase food products in order to supply the shop with beverages, bread, churros, rice, beans, butter, sugar, eggs, cleaning products and supplies to make tortillas and coconut bars in order to receive more income for the sustenance of her children. Her goals are to make her business grow more, ensure that her children graduate, and to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, bread, churros, rice, beans, butter, sugar, eggs, cleaning products, and supplies to make tortillas and bars to sell.

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en: Ishaku is a Babban Gona farmer from Chino Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields from his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Ishaku no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ishaku now has the opportunity to ensure he can build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 18-year-old single young lady from Nablus city. Her mother works in the public sector where she gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely covers all of the family's needs. Haya is a student in the university where she studies medicine. She wants to get a BA degree and be a doctor in the future to support her family.

Haya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Haya will be able to register at the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Haya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Kijungu Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Jane is one of the new group members of Kijungu in Mbarara town. The group is comprised of only women who have changed their homes through working together. They have improved their households and have developed among themselves. They have managed to improve their standard of living via working together. These people have been in business and agriculture for over six years and whatever they produce is sold to Mbarara town dwellers. Some are engaged in agriculture, especially farming, and all of their products are being sold in Mbarara.

The group has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000. Jane applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to be able to pay tuition for her daughter joining a tertiary institution. The group members are grateful to Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for supporting them in improving their households and community through educating their children, as well as in developing their small businesses.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is a constructor from Mkhchyan village of the beautiful Ararat region. He lives there with his parents and two brothers. Garik's family is mainly involved in agribusiness, running a beautiful and successful farm. Gaik himself chose to earn income for his family with his construction business.
