He provides renovation work, and due to his tireless and high quality work, he receives a number of orders during a season.

Garik currently works on one cosmetic renovation project, and he needs tools for organizing his work more efficiently. Garik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up loans on soft conditions to people who do not have access to credit products. Garik needs this loan to pay for renovation of his truck and to purchase tools for providing his renovation service. It is very important for him to be able to satisfy his customers' needs and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his truck and to purchase tools for providing his renovation service.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 45 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of two and seventeen years. He operates a commercial bathhouse and toilet business and has been in this business for six years. He employs three people who maintain the place for him. Michael also sells pork meat.

Michael is putting up a new toilet and bath facility and needs this loan to complete it by buying cement, pipes, ceiling fans and a water storage tank. He is operating the old facility and needs to pull it down because of the danger it poses to his clients.

This is Michael's second loan and he will complete the payment of his first loan in March, 2016. He has good loan repayment consistency and will be able to pay both loans without any difficulty. He believes with this loan his income will increase and that will help to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to complete a new commercial toilet and bath facility.

loans.name: Yarson Norberto

texts.es: Yarson de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, desde hace 10 años se dedica a l cultivo de maíz y frijol, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para asistir sus cultivos y asi seguir con sus siembra ya que esa es su fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yarson is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has been growing corn and beans for 10 years. He sells his crops in the area surrounding where he lives, and with the profits he gets, manages to keep going. 

He is requesting another loan in order to purchase fertilizers for maintaining his crops, so that he can continue his farming, as that is his source of employment.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik is farmer living in Norapat village of the Armavir region. He lives there with his wife and two school-aged sons.

Martik is mainly involved in keeping pigs, but he also harvests tomatoes and onions on his farm, which he sells in the local markets. Agriculture is the main source of income for Martik and his family.

The farm currently needs some improvements, so Martik decided to apply for this loan. He took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to make payments on time, due to his family's weak financial situation and his unemployment. However, after years of tireless work, he has been able to find a good job and owns a farm that is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Martik has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan is very important for Martik and will enable him to purchase three sows and pay for renovation of the barn for keeping pigs, and forage for feeding the piglets.

loans.use: to pay for three sows, renovation of the barn, and forage for feeding the piglets.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Duna Village. Haruna joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Haruna suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Haruna will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will help him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Haruna now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Meliq

texts.en:
Meliq runs a shop in Armavir town. He has been involved in this business for more than seven years. He is nice and polite to his customers, so people prefer to make their everyday purchases from Meliq's store.

Meliq lives with his wife and two children. Besides home appliances, he also sells meat and some food supplies in his store. The requested loan will help Meliq to purchase new goods to sell and meet the current demand of his customers.

Meliq has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to make payments on time, which marked his credit history with overdue days. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Meliq was able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover monthly payments. Therefore, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is an enthusiastic young farmer from Arevshat village. He lives with his mother, brother and father who are also involved farming activities.

Hayk also works as a barman in one of the local bars, but perfectly manages to run the family farm. The loan will help this young man to purchase fertilizer, wheat cultivation tools and to hire workers for supporting the cultivation process.

Hayk has taken a loan from a local financial institution in the past, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it back on time. However, thanks to his hard work, Hayk has been able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover monthly payments. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Hayk will be thankful to all the lenders for helping him to sustain his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, wheat cultivation tools and to hire workers for supporting the cultivation process.

loans.name: Jyoti Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Roji lives in a small village in Koraput, Odisha. She is 20 years old and lives with her husband and their two sons. The couple could not continue their education due to their family's financial issues but they are very much concerned about providing an education to their sons who are studying in grades one and two.

Her husband runs their grocery store and Roji assists her husband after managing all of her household work. They sell items like spices, salt, rice, oil, and sugar, which are in great demand among the local villagers and neighbors. But the family's earnings hardly cover the family's basic needs. In order to meet the growing inflation and to make provisions for the future cost of her sons’ education, Roji wants to grow her husband’s grocery business. She realizes that she can earn more profit if she can increase her stock on a large scale. To buy more grocery items in bulk, she needs capital. So she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR.

She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items and daily needed commodities in bulk so that she can satisfy her regular customers and earn more. With the increased income, Roji will be able to expand her business and save better for her family’s secure future. Roji is standing to the right in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items and daily needed commodities in bulk

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.es:
María, de 34 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar cuando era joven, hoy en día está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, pero también la apoya a ella cuando sale a vender, tienen tres hijos y todos viven con ellos en la casa.  

María, vende mariscos a domicilio, ella los compra en la ciudad y cada dos días recorre 76 kilómetros para ir a comprarlo, ella se levanta a las 4:00 de la madrugada para esperar el carro que les hace el viaje a ella y a otros 4 vendedores más, porque a las 6:00 de la mañana empiezan a vender los mariscos en las comunidades: es así como ha trabajado desde hace seis años junto a su pareja. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar dos hieleras para mantener el marisco fresco y que no se les dañe, ella pretende comprar más producto y almacenarlo en las hieleras, para no tener que ir tan seguido a la ciudad a comprar, de esa manera ella obtendrá más ganancias.

El sueño más grande de María, es convertirse en vendedora mayorista.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 34 years old, didn't have the chance to go to school when she was young. Today she is in a relationship. Her partner works at farming, but also supports her when she goes out to sell. They have three children, all of whom live with them at home.

Maria sells seafood from her home. She buys shellfish in the city and every two days travels 76 kilometers to buy it. Maria gets up at 4AM to wait for the car that carries her and four other vendors, because at 6AM, they begin to sell shellfish in their communities. This is how Maria has worked for six years, together with her partner.

She is asking for a loan to buy two coolers to keep the seafood fresh and not allow it to spoil.
Maria wants to buy more of the product and store it in the coolers, so as not to have to go so often to the city to make purchases. In this way she will have more profits. Maria's big dream is to become a wholesale vendor.

loans.use: to buy two coolers to keep seafood fresh and not allow it to spoil.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es una señora 23 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo con 1 año de edad, el cual adora con todas sus fuerzas, ella se dedica a la cría de peces, un negocio que lo inicio hace mucho tiempo por necesidad económica.
Labora 3 días a la semana durante 3 horas.
Es una mujer trabajadora, humilde y llena de sueños, su propósito es continuar con su negocio y poder pagar la educación de su hijo, pues su bienestar le preocupa.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará alimento al por mayor para sus peces.
Con esto espera aumentar sus ventas, clientes y de tal manera sus ingresos.
 
Con su aporte esta mujer podrá hace de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 23-year-old woman with 1 son, age 1 year, who she adores with all her might. She works raising fish, a business she started a long time ago out of economic necessity. She works 3 days a week for 3 hours.

She is a hard-working woman who is humble and full of dreams. Her plan is to keep going with her business so she can pay for her son's education, because she is worried about his well-being.

She is currently requesting a loan which she will use to buy food wholesale for her fish. With it, she hopes to increase her sales, her customers and likewise, her income. 
 
With your contribution, this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: To buy food wholesale for her fish.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
Gori is a 39-year-old, young and energetic lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She lives in a rural village and farms a small plot of land to earn a living for her family. Gori has had it tough in life. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Gori, her husband and her two children are among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with two others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Gori has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With a toilet in their homes, they will be able to lead a healthier life and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves. They seek a loan of 45,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
Mukta, 31 years old, is one of the millions who is affected by the sanitation crisis in India as a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. She is a humble lady from Koraput district, Odisha, India and is the one standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She is not financially sound enough to build a toilet at her house. Therefore, she has to face a lot of difficulties in order to go to a long distant place to relieve herself.

Seeking to improve her situation, Mukta along with her group members, is seeking a loan of Rs. 45,000 to build a toilet in her homes. Your loan will help the families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety. This will ultimately lead to increased hygiene.

loans.use: to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Surya is a 28-year-old, charismatic, industrious and sensible lady from a small village in Koraput, Odisha. This group of three is led by Surya who is standing to the extreme left in the photograph, She has understood the importance of having a toilet at home.

Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, Surya and her group members seek a loan of Rs. 45,000 to build a latrine in their homes. Your loan will help the families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg A-4 Group

texts.en:
Jambubati is a 34-year-old married woman standing on the left. She is from Koraput, Odisha, India. She has a son, a daughter, and a husband who works as a carpenter and gets a fixed salary. That small income is hardly enough to meet even the basic needs of her family.

Because of this situation, Jambubati decided to be involved in a baking business and open a confectionery locally. She, along with her group member, is asking for a loan amount of 30,000 INR. The loan amount will be used to finish building the confectionery and purchase all needed tools and merchandise. She will start baking various kinds of confectionery products that will be sold among local people and will have her own customers.

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her family with a good lifestyle. This credit will be a great support for the family. Jambubati is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to finish building a confectionery and purchase all needed tools and merchandise.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has been operating a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the major challenge of theft in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg A-5 Group

texts.en:
Kamala is a 25-year-old differently-abled woman who lives with her husband and parents-in-law in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha state, India. The lady standing to the left is Kamala. She is engaged in mushroom and vegetable cultivation. Her husband is a farmer and he produces rice. Her husband helps her in this activity. Currently, she earns 4,000 INR per month from her livelihood, which is used for the monthly household expenses. Kamala has a three-acre farming area where she produces mushrooms and vegetables and sells them in the market. She specializes in cultivating mushrooms because mushrooms can be grown on nearly any type of agricultural and forest residue. They are an ideal crop for rural areas with large amounts of cultivated hectares and residue from field crops. By taking into consideration the drought problem in certain regions, mushroom production could help soil and water conservation too.

Kamala wants to take farming land on rent so that she can produce more mushrooms and vegetables. For this, she along with her group member is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR.

Kamala says, “I am sure that with the financial assistance received from Kiva's partner, Peoples Forum, my family's needs can be met and even I can expand my business.”

loans.use: to rent farming land to produce more mushrooms and vegetables.

loans.name: Jay Maa Sarada Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Sumitra, 37, standing in the middle in the photograph, is the featured borrower of Jay Maa Sarada Shg-A Group. She has five members in her family, including three children. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation and other crimes.

Therefore, Sumitra along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR to build a well-equipped toilet at her home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped toilet.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
Gaspar is a farmer from Dimitrov village, where he lives and runs his farm with family members. Gaspar lives with his wife, parents, brother, sister and nephew. His whole family are engaged in the farming business. They have three greenhouses where they grow different types of vegetables.

Gaspar has now applied for this loan to purchase onion seeds, a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, three piglets and two bulls, as well as to pay for partial renovation of the barn for their livestock.

As this is Gaspar's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Gaspar and his family will be very thankful to lenders for their goodwill and support in helping them to collect the required amount of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for onion seeds, a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, three piglets and two bulls, as well as to pay for partial renovation of the barn for their livestock.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has been running a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenges of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jay Maa Sarada Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Mina is a 32-year-old lady from Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has a small family comprised of her infant daughter and her husband who is a rickshaw driver. The cheerful lady standing in the middle in the photograph is Mina. She hails from a low-income household and with the limited income, she is unable to build a toilet in her house. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves.

Therefore, to improve her family's living conditions, Mina along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a well-equipped, modernized toilet in her house. It will help her get access to basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped, modernized toilet.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre con 59 años de edad, tiene un hijo con 17 años de edad, es trabajador y muy humilde, se dedica  a la preparación y venta de comida en el municipio de Puerto de Salgar.

Los logros obtenidos en las ventas no son suficientes para este hombre que quiere surgir a toda costa para estabilizarse, es por esto que solicita un crédito, con el que comprará panela por pacas y también una parrilla para adaptar al carro y transportar sus productos.
Su meta es continuar trabajando para cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que el estado actual de esta no es el mejor.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de progresar permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 59-year-old man who has a son, age 17. He is hard-working and very humble. He works in the preparation and sale of food in the city of Puerto de Salgar. 

The achievements he's made in sales are not sufficient for this man, who wants to keep his head above water and become stable. That is why he is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy panela (cane sugar) in bulk and also a rack to adapt to his car and transport his products. 

His goal is to continue working to reach the dream of improving his living conditions, because the current conditions of his home are not the greatest. 

His positive attitude and desire to get ahead reveal the immense desire in this man to better himself and get a favorable response to his request.

loans.use: To buy panela (cane sugar) in bulk and also a rack to adapt to his car to transport his products.

loans.name: Jay Maa Sarada Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Runu, 43, is the lady standing in a white sari in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. These members are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. Unfortunately, they do not have access to a toilet in their house due to financial constraints. But all the members are determined to improve their living conditions.

Runu, along with her other two group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a toilet in her home. Access to a toilet will help these ladies maintain proper health and hygiene and safeguard their family's health.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is a married woman who has no children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Sophie has been running a motorcycle transport business for the past three years. She mentioned the major challenge of theft in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase some spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase some spare parts to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 45, married, and has three children. He has a small frozen meat and fish project and is requesting a 4,000 EGP loan to buy more frozen meats such as burgers, sausages and ground meat to expand his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more frozen meats such as burgers, sausages and ground meat.

loans.name: Rutoma Traders Association Group

texts.en: Dismas, a thirty-seven-year-old married man, is a member of Rutoma Traders Association and charged with the responsibility of taking care of six children, all of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He is a market vendor who sells secondhand clothes. He also ventured into farming, primarily growing cassava and rice in order to supplement his income. Dismas admires educating his children as well as expanding his business more in order to increase his capital base. He is seeking a loan facility to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Helmy

texts.en: Helmy is 34 years old, married and has one child. His parents live with him in the same house. He has a small shop in which there is a photocopier, some educational handouts, writing tools, and gifts. He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a new photocopier and expand his project to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new photocopier and expand his project to generate more income for his family.

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en: Ubale is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon Gari Daji Vilage. Ubale  joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ubale will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ubale would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy is 51 years old and lives together with his wife. He has taken many loans from Seva MFI for his poultry business. Those loans were repaid fully and on time. Rudy wants to start the cultivation of rice on a land of eight hectares. For this he lacks finances and approached us for a loan of SRD 8,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides. He wants to save the profits of the rice cultivation and secure his family's future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru: Нигинамо приветливая и трудолюбивая женщина из города Куляб. Ей 40 лет она замужем и имеет троих детей. Её муж таксист. Сама Нигинамо в течение 6 лет занимается портным делом. Она может шить не только национальные платья, но и европейские, а также свадебные платья. Всему этому она научилась благодаря курсам кройки и шитья. Однако ее дом находится в ветхом состоянии и ей очень неловко перед своими клиентками. Нигинамо хочет взять кредит на ремонт дома и на оставшуюся часть купить своим детям школьную форму. Она полагается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Niginamo is a friendly and hardworking woman from the city of Kulob.  She is 40, married, and she has three children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Niginamo herself has been working as a seamstress for the past six years.  In addition to traditional Tajik clothes, she knows how to sew European-style outfits and wedding gowns.  She learned her skills thanks to a designing and sewing course that she took.  However, her house is in a very poor condition right now and Niginamo feels ashamed when her customers come to visit her.  For this reason, she is taking a loan to renovate her house.  With the extra money, she will be buying school uniforms for her children.  She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Oemardath

texts.en: Oemardath once again thanks all his Kiva lenders for financing his rice cultivation. He repaid his loan fully and with the profits, he could renovate his house and also could save for his family's future. To continue with the rice production, Oemardath needs another loan of SRD 7,500 so he can buy inputs like diesel and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy diesel and fertilizers.

loans.name: Krishne

texts.en: Krishne once again repaid his loan fully and on time. He thanks all his Kiva lenders for doing such a great job. With the profits of last season, Krishne saved for his children's school fees. He also could overhaul his tractor. This will benefit him when he will harvest his rice fields. Krishne wants to continue with the rice production and needs a loan of SRD 9,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase diesel and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mujeres Los Morales Group

texts.en:
Caserio los Morales is a small hamlet in Solola in Southwest Guatemala. Here, the community - men but mostly women - wear their beautiful traditional clothing. The hamlet is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Los Morales” with its eight very dedicated and hardworking members whose small businesses consist of creating their traditional beautiful textiles to sell. Some of the members are also famers.

One of the members of “Mujeres Los Morales” is 35-year-old Susana, who is married with four children. She and her husband are farmers whose crops, thankfully, are supporting their children. Susana needs to request a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers for their crops of carrots, potatoes and cabbage which are grown on their 3 to 4 acres of land.

Like most of the 22,000 clients of Friendship Bridge, Susana never had the opportunity to have a formal education. She is very grateful for the monthly Trust Bank meetings where the Facilitator provides educational topics with drawings, role playing and photos. Each month a new important topic that the women can use in their daily lives is provided. These topics range from good business practices like bookkeeping, investing, savings, customer service and marketing to women’s and children’s health. They also have the opportunity to learn about medicinal plants and their uses. This winning combination of education and microcredit is Friendship Bridge’s “Microcredit Plus” Program.

Thanks to Kiva investors for helping to empower the Maya women to develop their self-esteem, grow their businesses and create better and brighter futures for themselves, their families and their communities. The ladies are most appreciative.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for their crops of carrots, potatoes and cabbage that are grown on their 3 to 4 acres of land

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
Joshada is a 45-year-old widow standing on the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Life was never easy for her after her husband's demise. All the burdern of her family came to her shoulders. But she never broke; she was always rock strong in order to move on and lead a happy life with her only son. Joshada is currently engaged in cultivating paddy and works hard in order to meet the household needs. However, due to a lack of financial resources, Joshada is unable to provide a higher education to her only son.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Joshada will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course. The loan amount will help her son to pursue his higher education smoothly and efficiently.

Joshada is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees of her son's ITI course

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нурила, 47 лет, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Образование - среднее. С 1985 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Для старта много лет назад у нее было только 4,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день бизнес достаточно развит. В хозяйстве Нурилы есть 3 коровы, 20 овец. На 1,0 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли выращивает лук, кукурузу и перец для реализации. Ежемесячный доход на сегодняшний день составляет около 23,000 сом (KGS). Нурила обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 16,000 сом (KGS) на сбор экологически-чистого лука. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса и хочет накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Nurila is 47 and married.  Her children are grown up and independent.  Nurila has a secondary education and she's been involved in agriculture since 1985.  When she started in this field, many years ago, she only had 4,000 som (KGS).  Today, her farming business is well developed: Nurila has three cows, 20 sheep, and she also grows onions, corn and peppers for resale on one hectare of her own land and one hectare of leased land.  She makes a monthly income of about 23,000 som (KGS).  Nurila has turned to Kiva's field partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 16,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to cover the costs of harvesting organic onions.  Nurila is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her farming business.  She would also like to save enough money to buy some furniture for her house.

loans.use: to cover the cost of harvesting organic onions.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
Radha is a 35-year-old lady standing on the extreme left. She hails from the Koraput district, Odisha, India and is the featured borrower of Maa Tarini Shg A-2 Group. She is one of the victims of the sanitation crisis and does not possess a toilet in her house. This compels her and her family to travel long distances to get access to a public toilet. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Radha, along with her other group members who are undergoing the same situation, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a hygienic toilet in her house in order to maintain safety and hygiene and prevent infections and diseases. She aspires to lead a healthy and happy life with her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Jay Maa Sarada Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Sarala, 49 years old and standing on the right, is a homemaker. She went to school up to the fifth grade but didn't continue her education due to a lack of economic resources. She got married and with her husband, had 4 children, all of whom are adults and work for their own households. Later, her husband died due to an illness and Sarala was left a widow. She lives with three of her grandchildren.

Sarala has had a small snack stand for 15 years. She established this business due to the necessity to give her children everything necessary. Sarala, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase juices, soft drinks, cookies, candies, sweets, ham, bleach, laundry soap, etc. In this way, she will manage to offer more product variety to her customers.

Sarala's dream is to have a larger store to be able to offer more products.

loans.use: to purchase juices, soft drinks, cookies, candies, sweets, ham, bleach, laundry soap, etc.

loans.name: Diego Fernando

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre con 43 años de edad, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad y es separado desde hace poco de su esposa. La adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y luchar por el sueño de formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos.

Él se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, trabaja toda la semana durante 7 horas. En el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una terneras y alimento al por mayor para las mismas.

Diego es un hombre lleno de sueños y metas, necesita ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Diego, aged 43, has a 4-year-old daughter and recently separated from his wife. Although he has had a difficult time, this doesn't stop him from wanting to get ahead and fight to formalize his business and be able to leave it to his children in the future.

He raises livestock, and works 7 hours a day every day of the week. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase cattle and buy feed wholesale.

Diego is full of dreams and goals and needs your help to realize them. Please give him a loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and buy feed wholesale.

loans.name: Paco Damian

texts.es: Paco tiene 18 años de edad es soltero se dedica a vender viveres tambien cria animales como cerdos gallinas, Paco invertira el dinero en la tienda comprando por mayor arroz y azucar y asi mismo vender por mayor estos productos el tiene la meta de consolidarce con su negocio en la ciudad donde vive y le gusta fisfrutar de las fiestas en sus tiempos libres
texts.en:
Paco, aged 18, is single and raises animals such as pigs and chickens. He will invest the money in his shop, buying rice and sugar in bulk, and then selling these goods wholesale.

His goal is to consolidate his business, which is located in the city where he lives. He enjoys going to parties and local festivals in his free time.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice and sugar wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
Regina es una mujer con 57 años de edad, tiene su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda ubicada en el Municipio de Fresno. Su deseo de salir adelante es admirable, porque pese a su avanzada edad, no disminuye esfuerzos, lucha día a día por lograr sacar adelante a su gran familia conformada por sus hijos y su actual pareja.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual surtirá su tienda con productos de consumo diario en los hogares al por mayor, y también pagara una deuda con un familiar que le provee.
Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de remodelar su vivienda, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su actual estado no es el mejor.

No cabe duda que el interés demostrado por esta señora es obtener lo deseado, merece considerar su petición.
texts.en:
Regina, aged 57, runs her own business, a small shop located in the town of Fresno. Her determination to get ahead is admirable, and she remains as strong as ever despite her age. She struggles every day to help support her large family, which includes her children and her current partner.

She is requesting a loan to stock her shop with everyday products which she will buy wholesale, and will also repay a loan to a member of her family.

She wants to keep working in order to realize her dream of remodeling her home, as it has been under construction for a long time and is currently in a poor condition.

It is clear that this lady is determined to reach her goal, and her request should be considered.

loans.use: to stock her shop with everyday products purchased wholesale, and also to repay a loan from a member of her family.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза жительница города Душанбе. Ей 57 лет. Она разведена с мужем и имеет детей. Дети учатся в университете. Роза одна кормить, и воспитывает детей. У нее высшая образования. Она работает учительницей в университете. Роза студентам преподает русский язык. Много лет она работает в этой сфере деятельности. У Розы большие расходы в жизни, потому что она одна зарабатывает и обеспечить семью. Она не смогла копить денег для покупки новый холодильник. Ее старый холодильник несколько раз сломался, и он надолго не выдержит. И ее продукт питания портится без холодильника. Роза по этой причине  обратился за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить новый холодильник. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас.
texts.en:
Roza is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 57 years old. She is divorced from her husband and has children. The children study at the university. Roza feeds and raises the children alone. She has higher education and works as a university teacher. She teaches Russian language to her students. She has worked in this area for many years.

Roza has a lot of expenses because she is the only one to earn money and provide for her family. She is not able to save money for purchasing a new refrigerator. Her old refrigerator broke several times and it will not work for much longer. Without a refrigerator her food will go bad. For this reason Roza applied for a loan. She will use the loan to purchase a new refrigerator. You can help her now.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.ru: Каныкей успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, 15 овец. На 0,70 Га она выращивает картофель для реализации, есть фруктовый сад. Совокупный ежемесячный доход Каныкей - около 13,000 сом (KGS), этих средств по-прежнему не хватает на достойную жизнь. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят  для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Каныкей планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Kanykei successfully repaid her previous loan after using it for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her get this financing.  She currently has two cows, 15 sheep, and she grows potatoes for resale on 0.7 hectares of land.  She also has an orchard.  Her total monthly income comes up to approximately 13,000 som (KGS), which is still insufficient for a decent life.  In order to further grow her business, Kanykei is once more taking a loan from Bai Tushum.  She has requested 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a few additional calves and increase her livestock headcount.  Kanykei is planning to use the earnings from her loan to grow her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves in order to increase her livestock headcount and her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a new product line (soft drinks and beer) which will be stocked alongside fish and yuca.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилчону 38 лет. Он вместе с семьей проживает на районе Темурмалик. Он отец четверых детей. Одилчон как ответственный отец и муж должен обеспечить своих детей и жену всем необходимым. Он начинает новый бизнес в сфере общественного питания. Одилчон нашел место и обустроил помещение для приема клиентов и составил меню блюд. Ему осталось только купить посуды и продуктов для приготовления еды. Одилчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить все необходимое и открыть свою от столовую.
texts.en: Odiljon is 38 years old.  He lives with his family in the Temurmalik district of Tajikistan and he is the father of four children.  As a responsible father and husband, Odiljon needs to provide his family with all the necessities of life.  At the moment, he is launching a new catering business.  He has already found a business location.  He has arranged a room to greet his customers and also taken care of the menus.  He just needs to buy the necessary utensils and food products to prepare his dishes.  He is taking a loan to buy everything that he still needs to open his new catering business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and food products to open a new catering business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a new sales agent for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums. She has completed iSmart's sales and marketing training and is beginning to work as a door-to-door sales agent in Nairobi's slum communities. iSmart's best-selling product is the clean cookstove, which has an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health as well as the environment.  Please help Agnes earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in her community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 28-year-old married man from Nablus city, an ancient city located in the West Bank. He lives with his family in a small house. Because it’s difficult to find a job in the West Bank, he wants to open his own business, a mobile phone store, as he has experience from his previous job selling mobiles and providing maintenance, and he has an entrepreneurial spirit.

In order to get started, Muhammad took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy mobile phones and accessories to resell in his new store. This will make him independent.

Muhammad appears in the photo in his new store.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories to resell in his new store.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is young woman living in Nairobi's slums in search of an opportunity to improve her life. She started working as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya where she earns an income selling green energy products like clean cookstoves and solar lamps in her community. She is learning valuable job skills in sales, customer service and professionalism that will help her throughout her lifetime.  Please help Stella in her quest for financial independence by funding this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Johnny Alexander

texts.es: Johnny tiene 20 años de edad es soltero se dedica a vender quesos guineo y necesita el dinero para invertir en mejorar la calidad de pastos y las matas de guineo con abonos y ureas, quiere llegar hacer un gran productor y le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Johnny, aged 20, is single, and produces bananas. He is requesting a loan to invest in fertilizer and plant feed for improving the quality of the fields and the banana plants.

He would like to become a big producer in the future, and in his free time he enjoys sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plant feed.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a young woman living in an informal settlement in Nairobi. She has come to iSmart in search of a job so that she can earn money to support herself. At iSmart Caroline sells life-improving products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves. She earns a commission on each sale that she makes. Please help her earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in her community by funding this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old, married man from Khan Younis, in the Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house; he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Ahmad has a stall selling fruit and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Ahmad took out a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy some fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Sanamacha Group

texts.en:
Sanamacha, the group leader hails from Imphal in Manipur. She runs a garment store and sells traditional Manipuri wraparounds called Phaneks, as well as regular clothing like salwars, kameez and shawls. As the prices of clothes prices rises she is facing difficulty in maintaining stock volume. 

Similarly other members of the group are also facing financial difficulty for managing their business activity. So they joined hands to form the group and applied for a loan from YMF, a partner of Milaap to enhance their business activity so that their income level increases. They are well aware of group rules and agreed to abide by it. They are grateful to the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To pay for wholesale purchase of garments like phanek, shawls and salwar kameez for her garments store

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama.
Él es buen padre, independiente y muy emprendedor. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores.
Miguel es moreno de cabello corto y baja estura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama como; edredones, cubrecamas, sábanas, y otros “vendemos ambulantemente recorriendo ferias y comercios, buscamos un puesto fijo de venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con demanda, la desventaja es la venta ambulante. Su sueño es tener su puesto de venta propio, él desea comprar un puesto de venta para dejar de ambular. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por eso motivos que Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de un puesto de venta fijo para vender junto a su pareja y dejar de ambular.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 24 year old man, his lives with his partner and they have a 2 year old son. Their business is selling bedding. His is a good father, is independent and hard-working. He carries out his business in the 'plan 3000' area which is known for the multiculturalism of its inhabitants. 

Miguel has dark, short hair and is fairly short, his native language is Guarani and he also speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his partner who earns a living from the same business, they live in a small, rented room which is made of bricks and cement and has all the basic services they need. 

Their business is selling bedding, such as quilts, bedspreads, bed sheets and others. 'We travel to sell and go to festivals and businesses, we are looking for a fixed place from which to sell' he says. 

The advantage of their business is that they rely on demand, the disadvantage is having to travel. His dream is to have his own shop to sell from, he wishes to buy one to stop having to travel. 

This is his first loan with the institution in his first year of running the business. This is why Miguel is asking for a loan, to but a fixed place to sell from with his partner and stop having to travel .

loans.use: to buy a place from which he can sell together with his partner and stop travelling

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.es:
Mardonia tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es bastante tranquila, la población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio sus clientes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Mardonia espera poder atender las diversas necesidades de sus clientes, lo que va a incrementar su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mardonia is 49 years old, she is married and lives with her family in a rural zone in the district of Oyotun, which is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region in the north coast of Pero. Life in this area is fairly quiet, the population earn a living from agriculture, livestock and business.

She earns a living selling groceries, and does this from her own home. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business, and her clients give very good personal and working references of her. 

The loan will be used o buy more products such as rice, sugar, oil, among others to increase the stock of her business. With this Mardonia hopes to be able to meet the diverse needs of her clients, which will increase her income and will allow her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of products to sell

loans.name: Elva Isabel

texts.es: Elva tiene 51 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos, es maestra y tambien se dedica a la crinza de animales como los cerdos con este dinero va a comprar alimentacion de los cerdos como es balanceados y vitaminas la meta de Elva es consolidarce economica y en sus momentos libres se dedica a leer y trotar
texts.en:
Elva is 51 years old and is married with three children. She likes to spend her free time reading and jogging.

She is a school teacher but also earns a living raising animals such as pigs, with this money she is going to buy pig feed such as balanced meals and vitamins. 

Her goal is to strengthen herself economically.

loans.use: to buy balanced meals and vitamins.

loans.name: Semillitas De Pacallal Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “SEMILLITAS DE PACALLAL” y está conformado por 05 socias .Este es el caso de magdalena  de 47 años de edad es conviviente. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de belleza por catálogo  desde hace más de 07 años que tiene dicho negocio. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Gracias al préstamo podrá implementar más su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para  la compra de colonias talcos labiales .su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio. El grupo “semillitas de pacallal” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Magdalena SE encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa color negro.
texts.en:
This group "Semellitas de Pacallal" [Little seeds of Pacallal] is made up of 5 members.

This is the story of Magdalena, she is 47 years old. She earns a living selling cosmetic beauty catalogue products, and has more than 7 years experience in doing so. With a lot of effort she has managed to help move her family forward.

Thanks to the loan she will be able to develop her business more. Her newest loan will be used to buy perfumes, powders and lipsticks. Her biggest wish is to be able to expand her business.

The group "Semillitas de Pacallal" are grateful to the people of Kiva for making this loan possible. Magdalena is seen at the back of the photograph, she is the first on the right wearing the black sweater.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, powders and lipsticks

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un señor  amable, pertenece a la etnia Quiché, originaria de  Santo Tomas La Unión. Está casado, tiene nueve hijos de las edades entre 13 y 32 años. Antonio cuenta con 25 años de experiencia de ser albañil, y su más grande preocupación es darle a su familia lo mejor,  él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como: cemento, arena y cal, esto lo realiza con el fin de remodelar su casa y darle un mejor aspecto a su humilde hogar.
Antonio tiene el anhelo de construir una casa más grande para mayor estabilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is a friendly man of Quiche ethnicity, he originates from Santo Tomas La Union. He is married and has 9 children between the ages of 13 and 32.

Antonio has 25 years of experience as a bricklayer, and his biggest occupation is giving his family the best he can.

He is asking for a loan to buy materials such as cement and sand, which will help him to remodel his house and improve his family's humble home.

Antonio wishes to build a bigger house to establish his family better.

loans.use: buy cement, and sand

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Don Cruz de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 30 años vende sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ventas q realixa es como puede salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes para asistir sus cultivos ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Cruz is 63 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has grown corn and rice for 30 years, and he sells his products in the nearby towns. With his sales, he is able to get ahead. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to help his crops, because they are his only source of income and this way he can have better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith es una microempresaria de 52 años de edad residente en un barrio del municipio de Cartagena de Indias y durante su niñez estuvo vinculada al negocio familiar de elaboración de condimentos y aliños, ella decidió continuar con este legado hace cuatro años y ha obtenido excelentes resultados económicos, con los que ha conseguido subsistir y sacar a delante a sus hijos. El aliño es la mezcla de especias y otros condimentos con el fin de realzar o potenciar el sabor de algún producto, como una ensalada o unas carnes o pescados y son muy utilizados en la preparación de platos típicos en la región Caribe y gracias a ello su negocio ha sido un éxito y sus productos muy comercializables entres sus clientes que en su mayoría son tenderos del municipio y otros negocios similares.  Edith distribuye a sus clientes en presentación de display: canela, manzanilla, pimienta de olor, clavitos de olor, ajo entre otros e incluso bicarbonato y azulin, utilizados como blanqueadores de prendas de vestir. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en flor de manzanilla, canela, pimienta para armar sus display de productos.  Con esta inversión capitalizará su negocio y podrá cumplir oportunamente a los pedidos de su clientela. Su meta a futuro es abrir un punto de venta en su vivienda y lograr comprar casa propia.
texts.en: Edith is a 52 year old micro-business woman. She lives in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias and during her childhood she was involved in the the family business of making seasonings and condiments. She decided to continue with the legacy four years ago and she has obtained excellent financial results, with which she has been able to subsist and get her children ahead. The seasoning is a mixture of spices and other herbs in order to bring out the flavor of a product, such as a salad or meats or fish. They are used a lot in the preparation of traditional dishes in the Caribbean region. Thanks to this her business has been successful and her products are very marketable with her customers, who are mainly shopkeepers in the town and other similar businesses. Edith distributes to her customers with a display presentation of cinnamon, chamomile, allspice, cloves, garlic and more, including even baking soda and bluing, used for whitening clothes. Right now, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in chamomile flowers, cinnamon, and pepper to stock up her display of products. With this investment, she will capitalize her business and be able to fill her orders for her customers in a timely manner. Her goal in the future is to open a new point of sale in her home and be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: to invest in chamomile flowers, cinnamon, and pepper to stock up on her product display.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Ricardo Palma Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. La mayoría de los socios se conocen entre sí y son responsables. Este es el segundo crédito que Girvin tiene con el grupo “Emprendedores de Ricardo Palma”. Girvin es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad soltero. Hace dos años él se dedica al servicio de transporte de moto taxi. Con los ingresos de su trabajo solventa los gastos de su alimentación y sus estudios. Una de las metas de Girvin es seguir sus estudios superiores. Solicito el crédito para hacer un mantenimiento general de su moto taxi ya que es su herramienta principal de trabajo. Girvin es la segunda persona del lado derecho de la foto viste polo color azul y short color marrón claro.
Está muy agradecido por haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is starting its second cycle. Most of the members know each other and are responsible. This is the second loan that Girvin has with the “Emprendedores de Ricardo Palma” group. Girvin is a young, 21 year old entrepreneur. He is single. Two years ago, he started working in the motorcycle transportation service. With the income fro his job, he pays for his food and education expenses. One of Girvin's goals is to continue with his post-secondary education. He asked for the loan to to general maintenance on his motorcycle, because it is his main work tool. Girvin is the second person from the right in the photo, wearing a blue t-shirt and light brown shorts.

He is very grateful for the support he has received from the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to do motorcycle maintenance on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jeronima Francisca

texts.es: Doña Jeronima, de 73 años es una de nuestras fieles clientes, que por muchos años ha trabajado con los prestamos de ADIM y los socios de Kiva, por 22 ciclos, esta nuevamente solicitando crédito para el financiamientos de su negocio y así poder seguir creciendo. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías en maderas, renta habitaciones y en su domicilio vende hielo. La inversión de su crédito esta destinada a la compra de centros de mesa, tajaderas, fruteros, floreros y hamacas así poder seguir ofreciendo variedad a su variada clientela.
texts.en: Jeronima is 73 years old and is one of our faithful clients. She has worked with ADIM  loans and KIVA members for many years, for 22 cycles. She is asking for a loan again to finance her business and continue growing. She sells wooden artisanal products, rents rooms and sells ice from her home. The investment of the loan will be used to buy centerpieces, mezzalunas, fruit bowls, vases and hammocks to continue offering a variety to her varied customers.

loans.use: to buy centerpieces, mezzalunas, fruit bowls, vases and hammocks.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007.

He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mohammad also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. With this loan, Mohammad can buy more cold soft drinks for his store to resell, which is popular because Gaza can get very hot! Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y tambien siembra frijoles y trabaja como jornal, vende sus prodcutos en los diferetes mercados que estan cerca de su casa con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de la casa, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y asi tener una buena cosecha ya que esa es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Miguel, 34 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. He has worked for 10 years in agriculture and grows corn and also plants beans and works as a day laborer. He sells his products in the different markets that are near his house. With the sales that he does, he manages to cover some of the household costs. He is asking for another loan to purchase fertilizer and, so, to have a good harvest since it is his source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena tiene 62 años, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge. Buenas referencias personales y familiares. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería; ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

Maria Elena se dedica al alquiler de máquinas de Play Station, en el distrito de Cayaltí desde hace 5 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de videojuegos originales, sillas, mesas,estantes, entre otros accesorios para mejorar su servicio y hacer crecer su negocio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 62-years old. She lives in her own house with her partner. She has good personal and family references and comes from a united family. She lives in a community dedicated to business, agriculture and livestock, located in the district and province of Morropón, in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Maria Elena has worked renting Playstation machines in the district of Cayaltí for approximately 5 years. The destiny of the loan is to buy original video games, chairs, tables, and shelves, along with other accessories to improve her service and make her business grow. It will allow her to improve her income, increase her earnings and improve the quality of life for her and her family in a short period of time.

loans.use: to buy original video games, chairs, tables, and shelves.

loans.name: Karen Guadalupe

texts.es:
Karen, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no siguió estudiando en la universidad debido a la situación económica que tenía, está soltera y vive con sus padres.

Karen, desde hace 7 años trabaja en un centro de desarrollo integral, donde les da clases de la biblia a niños y refuerza conocimientos de la escuela, a ella le gusta enseñarle a los niños y el lugar donde lo hace está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y su día de trabajo comienza a las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar pollos de engorde, concentrado, medicinas y cedazo para construir un pequeño corral.

Su sueño es estudiar en la universidad ingeniería agronomica, además sueña con colocar una granja de pollos y gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Karen, 22 years old, went to school through secondary school. She didn't continue her studies at the university due to her economic situation. She is single and lives with her parents.

For 7 years, Karen has worked in a comprehensive development center where she teaches Bible classes to children and reinforces academic knowledge. She likes to teach the children and the place where she does it is 1 kilometer from her house and her work day begins at 8:00 until 4:00 pm.

The loan will be invested in purchasing chickens to fatten, concentrated feed, medicines, and mesh to build a small corral.

Her dream is to study agricultural engineering at the university. In addition, she dreams of establishing a farm with chicken and laying hens.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to fatten, concentrated feed, medicines and mesh to build a small corral.

loans.name: Sindy Yaneth

texts.es:
Sindy es una mujer con 26 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, la adversidad que la ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y alcanzar sus metas, lo que se propone lo logra, antes quería tener su propio negocio, ahora lo tiene, desde hace poco se dedicó a realizar labores de campo y ahora es dueña de varios cultivos los cuales le generan muy buenos ingresos.
Trabaja toda la semana durante 5 horas diarias.
Sindy se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la mejora de canales y comprara fertilizantes y abonos.

Su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una buena estabilidad económica.

Con su apoyo esta mujer podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sindy is a 26-year-old woman, hard-working and very humble. The adversity that has followed her has not been an obstacle to wanting to get ahead and reach her goals, what she sets for herself she achieves. Before, she wanted to have her own business, now she has it. A little while ago, she worked doing rural jobs and now she is the owner of various crops which generate very good income.

She works the whole week for 5 hours each day.

Sindy is asking for a loan which she will invest in the improvement of the channels and to purchase fertilizers and manure.

Her greatest desire it to improve the conditions of her house, offer her family a better quality of life and good economic stability.

With your help, this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to invest in the improvement of the channels and to purchase fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Leonso

texts.es: Leonso es un hombre de 50 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia con el que vive muy feliz mente, él cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito anterior porque gracias a ello pudo realizar la compra de un terreno, sin embargo él no está convencido con este avance por lo que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de algunos muebles que le hacen mucha falta a su hogar, Leonso estará pagando su crédito con los ingresos que obtiene  de su trabajo de albañil. Su gran anhelo es contar con una casa más grande para mayor estabilidad de su familia.
texts.en: Leonso is a 50-year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family who he lives very happily with. He mentions that he did very well with the previous loan. Thanks to the loan, he was able to buy land. However, he is not convinced with this progress, so he has made the decision to ask for another loan to buy some furniture that his house badly needs. Leonso will be paying for his loan with the income that he gets from his bricklaying job. His great desire is to have a bigger house for more stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio es un hombre trabajador de 43 años de edad que desde muy joven aprendió a elaborar puertas, ventanas y balcones de hierro, convirtiéndose en mecánico de obra de banco, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. Desde hace 25 años. Eugenio vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y 3 hijos dos niñas de 15 y 17 años de edad y su hijo de 9 años de edad. Eugenio desea construir una galera en su vivienda, ya que su trabajo él debe realizarlo sin poder protegerse de las inclemencias del tiempo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para construir una galera para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eugenio is a working 43-year old man. From a young age, he learned how to make doors, windows, and iron balconies, becoming a bench work mechanic. This job has allowed him to support his family for 25 years. Eugenio lives in a house on his property with his wife and 3 children: 2 daughters, ages 15 and 17, and one son who is 9.

Eugenio wants to build a gallery at his house, because he needs to do his work without having to protect himself from the weather conditions. He is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, poles and pins to build a gallery for his business.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, poles and pins to build a gallery for his business.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 20-year-old single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house.

Osama has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic condition in Gaza became too bad after the last conflict.

Osama took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios y tiene muchos clientes especialmente los vecinos gracias a sus ventas es como puede salir adelente, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young girl has had her face pixelated because she is 28-years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has had a store located in her home for several years and has many customers, especially the neighbors. Thanks to her sales she can get ahead. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her two children. She is asking for a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc., and this way she can get a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: La Luz Del Mundo Group

texts.en:
Chicamán is a town in the department of Quiché located in northeast Guatemala. The area is diverse and has a few distinct ecosystems including the subtropical wet forest in the National Park. Because of the fertile and rich soil of the area, a wide variety of agricultural products are grown including cardamom. Guatemala is actually the top world producer of this exotic spice! The population is a mixture of ethnicities and includes K’iche’, K’eqchí, Uspanteko, Poqomchi' and Spanish. The predominant languages are K'iche and Spanish.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “La Luz Del Mundo” or “Light of the World” was formed here by eight enthusiastic women who share the common desire to improve their lives. Maria is a 42-year-old member of the group who is married with six children. In order to have enough income to cover the expenses of her large family, Maria opened a small convenience store.

This industrious woman is expanding the store and is requesting a loan to purchase rice, noodles, beans, eggs, sausages, cheeses, oil, sugar and other big selling items. Thanks to her earnings, Maria is able to supply income for the family and the couple is putting funds aside so that each of their children can have a good education. They know that education is the key to a successful future for the children.

Maria, along with the eight women in the Trust Bank, look forward to their monthly meetings when they make payments on their loans. After this, the Facilitator from Friendship Bridge, using drawings, pictures and role playing, conducts educational training on a relevant and useful topic.

Kiva investors are greatly valued by indigenous women like Maria as it would be impossible for her to walk into a bank to obtain a loan. All of the ladies have already taken steps toward empowering themselves and eliminating poverty. Thank you for your generosity and kindness!

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, beans, eggs, sausages, cheeses, oil, sugar and other big selling items

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.en:
Isabel lives in the town of Sacapulas in the northeastern part of Guatemala. She is 33 years old, has three children and has a goal of developing herself economically and intellectually. She is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Buen Samaritano” or “The Good Samaritan,” along with seven other ladies.

Isabel has various businesses including the sales of vegetables and tortillas. Because of the success of these businesses, the family is prospering. Isabel is greatly heartened at the success of her business and would like to open another locale to sell vegetables. She is requesting a loan to buy various vegetables like corn, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and onions. She shares the success of her business with an employee who helps her. Her employee is able to earn an income and help support her own family. It is a real win-win for all!

“Microcredit Plus” is the name that Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education. Each month, a facilitator from the organization meets with the women and conducts educational training sessions with the ladies in their own language and using drawings, role playing and pictures.

Isabel and her friends in the Trust Bank look forward to a brighter and more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their communities. They are grateful to Kiva investors for funding their loans. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy various vegetables like corn, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and onions to sell.

loans.name: Magnolia Lucia

texts.es:
Magnolia es una señora con 50 años de edad, soltera y tiene dos hijos con 13 y 19 años de edad, los cuales ama con todas sus fuerzas. Desde hace poco monto su propio negocio, un restaurante el cual ubico en un local arrendado por un familiar, el problema que tiene es que este no se encuentra en buen estado y no es el adecuado para el manejo de alimentos.
Es por esto que solicita un crédito, el cual lo invertirá en el arreglo del local, colocará techo, organizará la cocina y pondrá una reja.

Su meta es continua trabajando para cumplir el sueño de comprar una vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijas, pues su bienestar le preocupa.

La actividad que realiza Sandra para sobrevivir con los suyos es digna de aplauso y la hacen merecedora de la ayuda que solicita, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Magnolia is a 50-year old woman. She is single and has two children, ages 13 and 19, who she loves with all of her heart. A little while ago, she set up her own business of a restaurant, which is located in a spot rented by a family member. The problem that she has is that it is not in a good state and is not adequate for food handling.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan to invest in arranging the restaurant, placing a roof, organizing the kitchen and putting up a fence. Her goal is to continue working to achieve her dream of buying a house and paying for her daughters' education because their wellbeing worries her. The job that she does to survive on her own is worthy of applause and makes her deserving of the help that she is asking for. Go for it, make a loan.
