loans.use: to invest in arranging the restaurant, placing a roof, organizing the kitchen and putting up a fence.

loans.name: Agostinha

texts.en:
Agostinha is 52 years old and she is married. Every day she sees that all the women are always dependent on their husbands, so one day she thought to help her husband, so that her husband could feel lighter in his responsibilities to the household.

So, she began to open her small business. She has been involved in business activities since a few years ago, with her own working capital, and she does her best with it.

She started with a small store, so she is requesting a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more additional items to keep in her store including salts, cooking oils, detergents, cigarettes, candies, eggs and other things to sell. She will improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy salts, cooking oils, detergents, cigarettes, candies, eggs and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Francine

texts.es:
Sandra es una señora con 42 años de edad, casada y tiene dos hijas con 13 y 18 años de edad, por necesidad económica esta señora se dedica a realizar manualidades desde su casa, hace aretes, collares y otros. Su mayor deseo es abrir su primer local, formalizar su negocio y cumplir el sueño de pagar la educación de sus hijas, pues su bienestar le preocupa.

Los ingresos obtenidos por las ventas no son suficientes para Sandra, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de alicate, hilo, alambre, agujas, y perlas. Con esto espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de progresar, permiten ver en esta señora unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 42-year-old woman who is married and has two daughters, one 13 and the other 18 years old. To meet her financial needs, she works from her home making handcrafted jewelry, including earrings, necklaces, and other things. Her greatest wish is to open her first shop, formalize her business, and achieve her dream of paying for her daughters' education, since she worries about their well-being.

The income that Sandra currently earns through her sales isn't sufficient to meet her needs. For this reason she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy pliers, thread, wire, needles, and beads. This will help her to improve her sales, gain more customers, and increase her income.

With her positive attitude and desire to get ahead, it is evident that Sandra has an immense will to succeed, and that, of course, she will receive a favorable response to her loan request.

loans.use: to buy pliers, thread, wire, needles, and beads.

loans.name: Juvinal

texts.en: Juvinal is 35 years old. He began building his home a few years ago with his own working capital and until now his house has not been completed. Now he plans to add ceramic tile inside his home but his money is not enough to buy more materials. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 from the Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials like sand, cement, ceramic, and other materials. He is very happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for this because with it will help him to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, ceramic, and other materials for his home.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elsa has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is a 32-year-old Father from the Same district in Timor Leste. He lives with his wife and 5 children. He is a journalist which allows him to support his family and his wife is housewife. The family works together to provide a good life for their five children.

A loan of $1000 will help Julio to send his children to school. He hopes that by continuing his children’s education they will have more opportunities and a better life. The money will be used to cover educational costs including textbooks and a backpack for his youngest daughter.

loans.use: to pay educational costs including textbooks and a backpack for his youngest daughter.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 51 years old, married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina has very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2014 with her own working capital of $200 and she makes her best of it. She has a small store so she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital because her capital is not enough. She will use this loan to buy more items to keep in her store including: candies, soaps, cooking oils, noodles, cigarettes, biscuits and other things to sell. With this loan she wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, soaps, cooking oils, noodles, cigarettes, biscuits and other things to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a business buying and selling seashells in the Philippines. Mildred has repaid a previous loan.

Mildred is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more seashells to sell. She dreams of one day saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seashells to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed to practice aviculture.

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 34 years old and is married with three children who are all enrolled in school. For the past 12 years, she has been a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. Flordeluna has borrowed and repaid 18 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Flordeluna is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farm. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and be able to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera, su compañero de vida murió hace un año y medio, tiene 2 hijos pero ya no están con ella, porque cada uno tiene su propio hogar, ella vive solo con una hermana.

Susana, siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo del campo, pues fue lo que le enseño su pareja y lo continuo haciendo pues fue un medio para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella siembre maíz, pero desde hace 2 años se dedica a la siembra de plátanos, está es la segunda vez que siembra este tipo de cultivo, actualmente tiene 3,500 metros cuadrados ya sembrados, su lugar de trabajo está a 35 minutos de su casa y se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. por que tiene que estar a las 6:00 a.m. en el trabajo.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas para preparar la tierra y sembrar plátanos.

Su sueño es poder comprar un vehículo para comercializar su producto.
texts.en: Susana is 45 year old. She studied up to third grade. She is a single mother: her domestic partner died a year and a half ago. She has two children, but they are not with her anymore, because each of them has his own home. She lives only with a sister. Susana has always worked in the fields, because her partner taught her this type of work which she continued as the means of supporting her children. She plants corn, but for 2 years she has been planting bananas. This is the second time she grows this type of crop. Currently, she has 3500 square meters already planted. Her place of work is located 35 minutes from her home, and she gets up at 5:00 a.m., because she needs to be at work at 6:00 a.m. She will invest the loan to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land and plant bananas. Her dream is to be able to buy a vehicle in order to sell her product.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the soil and plant bananas.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Flordeliza buys and sells oysters in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Flordeliza requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more oysters to sell.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell.

loans.name: Marculino

texts.en:
Marculino is a 31-year-old married father with one child. He is a teacher who works hard to support his family. His wife is housewife. Although Marculino works very hard, it has been difficult to afford the cost of his education. 

Marculino is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to allow him to attend university. He will use his loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. Marculino loves his family very much and hopes that furthering his education will help them to have a brighter and happier future.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Renuka is a 29-year-old married lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India.

She is a grocer by profession and is a mother of two beautiful daughters. Her family does not have access to a toilet. Her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields.

Renuka, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes in it. The loan will help her get access to a toilet and maintain her privacy and thereby promote cleanliness in the community.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes.

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.en:
Umbelina is 56 years old. She is married and a businesswoman. Every day, Umbelina sees all the women who are dependent on her husband. One day, she thought to help her husband so that he could lighten his financial responsibilities for their family, so Umbelina used her own working capital of 500 USD to open her general store. Since 2002, she has made the best of her store. 

Umbelina is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more items to keep in her store such as noodles, cooking oils, sugar, biscuits, sardines, cigarettes, lighters, candies, rice, hard drinks, and other items to sell. She will use her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cooking oils, sugar, biscuits, sardines, cigarettes, lighters, candies, rice, hard drinks, and other items to sell

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg A-4 Group

texts.en:
Parwati, 56, is the featured borrower of Maa Tarini Shg A-4. She is standing to the middle in the photograph. She works for a daily wage in the agricultural farms. In order to maximize her efforts, she is running a small-scale animal husbandry business too. The family of four earns a monthly household income of 8,000 INR. Half of the income is used for expenses, and they end up saving 4,000 INR per month.

Parwati has bigger dreams: the dream of making her son highly educated and seeing him become successful in his life.

Parwati, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the banking course fees of her son. Parwati aspires to see her son become a successful banker and excel in the banking industry.

loans.use: to pay the banking course fees of her son.

loans.name: Kounalai Group

texts.fr: Fatimata est âgée de 39 ans mariée mère d'un enfant. elle exerce son activité depuis 14 ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son accueil de la clientèle, la satisfaction de la clientèle et son écoute de la clientèle. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des habits à 35 000 F ; des chaussures à 15 000 F et des plats à 50 000 F. l'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner son activités afin de renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt deux fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Fatimata is 39 years old, married and mother of one child. She has been practicing her trade for 14 years. What makes her business work, is her welcome of clients, clients' satisfaction and the way she listens to clients.

She wants the loan to buy clothes for 35 000F, shoes for 15 000F and dishes for 50 000F. The purpose of the loan is to stock up in order to build her activity. She has already received a loan twice and has reimbursed ACFIME according to the planned dates.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for 35 000F, shoes for 15 000F and dishes for 50 000F.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигул уроженка города Турсунзаде. Она спокойная и миролюбивая женщина. Она замужняя мать 5 детей. Муж Мавчигул работает таксистом. У Мавчигул 5 летний опыт работы в сфере шитья. Она с легкостью может сшить платье на любой вкус и фасон. К сожалению, дом Мавчигул нуждается в капитальном ремонте, но средств на это у семьи недостаточно. Чтобы вовремя успеть закончить ремонт до наступления холодов Мавчигул обратилась за кредитом. Она очень ждет положительного ответа с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Mavjigul is a native of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is a calm and peace-loving woman, married and the mother of five children. Her husband works as a taxi driver and she has five years of experience in sewing. She can easily sew dresses to any taste or fashion. 

Unfortunately, Mavjigul's house needs major renovations but her family doesn't have enough money for them. In order to finish the renovations before winter comes, she is looking for a loan. She eagerly awaits a positive result from you.

loans.use: To renovate her home

loans.name: Saqer

texts.en:
Saqer is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Saqer took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a 39 year old green grocer at Mikindani Mombasa Kenya. He is a married father of three whose wife supports with additional income and has been in this business for the last five years doing well.

This is his first borrowing from from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase fruits and vegetables in his kiosk and the anticipated to profit to expand and bring in dry cereals. 

He hopes to own a kiosk with all grocery under one roof in future.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past six years, selling meat goat. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Pashmeena

texts.en:
Pashmeena is 48 years old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 1 child. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Pashmeena is providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold.
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Pashmeena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wants to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Taririo Yemadzimai Group

texts.en:
In Harare, early in the morning just after 3am, a woman named Bessie wakes and sits on her hand driven sewing machine and starts sewing. Bessie has three electric sewing machines, but due to power-cuts, she is usually forced to use her hand driven machine in candle light. When the sun rises, Bessie travels to her workshop in the city to finish off her work. Her main products are curtains, sofa covers, bedspreads and other interior decor products. She also occasionally sews wedding decorations whenever she gets orders.

Bessie is a hardworking 31-year-old mother. She wishes to build a better future for her three children. She wants to expand her business but lacks funding. She has joined hands with other three women and attended financial training at Thrive Microfinance. Their group is called Taririo Yemadzimai. Bessie will use her portion of the Kiva loan to buy an overlocking machine. The Tariro Yemadzimai group hopes that a $950 loan from Kiva will help them realise their dream of a brighter future for their families.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine to reduce costs.

loans.name: Maroofa Jan

texts.en:
Maroofa jan is 55 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and she is a mother of 6 children. Her husband has been running his own business as a plastics wholesaler for past 19 years. He is the guardian of the family and manage the entire house hold

Maroofa jan's husband needs to buy plastics in bulk and other commodities for reselling purpose, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Maroofa jan has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for reselling purpose to earn maximum profitable income, this profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of family and business.
Maroofa jan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's wholesale plastics business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 52 years old and a widow with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Francisca has a knitting business in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her knitting business.

Francisca has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her knitting business.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es: Ruth de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijol, maicillo, loroco y jocotes desde hace 20 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y gracias a esas ventas es como ella puede salir adelante con su familia, la clienta esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ruth is 47-years old.  She lives in her own home with her five children.  She has made her living growing corn, beans, sorghum, "loroco" (an edible flower) and "jocotes" (a tropical fruit) for more than twenty years.   Ruth sells her produce in neighboring villages, and thanks to those sales she is able to get ahead alongside her family.  Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase compost and fertilizers so she can keep working and improve her financial income.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 46-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Adnan took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emee has a buy and sell sea shells business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Emee requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea shells to sell.

In the future, Emee would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea shells to sell.

loans.name: Merelin

texts.en:
Merelin is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Merelin dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Laarni dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rylen

texts.en:
Rylen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rylen dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wafeeqa

texts.en: Wafeeqa is a 58 years old; she is responsible of her three children`s education, that's why she had to find a source of income in addition to her work as nurse. So Wafeeqa started to buy cosmetic products at a good price and re-sell from home to her friends and neighbors at market price. Now she is applying for a loan in order to get more quantity of the cosmetic products to promote and sell it to beauty salons in the area.

loans.use: to get more quantities of cosmetic products to promote and sell it to beauty salons in the area.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, sugar, and salt. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, sack of salt and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, sack of salt and wheat flour

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
The first in his family to attend college, Jean Pierre plans to major in either Communications with a Concentration in Business or Health Care Management. He will decide on a a career path in the coming year and graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. During his studies, he plans to identify what services and products are most absent in his community in the field he chooses for study. His ultimate goal is to do his part to employ and lift up his fellow Rwandans.

Jean Pierre is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He chose Kepler because of its ability to provide the technology and communications skills he needs to start his career.
He likes to play chess.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
He is 23 years old and currently a final year student at Thika Technical Training Institute in Thika town, Kiambu, Kenya. He is pursuing a certificate course in masonry and concreting. He comes from a family of 2 brothers and 8 sisters with both of his parents working as peasant farmers.

He will be the first sibling to enroll and complete higher education. After high school, he worked as an unskilled laborer for one year. Using the small income he had saved, he was able to join enroll for college education. During the holidays he strives to get employment as a semi -skilled artisan in building and construction. However this income is not enough to sustain him through school.

His aim is finish college and using the skills he acquires to work and also further his education. Through this he will be able to support his parents in raising his siblings and also be a role model to other young men in his community, that they too can set and achieve their goals in a bid towards poverty eradication.
He requests for a loan to pay for his school fees and finish his education. This will facilitate him realize his goals.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees and upkeep for his studies in masonry and concreting

loans.name: Bateefu Primary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is James. He is the Head teacher of Bateefu School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mutundwe in Kampala district with 360 students. Bateefu School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bateefu School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. James ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Esther, 52, is married and has a cheerful family of one school age child. Esther belongs the group called nkome nfa group of four members who have come together to support each other in achieving their individual dreams. The group needs a total loan of GHS 3,500 to sell food stuff, soft drinks, corn and cassava dough, and second hand clothing. Esther will receive GHS 600 which she needs to purchase vegetables (tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs and onions) for her business. She has been doing this business 5 years to ensure her family would have enough money for their basic needs. Esther uses profit from this business to support her family and her child’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.

In the future, Esther plans to support her child to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day, she will become an as business woman. She thanks you for supporting her group.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, tomato, pepper, garden eggs and onions for her business.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is the proud owner of Beyond the Tenure Track. She founded her business after graduating from Rutgers University with a Ph.D. in Cultural Anthropology. She has been in business for more than two years and is now ready to grow to the next level.

Fatimah’s business supports graduate students and faculty in exploring and transitioning to alternative careers that match their individual passions. Fatimah speaks, writes, and coaches on career planning. She also offers courses and one-on-one coaching. Fatimah maintains a blog and has hundreds of followers who rely on her advice and resources. Her followers say her presentations are “inspiring” and “helpful to regain the focus needed to be successful in today’s competitive job market.”

One of her clients said about Fatimah, "Her insights, experience, and generosity made an enormously positive impact on our graduate-student career workshop. She was as inspiring and effective in addressing a group of 200 as she was in her individual interactions with students; we only wish we could have cloned her for all the panels that day.”

A Kiva loan from you will help her access the funding she needs to pursue her vision publish a book with her ground-breaking ideas.

loans.use: to contract an editor to copyedit and lay out her book to prepare for publishing.

loans.name: Willma

texts.en:
Willma is a single mother, with two children, with her own house which is made of adobe Willma makes cheese. She learned when she was a child about this business.

She needs a loan to buy a milking cow and hopes you can help her, because she is the only support for her family. Willma wants to increase her milk production to make more cheese

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is taxi driver living in VAnadzor town with his wife. Using his own car, Armen has been providing taxi service for already 3 years. He was able to gain number of loyal customers and drives both in and out of Vanadzor town. 
Armen asks lender to help him with this loan and enable to pay for  renovation of the engine of the car.
He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Armen to be able to continue his business and sustain his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the engine of the car to be able to continue taxi driving service

loans.name: Douglas Eberto

texts.es: Douglas de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, se dedica al cultivo de granos bascios y a la crianza de ganado desde hace 19 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas es como ha podido salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Douglas, age 39, lives in his own house with his wife and their son. He has been growing basic grains and raising livestock for 19 years. He sells his products at the different markets that are close to his house. With the earnings that he gets from the sales he has been able to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc. He will also improve the land, which is shown in the photo. He will do this in order to be able to continue with his work and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 54 years old. She lives in Borjomi district with her son. Tamar is unemployed and the family lives in poverty. Tamar owns a flat and she decided to rent it out in order to generate profit, but she does not have the money for renovation.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1300 USD. With the received credit she will renovate the flat and will rent it out. Tamar will generate stable income and will be able to cover all expenses. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to generate more income

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a florist who emigrated from Mexico to the United States over 10 years ago. She and a business partner started a flower shop right away, and they worked hard to build a successful business in Paterson. It was this business and her husband's hard work in construction that allowed her to support her two young children.

Unfortunately, last year, Angelica and her business partner decided to split. Not wanting to give up her passion of making and selling flowers, Angelica had to start over and begin a new business from scratch.

Despite having a decade of experience in the industry, this past year has still been difficult for Angelica. She did not have a storefront and had to keep her floral arrangements in a fridge in her home. She began making sales thanks to her connections with past customers, and over the past few months, she has been successful enough to begin renting out space inside a store in Paterson. This is a temporary space, and Angelica is already looking for a new storefront that she can occupy by herself.

This loan will help Angelica make the move, a major step toward bringing her new business to the heights of her old one.

loans.use: to help move her flower business from her house to a storefront.

loans.name: Edith Noemy

texts.es:
Edith, de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hijo de 12 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, su madre la regalo cuando ella tenía cinco años de edad, situación que la llevo a tener que vivir experiencias desagradables. 

Edith, tiene una tienda desde hace 10 años, anteriormente trabajó como empleada doméstica o también lavaba y planchaba ropa ajena; ahora tiene su pequeño negocio en donde le ha dado trabajo a otra persona que está en las mismas condiciones que paso ella años atrás y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. todos los días.

El dinero que solicita Edith, es para comprar productos para la tienda como arroz, frijoles, pan, café, detergente, entre otros, porque desde hace un mes atrás, se dispuso a mejorar las condiciones de instalación de la tienda y se descapitalizo y está dejando de invertir en mercadería.

El sueño más grande de Edith, es que su hija no pase los momentos tan difíciles que ella tuvo que pasar y que ella se prepare académicamente para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Edith, 33 years old, is a single mother of a 12-year-old girl. She has a sixth-grade education. Her mother gave her away when she was five years old, a situation that led her to have to live through difficult experiences.

Edith has had a store for the past 10 years. Previously, she worked as a domestic employee or also washed and ironed clothing for others. Now, she has her own small business, where she has provided work for another person that is in the same condition that she was in years ago. Her work schedule is from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm, every day.

The money that Edith is requesting is to purchase products for the store, such as rice, beans, bread, coffee, detergent, and others. One month ago, she set out to improve the conditions in her store. Now, she is undercapitalized and has not been investing in merchandise.

Edith's greatest dream is that her daughter does not live through the difficult moments that she went through, and that she has academic training to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy products for her store such as rice, beans, bread, coffee, detergent, and others.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
A 50-year-old widow who lives in a small wooden house located in Battambang province, Chantha has one dependent son to look after. To support the living, she is growing rice. She has been in this business for ten years. Since her rice farming business is based on rainfall, it grows slowly and produces low outputs.

Thus, Chantha is now leading a three-member group to apply for a loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan to build a well to get water for her family's uses and to irrigate her farmland, hoping that it can enable her to have enough water to do farming for the whole growing season. She also hopes to expand the current business and upgrade the standard of living.

loans.use: to build a well to get water for her family's uses to upgrade the standard of living.

loans.name: Muhand

texts.en:
Muhand is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Muhand took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Don Mario de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 7 años a la agricultura al cultivo de granos basicos, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos y con las ganancias es como el sale adelante en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Mario, age 55, lives in his own house with his wife. He has been growing basic grains for seven years. When he has the harvest, he sells it in surrounding towns. He has a lot of fixed customers. He gets ahead in his household with the earnings.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc. He will do this in order to be able to continue with his crops because this is his only source of work. This way he will have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a 34 year man who makes mats for hotels from coconut palms.

For the last eleven years she has been in this business doing well, he is married and has been blessed with two children.

This marks his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business.

He will use the loan to purchase a motorcycle for a second business and also to transport his products to clients.

He hopes to grow his business big in future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 32 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Diana works very hard to provide for them.

Diana has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Diana has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Diana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a charcoal retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling banana.

Virgilia dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana , de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no siguió estudiando debido a sus escasos recursos económico, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos pero solo 2 están con ellos.

Ana, desde hace 20 años se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, pero desde hace 2 años puso una venta de tortillas, ella comenzó como empleada en la tortillería, pero la dueña ya no quiso vender y se la dejo a ella, su negocio se encuentra a 2 cuadras de su casa y su día comienza a las 4:00 a.m. pues a esa hora hay que coser el maíz porque a las 8:30 a.m. tiene que ir al molino y a las 10:00 a.m. comienza a vender tortilla y regresar a la casa a las 6:00 p.m. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz y leña para hacer las tortillas.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, comprar una plancha industrial y que sus hijos se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Ana, age 42, went to school through the ninth grade. She did not continue her education due to scarce financial resources. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She has three children, but only two live with them. Ana has worked in agriculture for 20 years.

However, she has been selling tortillas for two years. She started as an employee in a tortilla business. However, the owner did not want to sell and left it to her. Her business is two blocks from her house. Her day starts at 4:00 a.m. because she has to cook the corn at this time. At 8:30 she has to go to the mill, and at 10:00 a.m. she starts to sell tortillas. She returns home at 6:00 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy corn and firewood to make the tortillas.

Her dream is to improve her business, to buy an industrial griddle, and for her children to be academically prepared.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind. She is very ambitious and she has a willpower that led her to be a productive woman in her community. She is always looking for activities that can improve the family income.
She bought a sewing machine and trained on it until she became a professional. She started to make clothes and some products and sell them so that helped her to cover some of the household expenses.
She is 45 years old lives married and mother of five children, and she is sole breadwinner for her kids.

Huda is requesting financial help to buy more fabrics and yarns, so she can invest in setting up her business and attracting clients and in this way create a positive impact on her earnings.
Her dream is to become a big tailor that provides a good income and creates jobs to the women who needs jobs to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and yarns and she can invest in setting up her business and attracting clients.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en: Thary, who is 35 years old and married, lives in Kampong Cham province. She is blessed with a son who is now in school and need her supports. She and her husband are growing rice and they spend their rest time to work as paid workers to supplement their income. Rice which is harmed by insect pests and unseasonable rain returns her lower yields. Thus, she is now applying for a loan support from VisionFund, which is the first cycle for her, to buy organic fertilizer to boost her crop yield. She hopes that the crop will return high yields and she is able to keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost her crop yield so that she can earn more income to keep her son in school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Neangheang's Group

texts.en: Neangheang’s group live in a rural village in Battambnag province in Cambodia. Neangheang works as farmer and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Grupo Xejuyup Sector 2 Group

texts.es:
Sheyla es una joven de 20 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de un hijo de un año de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xejuyup.
Sheyla para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia desde hace tres años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde la comodidad de su hogar, y esto le permite cuidar mejor de su familia. Sheyla con el afán de mejorar su trabajo y brindarles a los clientes un mejor servicio solicita un préstamo para la compra de más materia prima tales como: hilos, de tipo seda, alemán y lustrina para seguir elaborando ropa típica.
Su gran sueño es ampliar su negocio de elaboración de ropa típica para brindarle a la gente un mejor servicio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sheyla is 20, single, and has a lovely family, comprised of a one-year-old son. This humble family lives in a village by the name of Xejuyup.
In order to make money and support her family, Sheyla has been weaving traditional clothing for three years.
She works at home, which is very comfortable and allows her to better care for her family.
With the aims of improving her products and providing a better service, Sheyla asks for a loan to buy more materials, such as silk thread, German thread, and embroidery floss, to keep weaving traditional clothing.
Her greatest dream is to expand her business to provide a better service and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy materials to weave traditional clothing.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 35-years-old married woman, living with her family in Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a bakery in their hometown; he sells kinds of cakes, rusks, milk packs, biscuits, and juices. He purchases the inventories in large quantity from a nearby bakery and sells it from his bakery. Now he wants to offer additional different types of sweets to his customers but does not have sufficient amount to buy these additional sweets.

Therefore, she has requested a loan so that her husband can buy his desired sweets to sell. He wants to prepare these sweets at home so that he can generate maximum income. He will make some saving with the profit amount and hopes in future he will prepare all sweets by himself.
Zahida thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of sweets for her husband' s bakery.

loans.name: Try's Group

texts.en: Try’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Try makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Shara

texts.en:
Shara has been in business for the past nine months. She is the proud owner of Direct Emergency Medical Services, an emergency and non-emergency transport business that serves residents of Bergen county in New Jersey.

Before opening her business, Shara worked in a physical therapy office and learned the ins and outs of health insurance billing. Shara learned about the need for private ambulance services through her work experience and from her brother who is an EMT. She poured her personal savings into starting the business and used her own money to purchase the company’s first three vehicles. Each vehicle had to be inspected and licensed.

Shara’s greatest success to date is securing a contract with the state of New Jersey to provide ambulance services for Medicare patients. Her largest difficulty now is raising the capital to meet the demand for her services. Shara has struggled with her personal credit in the past and hopes to use this loan as an opportunity to rebuild.

Shara and her business will greatly benefit from a Kiva loan from you. She will use the funds to purchase a new vehicle and for working capital to ensure consistent employment for her ambulance drivers. Though Shara works very hard running her business and she maintains a part time job on the side, she is happy pursuing her dream as a business owner.

loans.use: to purchase another vehicle.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 32 years old married with five children and support plus two dependents. He runs a business of motorcycle services for the last 5 years. Right now his monthly income is ksh 30,000.

He is borrowing a loan of ksh100,959 to buy a motorcycle for transporting goods and service from one place to another. He would use the profit to repay the loan and pay school fees for his children.

This is his first loan from visionfund Kenya. His dream and for future business is to buy a motor vehicle and educate his children to the higher level as well as to be finacially stable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting  goods from market and customers from one  place to another.

loans.name: Gretchen Faith

texts.en:
Gretchen Faith has received a loan to finance essential beauty supplies for her salon. She is glad that she was able to invest in this kind of business, which gives her not only income but fulfillment for doing what she loves most.

She thanks God for Kiva and CCT for using them as instruments to assist small business people like her. She trusts she can still request a 30,000 PHP loan to buy the regular needs of her salon such hair dyes, shampoo, hot oil, conditioner, hair scissors. Her passion for beauty and her charming personality makes people come to her salon.

Gretchen Faith dreams of having a bigger salon and prays to always have a happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 30 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenny has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Jenny requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fritzel Joy

texts.en:
Fritzel Joy is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fritzel Joy has a buy and sell sea shells business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Fritzel Joy requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea shells to sell.

In the future, Fritzel Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea shells to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is married with children, and they are attending school. He deals in crude salt, and operates a retail shop. Through that, he is able to meet his family needs.

Godfrey's dream is to educate his children to high levels of learning, because he feels that is the best thing he can ever give his children. He works so hard towards his dream, so now requests for money to buy more crude salt since it sells like hot cakes in his area.

However, Godfrey lacks enough capital to do so. He is requesting for money to buy more salt for selling so that his income levels can improve and thus be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more salt for selling.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with five children two of whom attend school. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food.
She has operated a farming business for the past five years selling mangoes and oranges .She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan, Beatrice plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming. She decided to join yehu to access loans and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do her farming business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a divorced mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 
With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale

loans.name: Mana

texts.en: Mana is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwest Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her sister, her brother, and her parents. Her family owns one hectare of rice field and one pig. In May 2014, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Mana makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal feed. Thanks to the loan, she will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is married with four children grows and harvest rice, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband also as farmer who works for their farm since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. She gets up early with her husband and has to go to the fields where they had to oversee their crops. Rosela is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement.  In the future,she wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Mundonido

texts.en: Mundonido resides in Lapasan, Clarin with his one child. He has operated a piggery for a year now and it is doing well. He borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy piglets for his piggery. He wants to improve his piggery in order to earn more and save little by little from a portion of his income for the future education of his child.

loans.use: to buy piglets for his piggery.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling fruits and vegetables. Andrea dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store, and fattening pigs businesses in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosita dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Glosyll

texts.en:
Mary Glosyll is 28 years old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Glosyll has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Glosyll requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Mary Glosyll has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mary Glosyll would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 51 years old. She lives in in a wooden house with with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her son, who is still studying. Her 3 other children are already working and/or married. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field.

In 2001 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Kong makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field and to extend her lending business.Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is married with 2 children. He owns a photo studio and also deals in transport business. He is able to cater for his family welfare through income got from the businesses, as well as save. He wants to improve his family house. He has 80% of the money that he needs to do so, however still lacks the 20% to achieve his dream.

ackson is a very hardworking man and can be trusted with a loan. This is proved by his saving culture that he has. He is now requesting for money to buy more construction materials like sand and cement for constructing his house.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials like sand and cement for constructing his house.

loans.name: Yorangel

texts.es: Yorangel de 35 años habita en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar y desde niño su padre que era agricultor le inculcó el amor por el campo y los animales; cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad se inclinó por la comercialización de carne de cerdo y encontró la manera de crecer comercialmente a través de su alquiler de lavadoras. En su gran mayoría sus clientes son vecinos y residentes del sector en el municipio que no poseen en sus viviendas estos electrodomésticos que le permitan realizar esta labor con menos esfuerzo y un ahorro significativo de agua, así mismo promueve su venta de carne de cerdo entre la misma comunidad. Todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. esta dispuesto a atender a su clientela y en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual surtirá con carne de cerdo y comprará dos lavadoras. Esta inversión le permitirá reponer dos electrodomésticos averiados que le están mermando sus servicios y con ello sus ingresos. Yorangel es padre de dos hijos y reside con su cónyuge, su meta es continuar ampliando sus negocios al incrementar su número de lavadoras a 30 y ser mayorista de cerdos.  Su meta familiar seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yorangel, age 35, lives in a neighborhood in Cartagena de Indias, a municipality in the Bolívar department. Ever since he was a boy his father, who was a farmer, instilled in him the love of the field and animals. When he became an adult he leaned towards selling pork. He found the way to grow commercially through the rental of washers.

Most of his customers are neighbors and residents of an area in the municipality where they do not have domestic appliances in their homes that allow them to do this work with less effort and significantly save water At the same time he promotes his pork sales in the same community. He is ready to tend to his clientele every day from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

He is requesting a Kiva loan, his first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to stock pork and to buy two washers. This investment will allow him to replace two damaged domestic appliances that are decreasing his services and his earnings.

Yorangel has two children, and he lives with his wife.

His goal is to continue expanding his businesses by increasing his number of washers to 30 and to be a pig wholesaler. His family goal is to continue supporting his children's education.

loans.use: to stock pork and to buy two washers.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 20 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her family. She has 4 brothers and sisters who all work in the family fields.Her family owns 10 hectares of rice fields and 1 hectare of cassava field.

In 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Sreyneang makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal food, fertilizer and diesel for the fields Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Nadie

texts.en:
Nadie is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive academic credentials, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Nadie chose to attend Kepler because of its focus on providing the skills she'll need to compete in a competitive business environment.
 
Nadie plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to start her own business that employs people from her community—while also supporting her siblings through their education.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Khuderbat

texts.en: Mr. Khuderbat is one of our trustworthy clients and he lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been making and selling boots to local people for more than 15 years. Their son began going to elementary school last year. Using his previous loan he has renovated his house and created comfortable living condition for his family. Now he is requesting a loan of 1500 USD to build a greenhouse on his land in order to grow vegetables such as potatoes, carrots and cabbages. By doing so he won't be buying vegetables from outside and save money in times of economic recession in Mongolia.

loans.use: to build greenhouse in order to grow vegetables

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en: Cecilio is married and lives in Mialen with his family. He earns better income from his transportation business and was able to support his child's education. He also bought some home appliances from his generated income. His previous loan was used for maintenance of hid vehicle and it was repaid successfully. To make his services more comfortable and safe, he took a new loan recently to purchase spare parts for the repair of his transport vehicle. He plans to use his profit for improvement of his residence house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the repair of his transport vehicle.

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en:
Mark Anthony is 18 years old and is from Laur, Nueva Ecija. With farming as his family’s source of income, his parents find it hard to send him to college because of their unstable income. 

Mark requested an education loan from ASKI for 43,000 PHP, which he will use to support his nine months of schooling. He is studying microfinance technology.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda has been doing business through charcoal making for many years and she earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also has a banana farm where she earns more income for her needs. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more coconut shell for charcoal making. She has a desire to improve the business and have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut shell for charcoal making.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling banana. Shirley is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary Lourd

texts.en:
Mary Lourd is 27 years old, married with one kid. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Lourd has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Mary Lourd requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell.

Mary Lourd has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mary Lourd would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with four children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her  own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Alvaro Enrique

texts.es: Álvaro es un comerciante de 54 años, habitante de Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, nombrada oficialmente como distrito turístico y cultural por la gran historia que en ella reposa. Como el turismo se convirtió en un factor potencial de la ciudad gracias a sus atractivos naturales y su rica historia, Álvaro consideró como una oportunidad de negocio ofrecer a los visitantes de las playas cervezas, las cuales con muy consumidas entre los bañistas gracias al clima tropical de la zona. Él pudo emprender su idea de negocio con el apoyo de un amigo quien le suministró el capital inicial y de este modo cuenta con veinte años comercializando este producto en las playas y brindando bienestar a su familia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aprovisionarse de cervezas al por mayor y comprar un botellero. Con esta inversión podrá manejar un stock de productos en su vivienda y tener a la mano un amplio surtido para su negocio.
texts.en:
Alvaro, 54, is a vendor living in Cartagena de Indias, a city in the department of Bolívar that has been recognized as a tourist and cultural district owing to the impressive history that rests upon it.

Since tourism is a potential factor for the city, thanks to the beauty of its landscape and its rich heritage, Alvaro considered the opportunity of a business selling beer on the beaches. Beer is on high demand by beachgoers thanks to the tropical climate of this zone.

Alvaro was able to start his business with the support of a friend who provided the startup capital, and for twenty years he's continued working on the beach and thus providing for the well-being of his family.

He is now applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy a supply of beers at wholesale, and a bottle rack. With this investment, he will be able to manage his stock at home and have an ample selection of products at hand for his business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of beers at wholesale and a bottle rack.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and three children. Her husband owns a small gemstones shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case, for the attraction of customers.
He is the family's sole source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children, and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.
Therefore, Saima has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan funds so her husband can buy precious gemstones, which will enable him to increase his earnings.

She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members may pass their lives comfortably. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy precious gemstones for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Chhel's Group

texts.en: Chhel’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chhel makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors is from Phnomsrok, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 37 years old. She lives in a wooden traditionnal khmer house with her parents. Her family owns 5 hectares of rice field and 5 cows.

In 2013, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Samphors makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses and to buy fertilizer for the field.
Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.
Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Lolok

texts.en:
Lolok is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwest Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her parents and her younger brother. She is a young and very motivated weaver. Her family owns 7 hectares of rice field, 1.5 hectares of cassava field, and 8 pigs. In 2013, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Lolok makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal feed, fertilizer, and diesel for the field.
Most importantly, she wants to make her family business grow with her salary.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Chhoeut

texts.en:
Chhoeut is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwest Cambodia. He is 32 years old. He lives in a wooden house with his wife. They have an 8-year-old daughter who lives at their grandparents' house in a village close by as they have lots of work for the moment. His family owns 5 hectares of cassava fields and 3 hectares of rice fields.

In 2013, he was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Chhoeut makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field, and to repair his house. Thanks to the loan, he will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Vary

texts.en:
Vary is 21 years old, single and from the Takeo Province in Cambodia. Currently, he is studying as a Finance and Banking major in his third year at a university in the city. Vary is also working as a waiter since 2014, earning approximately $6 per day to help pay his fees.

Due to the fact that he lacks the finances to pay his tuition fees from the third to the fourth year, therefore he would like a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fee and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For his future goals, he wants to save money to run his own business, so he will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the third to the fourth year for his BA in Finance and Banking

loans.name: Judy Ann

texts.en:
Judy Ann is 18 years old and from Bangad Casiong, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija.

She is starting a 6-month bookkeeping course through ASKI. She wants to take an education loan of 33,000 PHP through KIVA because her parents can’t pay for her schooling.

She wants to finish this course and hopefully find a stable job so she can help her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

location.town: Bangad Casiong, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija

loans.name: Arjay

texts.en:
Arjay is 19 years old and is from Dianed, Dipaculao, Aurora. He is taking a nine-month microfinance technology course in the ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute. He is eager to finish schooling and find a stable job that will help alleviate his family's life. 

Arjay requested an education loan for 43,000 PHP, which he will use to sustain his schooling.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Ma. Gelma

texts.en:
Ma.Gelma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a buy and sell fish crackers in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her fish cracker business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Ma.Gelma dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her fish cracker business.

loans.name: Phola

texts.en: A 25-year-old married woman whose name is Phola is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other one is under the age of school. In order to support the living, she along with her husband has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee to supplement income. They have been doing their farming business for seven years, earning about USD14 a day and saving approximately about USD5. The unhealthy cassava crop is the challenge to her farming business and causes her to earn a very low income. Phola is requesting for a loan from VisionFund to save her business. The past loan enabled her to earn good income to support the living and send her children to school. For this new loan, she will use it to renovate her house to be in good condition. She hopes to have a comfortable and safety house to stay.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to provide her children a comfortable and safety house to stay.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Blanca Marisol

texts.es:
Blanca, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, dejo de estudiar cuando se acompaño, su pareja se dedica a la albañilería, tiene una hija de 12 años de edad que está estudiando y con ellos vive su papá, pero solo su hija depende de ella.

Blanca, desde que tiene 10 años se dedica a vender tomates, tostadas, refrescos y más, pero desde hace 2 años tiene una pequeña tienda, ella inicio con $100 que le dio su pareja, pero ahora ya cuenta con un inventario de $350, pero además de la tienda vende ropa para damas y lo hace en los caseríos aledaños a su casa, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. 2 veces por semana y su hija vende en la tienda.

El crédito será invertido para comprar frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel y más.

El sueño de Blanca, es mejorar su tienda y su gran sueño es que su hija se prepare academicamente y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is 33 years old and went to school until the seventh grade. She stopped working when she got together with her partner who works as a bricklayer. She has a 12 year old daughter who is at school. Her father lives with them but only her daughter is dependent on Blanca.
Blanca made a living from the age of ten selling tomatoes, plantain chips, soft drinks and other items. For the past two years she has run a small shop which she started with a gift of $100 from her partner and now has stock worth $350. She also sells womens clothing in the hamlets near her home. She starts work at 07.00 am until 2.00 pm twice a week, her daughter also helps out in the shop. The loan will be invested in the purchase of beans, rice, sugar, oil, paper and other items.
