Blanca's ambition is to improve her shop and her lifelong dream is that her daughter receive an education.She would like to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy beans,rice,sugar,oil,paper and other items.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanthy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver, providing transportation services by using a three-wheel auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw, which has good engine quality but a damaged body. He does not have sufficient cash to buy a new body and seat covers. 

Kalsoom requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers. With the loan, he will be able to smoothly drive his rickshaw.  She hopes that now her husband can generate income to support his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw body and seat covers for her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en: Rin’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Rin makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 19 years old from Bongabon, Nueva Ecija. He is taking up a 9-month Microfinance Technology course in ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute. His parents with four kids cannot provide for all of their needs. That’s why Joshua wants to ask for Php43,000 education loan from the Kiva lenders. He will use this loan to pay for his tuition fee, so he will not be a burden to his parents.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees in Microfinance Technology

loans.name: Arnanie

texts.en:
Arnanie is 19 years old. He is from Taguing, Baggao, Cagayan. His mother is widowed, so she is the only one supporting the family. 

Because of life’s hardships, Arnanie wants to take an education loan of PHP 43,000 to send himself to school. He is taking a nine-month Microfinance Technology course at the ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute. He wants to graduate to help his mother and siblings out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She supplements this income with earnings from her fattening pigs.

Jona dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Corazon dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 24 years old, married with one kid who is in school. 

Jenelyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenelyn has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
RABIA’s age is 26; she is married, living with her husband and a kid in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her financial condition neither good nor bad, her husband earns not enough to contribute household expenses. He is a carpenter and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, cots etc. He has been running this work for many years and has lot of experience. 
Last days her husband became sick and most of the savings spend upon his medical treatment. Now he is healed and hearty but does not to buy raw material for making furniture. Therefore, RABIA requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue and chip boards to continue his business. 
RABIA thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and feeling happy after this loan.

loans.use: to buy wooden raw material for her husband's carpenter work.

loans.name: Toeur's Group

texts.en:
Toeur is 56 years old and she is married. From Banteay Meanchey province, she is working hard in rice growing business to better support the living, especially to her three dependent children. She sometimes works on her co-villager’s farm for a fee to earn additional income in order to meet family’s needs on time. She has been involved in her farming business for over thirty years and it earns her about USD9 per day.

Toeur has been with VisionFund for six cycles already. The previous loans have helped her to earn better income to deal with daily expenses and buy household supplies. Leading a group which consists of three members to get a loan from VisionFund, Toeur will use her it to buy zinc sheets to use in building house. She hopes this loan will fulfill her dream of living in a decent and more comfortable house and keep her children in a safe house.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets to build a more comfortable house in order to keep her children in a safe place.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 73 years old, widow with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Aurora has a pottery business in the Philippines. Aurora requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Aurora has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Aurora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: Chork’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chork makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home system

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en: Benjie is 22 years old from Ura, Dilasag, Aurora. With a big family of 7 children, and a small income from farming, their family is struggling financially. Despite life’s hardships, Benjie is hopeful to finish schooling and find a stable job to help send his siblings to school. Because his parents cannot sustain his schooling, Benjie wants to avail an education loan of PHP43,000 from the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: El Molino Group

texts.es:
El territorio pequeño de una comunidad mexiquense contrasta con la gran historia que mantienen sus calles y campos. Los habitantes son personas muy alegres y trabajadoras en especial las integrantes del grupo El Molino; todas son amas de casa quienes día a día luchan porque sus familias tengan bienestar. Por otro lado, están entusiasmadas pues el mes patrio se encuentra cercano y están haciendo preparativos para tener una celebración especial, el día 15 de septiembre dan el grito de independencia como es costumbre en México al igual que el 16 donde organizan un gran desfile y honores a la bandera.
   Doña Lucia se caracteriza en su grupo por ser muy reservada pero ante todo muy trabajadora y responsable. Vive casada con Margarito y juntos formaron una familia integrada por cinco hijos de los cuales sólo una hija depende de ellos ya que continúa con sus estudios. Doña Lucy, como le llaman de cariño,  se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, bueyes, pollos, pavos y patos desde hace más de 25 años, justo el tiempo que tiene de casada. “Me gusta mucho mi actividad porque veo como nacen los animalitos de sus madres. En cierta ocasión una oveja dio a luz gemelos pero tuvimos que ayudarla a que nacieran y lo hicimos gracias a las técnicas que aprendimos en las capacitaciones” comenta contenta Lucy quien además de la experiencia previa, ha tomado distintos cursos de cuidado y nutrición animal.
   Está muy contenta y agradecida con VF México pues con los créditos ha podido invertir en su actividad y con sus ganancias construyó su casa. Sin embargo aún tiene el deseo de que su hija termine una carrera profesional y tenga una mejor calidad de vida. En esta ocasión planea invertir en terneras y alimento. 
   Las integrantes del grupo también están muy agradecidas con KIVA su confianza es de gran ayuda para invertir en sus actividades como Doña Maximina quien invertirá en bordados, pescados y pollos; Doña Nicolasa, en borregos y maíz; Rosaura, en ropa y María Cruz, en una tienda de abarrotes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Doña Lucy es quien porta el suéter color negro.
texts.en:
The small territory of this Méxican community affirms the great history that its streets and fields maintain. The people here are very happy and hardworking, especially the members of the El Molino group (The Mill Group). They are all housewives who struggle daily for their families to keep their well-being. On the other hand, they are excited because the patriotic month is near and they are making preparations to have a special celebration. The 15th of September they celebrate their independence, as is customary in México. The celebration continues on the 16th, for which they organize a big parade and honors to the country.

Doña Lucia is characterized by her group to be very reserved, but above all very hardworking and responsible. She lives with her spouse, Margarito, and together they have a family of five children, four sons and only one daughter, who depend on them to continue their studies. Doña Lucy, as she is affectionately known, makes a living by raising pigs, cattle, chickens, turkeys and ducks, for more than 25 years now, since when she was married. "I really like my work because I see the little animals being born to their mothers. On one occasion a sheep gave birth to twins, but we had to help her. And so her twins were born and we were able to do it thanks to the techniques that we learned in training," says Lucy, happily. Lucy, in addition to the previous experience, has also taken different courses on animal care and nutrition.

She is very happy and grateful to VF México. With her loans she has been able to invest in her business, and with her profits she built her house. Nevertheless she still has the hope that her daughter will complete a professional degree and have a better quality of life. On this occasion she plans to invest in calves and food.

The group members are also very grateful to KIVA. Its reliability is a great help to invest in their activities. Doña Maximina will invest in embroidery, fish and poultry; Doña Nicolasa, in sheep and corn; Rosaura, in clothing; and Maria Cruz, in a grocery store.

* The photograph was taken in the town garden, Doña Lucy wears the black sweater.

loans.use: to buy food and calves.

location.town: San Juan Jalpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Kaila

texts.en: Kaila from Dingalan, Aurora is taking up a certificate course on Microfinance technology. She is 20 years old whose family is struggling financially. She says that her parents cannot pay for all her school expenses. That’s why she wants to avail an education loan worth PHP43,000 so she can sustain her own schooling. She is hopeful that lenders will be generous to her so she can finish her studies and help her younger sibling to finish as well.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee in Microfinance Technology

loans.name: Ma. Tionela

texts.en:
Ma. Tionela is 45 years old, married with two children. Both of whom are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Tionela has a pottery business in the Philippines. Ma. Tionela requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Ma. Tionela has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ma. Tionela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Jally

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jally works hard to support her family.

She has a home products retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling shoes. Jally is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more home products to sell for her home products retail business.

Jally has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 53 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, snack food and personal care products. 

In the future Concepcion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en: Sarat’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sarat works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sokra

texts.en:
Sok Ra is 45 years old living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province and she is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are schoolchildren and the other one is under age of school. Growing cassava and rubber are the primary sources of her family’s income. These businesses have been with her for 17 years. Destruction by insect pests on her crop causes her to earn a very low income, which is hard for her to support her big family.

This is the fifth cycle for Sok Ra with VisionFund and she repaid her past loans successfully. The previous loans, she has household supplies for her family’s uses. She is now applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer to produce good yield. She hopes that this fifth loan will help her to get high yield to earn more income so that she can expand her current business and send children to school as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce good yield to earn more income so that she can expand her current business and send her children to school

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some sacks of rice, one refrigerator, and edible oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase binding materials and stationary for resale

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 35 years old, married and has four children. Three of her children are enrolled in school.

Jenelyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenelyn has been farming sugarcane for 13 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sreyny's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province, Sreyny is 47 years old, and she has four dependent children who are all in school.

For 29 years she has sold grocery items and worked at a garment factory to earn a living. Her grocery-selling business is doing poorly due to having fewer customers, while the price of grocery items is increasing in market.

Lacking working capital to support her business, Sreyny decided to lead a group of three to ask for a loan with VisionFund. She will manage her entire portion of the loan to buy more grocery items in order to attract more customers and increase sales. She hopes to earn more profits so that she can support her children’s education until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items in order to attract more customers and increase sales so that she can afford her children’s education until they graduate.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and, equally with her husband, responsible for all of them.

Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he manufactures iron accessories through welding. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demands of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Kubra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Kubrais very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding raw materials for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 63 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Vilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Vilma has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Vilma has been in this business for 42 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa, 39, is living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of five children, three of whom are in school.

The main sources of her income are from growing rice and selling organic fertilizer. She can get supplemental income by selling grocery items. She has been involved in her job for 21 years. The main challenge for her business is that the price of organic fertilizer is decreasing in the market so she cannot generate more income to support her family’s daily expenses.

Channa leads a group of five, which is the first time for her to apply for a Kiva loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to grow a good-quality crop and to keep some for sale as well.

She hopes that this loan will help her to get a high yield and earn more income in order to get a better living standard than last year. Moreover, she can manage to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow good-quality crop and keep some for resale in order to increase her income so that she can manage to support her children’s studies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kean's Group

texts.en:
Kean is 46 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She has two dependent children.

She has done rice farming as the main source of her family’s income for 28 years. Moreover, she works as a construction worker for a fee to earn more income to support her living. Her crop has been destroyed by insect pests, so she is earning a lower income, which is only about 13 USD per day to support her whole family.

This is Kean's fourth loan cycle with VisionFund. The previous loans have enabled her to improve her living standard. As the group leader of a four-member group, she will use the new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay for labor fees to enhance the productivity of her crop. She hopes to get more income so that she can expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the productivity of her crop and pay for labor fees, to get more income so that she can expand her current business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sithul's Group

texts.en:
Sithul lives in Kampong Cham province. She is 44 years old and a married mother of three dependent children.

Rice farming is the primary source of her income. Meanwhile, she can earn supplemental income by working for a labor fee. She has been involved in her business for 26 years. Insect pests have destroyed her crop, so she is getting a lower yield than the previous year. Her daily income is around 11 USD per day to support her family’s living.

This is her third cycle with VisionFund. With the past loans, her family’s living standard has improved.

Due to a lack of working capital, she is now leading a group of four to get a new Kiva loan. This new loan will be used to buy organic fertilizer and pay for labor fees to increase crop yield. She hopes to get a higher yield so that she can increase profits to save for future need.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay labor fees to increase crop yield so that she can increase profits to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en: Ariel is a 19-year old student from Laur, Nueva Ecija. He is currently taking up a 9-month Microfinance Technology course.  He wants to finish his studies and have a stable job to help her grandmother out of poverty, and also those who have supported him financially. Ariel wants to avail an education loan of PHP43,000 from the KIVA lenders to aid in his schooling.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee in MIcrofinance Technology

loans.name: Yhimi Honan

texts.es:
Yhimi tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, su población en la mayoría se dedica al comercio y agricultura especialmente de frutales, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Yhimi tiene un taller de carpintería metálica, ubicado en su domicilio en el cual elabora diferentes productos de metales como son puertas, ventanas, escaleras, con una experiencia de más de 07 años en el negocio, además se desempeña como maestro de construcción. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de materiales y herramientas como madera, fierros, clavos, entre otros, para su negocio y de esta manera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, mejorando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yhimi is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of San Felipe. Its inhabitants work primarily in business and agriculture, especially fruit. San Felipe is in the Jaén province, which is in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

Yhimi has a metalworking shop located in his home, in which he makes different metal products such as doors, windows and stairs. He has over 7 years in his business. He also works as a construction manager. He seeks a loan to buy materials and tools for his business such as wood, iron and nails, among others, in order to offer better service to his customers, thereby increasing his level of income, and his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria has been operating her tailoring business to make a living. She was thankful to GDMPC for the capital entrusted to her in order to improve her business for she solely provide the needs of her family. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for the business.

To improve her services, she took a new loan recently to buy machine parts for repair and maintenance cost to improve her sewing activities. She wants to improve the general living conditions by improving her business first and be able to buy more unit of sewing machine as expansion.

loans.use: to buy machine parts for repair and maintenance costs of her sewing machine

loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
She is Sahera, 36 years old, a new member of *CCT (Center For Community Transformation)a Christian organization against poverty and serves urban and rural poor communities. Sahera is married to Mahammad Raid, a businessman and they have five children of which one is in College, one is in High School, two are in the Elementary level and the youngest is not of school age yet.

She is thankful that she has run her general store for seventeen years already which is a great help in raising a family of five children. She sells dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food and household items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Sahera is seeking your financial assistance of Php 30000 loan which she will use to refill her store with rice, canned foods, instant noodles, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, soda, toiletries, etc. She finds is necessary to fill her store with more food and household items to attract more customers. Although her sales suffers during rainy months, she is glad that her sales pick up during summer months and Christmas season. She is thanking you in advance for supporting her livelihood.

As with most small store owners, her simple dream is to grow her mini store into a big grocery store and see her children finish College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship *CCT members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is 36 years old, married with three children. With all three in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Reina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Reina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Reina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Reina would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 38 years old, married with seven children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Concepcion has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for six years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and married with three children.  With all three children in school, Ana works very hard to provide for them.

Ana has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, snack food and other groceries. 

In the future Ana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sokum's Group

texts.en: Sokum’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokum works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 34-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughters and a son.

Her husband is a very hard-working and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers many types of delicious foods. Customers do not like to come inside the restaurant due to poor seating arrangements. He does not want to disappoint his dear customers because these customers enable him to earn his income.

Najma wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, such as tables and chairs.
Therefore, Najma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy new plastic tables and chairs.

Najma says thank you to Kiva and appreciates the warm support offered to her.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en: Lorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sreymom is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with three children who are depending on her. Two children are in school while the remaining one is too young to attend school. She has been growing rice for years to earn the main source of income. The drop of rice price is the challenge to her business.
This will be the first time for Sreymom with VisionFund. As the leader of a two-member group, she will use her loan to purchase rice seeds and to pay for plowing fee. She wants to get more yields as well as her income so that she can support her children’s education until they graduate.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to increase her crop yields as well as her income so that she can support her children’s education until they graduate.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Lagm Taabanooma Group

texts.fr: Françoise est âgée de 46 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. elle  exerce son activité de vendeuse de dolo depuis 8 ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est ça façon de se comporter envers ses clients, elle à l'écoute de ses clients et aussi tient son lieu de commerce très propre, sans oublier son amour et le respect envers la clientèle.Elle veut le prêt pour acheter du dolo (boisson alcoolisées traditionnelle) à 50 000 F pour revendre. l'utilité du prêt c’est de s'approvisionner en dolo afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et aussi renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Françoise is forty-six years old, married and mother to four children. She has been selling dolo (traditional, alcoholic drink) for eight years. The reason her business is so successful is the way she conducts herself with her customers. She is very attentive, keeps her establishment very clean and has a lot of love and respect for her clients.

Françoise has requested this loan to buy dolo for 50,000 francs CFA. This will satisfy her customers demands and improve her business. She has already received several loans and they have always been repaid on the correct date.

loans.use: to buy dolo (traditional, alcoholic drink) for resale.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en: Thida’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Thida works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kitona Ii Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis 40 ans que Maria, présidente du groupe KITONA II, exerce la culture du paddy qu'elle a apprise de ses parents. Cette culture étant rentable; elle a pu réunir deux cent cinquante dollars lors de la récolte précédente après un coût de production équivalent à cent dollars. Sans toutefois ignorer certaines difficultés liées au manque d'eau d'irrigation, les maladies de plantes ainsi les oiseaux ravageurs, le groupe souhaite avoir une bonne récolte qui leur permettra de scolariser leurs enfants, améliorer l'alimentation ainsi que les conditions d'habitat. Sur photo, Maria est distinctive au travers d'un carnet qu'elle tient entre ses mains.
texts.en:
Maria is the president of the Kitona II Group and has been tending a rice paddy for forty years now. She learnt her farming techniques from her parents. Her business is successful, she made $250 from her last harvest, after production costs of $100. There are several problems that she has to surmount such as lack of irrigation water, plant disease and birds who destroy crops.

The group would all like to ensure a good harvest so that they can educate their children and improve their food and living conditions.

Maria can be identified in the photo as she is holding a booklet in her hands.

loans.use: to pay for weeding, transplanting, help with harvesting and buy fertilizer and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Raja

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Raja is 35 years old, widow with one child, and lives in small village in Nablus city. Raja has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc.

Raja needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Raja hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock.

Raja thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “LAS AZUCENAS” y está conformado por 07 socias responsables. DELIA  de 25 años de edad es conviviente con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de zapatos desde hace más de 06 años que tiene dicho negocio. Gracias al préstamo podrá implementar más su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para reparación de su maquinaria de de zapatos .su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio. El grupo “las azucenas” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Delia SE encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado derecho viste casaca color negro.
texts.en:
Las Azucenas is made up of seven responsible members. 25-year old Delia lives with her partner and two children. She has earned her living making and selling footwear for the six years she's had her business.

Thanks to this loan she will be able to expand her business, her greatest wish. She will have some footwear-making equipment repaired.

Las Azucenas group is grateful to Kiva lenders who make this loan possible. Delia can be seen in the back row, first person on the right, wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: have her shoe-making equipment repaired

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en: Manolo is 27 years old and single resides at  Maningcol, Ozamiz City. Manolo with his parents. he owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. he has been in the business for five years and earns 8,000 PHP per month. he had repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying tires and accessories for his motor. he is now taking anew loan to buy spare parts and accessories for motorcycle maintenance for a safe travel with costumers. Manolo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephinie is 45 years old, married with five children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephinie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josephinie requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Josephinie has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Josephinie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 30 years old and married.

Estela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Estela has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Estela aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María, de 45 años de edad, nunca tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la elaboración de cestas, tienen 4 hijos pero todos están acompañados.

María, desde hace 15 años se dedica junto a su esposo a la elaboración de cestas, su esposo le enseñó y decidió dedicarse a este negocio debido a la necesidad que tenían y para ayudar con los gastos del hogar; además trabajan en la agricultura, su día comienza a las 5:00 a.m. pues tiene que irse temprano para empezar a las 6:00 a.m. y cuando regresan a casa por las tardes, trabajan elaborando las cestas para comercializarlas en el mercado de la ciudad.

El crédito será invertido para comprar materiales para la elaboración de cesta.

María, sueña con comprar un terreno para construir una casa, porque actualmente viven en un terreno que le pertenece a una sobrina.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture and makes baskets. They have four children and all of them are in relationships.

For 15 years María has worked together with her husband making baskets. Her husband taught her and she decided to work in this business because of their needs and to help with the household expenses. They also work in agriculture. Her day begins at 5 am as she has to leave early to start at 6 am. When they return to the house in the afternoon they work making baskets to sell in the market in the city.

The loan will be invested to buy materials to make baskets.

María dreams of buying a plot of land to build a house as currently they live on land that belongs to a niece.

loans.use: to buy materials to make baskets.

loans.name: Delwend Group

texts.fr: Bibiane, est âgée de 59 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 11 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son expérience dans l'activité, elle entretien toujours son lieu de commerce propre, elle aussi la meilleure qualité de dolo dans son quartier sans oublier sa douceur, son accueil, l'écoute et sa disponibilité qui est très importante chez elle. Elle veut le prêt de 100 000 F pour acheter du mil et les 25 000 seront utilisées dans la préparation du dolo ( achat de levure et autres..) afin de vendre à ses clients. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en matière première afin de préparer son bon dolo pour ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 4 fois et à rembourser à ACFIME aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Bibiane is fifty-nine years old, married and mother to eight children. She has been running her business for eleven years. It is successful because of her experience, she always keeps her establishment clean and offers the best quality dolo (a traditional, alcoholic drink) for sale. She is also always welcoming and takes the time to listen and be available for her customers.

Bibiane will spend 100,000 francs CFA on millet and 25,000 francs CFA on preparing dolo (buying yeast and other supplies). She has already received four other loans and they were always repaid to the field partner, ACFIME, on time.

loans.use: to buy millet and pay for preparation of dolo (a traditional, alcoholic drink).

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a 40 year-old married father of six children who works hard to support his family. He is a teacher and his wife is housewife. Even though the family works very hard to support his family, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education.

Tomas very happy because Tuba Rai Metin give loan of $ 1000 will allow Tomas to send her daughter to University. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, school supplies. He loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, school supplies for his daughter to attend university

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a permanent resident of Lungujja rubaga division Kampala, he deals in motor cycle spare parts, buying and selling of both new and used motor cycles at Kibuye.
From his much effort, he has managed to set up a permanent house where is currently staying though it's not yet finished. Along the way, he has become stuck and he is looking for funds to accomplish the building of his apartment.

He has resorted to borrowing three million shillings (ugx3,000,000/=) so that he buys the remaining materials. He will buy cement, sand, paint and other materials needed.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Nareen

texts.en:
NAREEN is the age of 32 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; three of them stays at home and one goes to school.

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been supporting his whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers, so that he can grow his income.

NAREEN is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. NAREEN is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to generate more profit and savings, as well.

NAREEN thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for her husband's restaurant so he can offer more menus to his customer.

loans.name: Somkeita Group

texts.fr:
Adama est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée mère de 2 enfants tous majeurs. elle exerce son activité depuis 7 ans.
elle a une boutique et dans sa boutique elle vend des produits alimentaires, ce qui fait marcher sa boutique on y trouve du tout ce qui satisfait ses clients, elle est dynamique, accueillante, elle est à l'écoute de la clientèle.Elle veut acheter des produits alimentaires (savon, lait, sucre, huile, etc..) à 75 000 F. l'utilité du prêt c'est d'approvisionner sa boutique afin de renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Adama is 47 years old and the married mother of two children, both adults. She has been running her business for seven years. She has a little shop and in her shop, she sells foodstuffs. Her business functions because her customers can find everything they need there. She is dynamic, welcoming, and she listens to her clientele.

Adama wants to buy some general merchandise (soap, milk, sugar, oil, etc.) for 75,000 francs. The object of the loan is to stock her shop so as to reinforce her business. She has already received two loans and has reimbursed ACFIME on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy some general merchandise items (soap, milk, sugar, oil, etc.) for 75,000 francs

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: JUDITH de 25 años de edad es CASADA y tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “las pioneras” la cual lo conforman 06 socias con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 1 año que se dedica al negocio de alquiler de mototaxi lo cual lo realiza por su zona. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia. Solicitó el crédito para reparación de su moto. La Alcancía “las pioneras” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Judith es la primera del lado derecho se encuentra sentada.
texts.en:
JUDITH is 25 years old, married and has one dependent child. She belongs to the “Las Pioneras” communal bank which is made up of six members who have the desire to work honorably and progress. For more than one year she has worked renting a motorcycle which she does in her area. Thanks to her constant dedication she has manged to get her family ahead. Her greatest wish is to have her own house.

She is requesting the loan to have her motorcycle repaired. The “Las Pioneras” communal bank are grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support provided. Judith is the first on the right, sitting down.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena has three children attending to school who are in high school level of education. Her life as a wife and mother is very challenging. She encountered different difficulties in life but it never comes to her mind to give up. Instead, she did her best to overcome it.

Rowena is engaged in selling of plastic wares in different villages. She has been in this business for 12 years. Her income from the business serve for the education of her children. With this, Rowena wants to grow the business because someday her children will enter college. Therefore, Rowena ask for a loan of P50,000 to buy hanger, pail, basin, and other plastic wares to sell. Rowena will do her best to get her wants soon that enables her to sends her children in school up to college.

loans.use: to buy hanger, pail, basin, and other plastic wares to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: This marks Agnes fourth borrowing after servicing her loans successfully, she will use the money to purchase a hair drier in her salon which will help her get more clients hence increase her income, she is greatful to the loan facility hence her dream are almost true.

loans.use: to buy stock of salon products.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old and married. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 12 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Virginia is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Lydia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she deals in buying and selling of general merchandise and food staffs like bread, cooking oil, maize and cassava flour and others to the local people. She gets additional income from cocoa growing.

She started the business 4 years ago, so far the profits are good. She is hard working and plans to expand the business, but faces competition and dishonest customers with high default rates, this affects her profits. Ester has requested for a loan to buy sugar, rice and maize flour for selling to her customers. She holds a dream of becoming a prominent business woman and constructing a permanent house for the family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and maize flour for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge es un microempresario de 54 años de edad que se encuentra domiciliado un barrio de Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar y su amor por el arte de las ornamentaciones y trabajos en hierro, lo motivarlo a capacitarse en una institución del estado e iniciar su taller, en el que hoy en día cuenta con una amplia experiencia de 20 años, oficio que le permite fabricar productos que combinan su talento, buen gusto y calidad. En su vivienda adecuó un espacio para su taller y en el ofrece servicios de diseño, elaboración de cerramientos en hierro para terrazas, ventanas y puertas y les ofrece a sus clientes comodidad en sus pagos o a un contado de acuerdo al contrato que estipulen. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en varillas de distintos calibres, cerraduras, material para soldadura y entre otros insumos necesarios para la producción que al comprarse por volúmenes le generan un menor costo. Su meta a futuro es mantener estable y próspero su negocio.
texts.en:
54-year old Jorge runs a small business where he lives in the neighbourhood of Cartagena de Indias, a municipality in Bolívar department. His love of ornamental art and ironwork led him to take a course at a state institution. Then he opened his own workshop. He now has 24 years of experience in this line of work making products that combine his talents, good taste, and quality workmanship.

Jorge has dedicated part of his house to his workshop where he offers design services, conservatories for patios, windows, and doors made of metal. He provides easy payment terms or cash for his customers--whatever has been agreed on in the contract.

Now Jorge is seeking his first loan with Kiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He plans to buy iron rods of different diameters, locks, and soldering materials that he needs for his work. By buying in quantity, he will incur lower costs. Jorge's goal is to keep his business stable and prosperous.

loans.use: buy iron rods of different diameters, locks, and soldering materials

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Luri is married and lives with his large family in Senaki district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 3 cows, 2 calves and 2 pigs. His wife produces cheese products to sell locally as well as to use for family feed.

Luri wants to open a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit Luri will open a workshop, where he will recycle polyethylene and plastic stuffs. He will sell the recycled powder to another workshop, where different kinds of materials are made from recycled plastic and polyethylene. Luri is very hardworking man and very motivated to start a new business. He already had a Start Up loan from Credo and awaits your support once again.

loans.use: to open a business to recycle plastics and other polyethylene materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy additional grocery products such as sweets, soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yawa Bénédicte

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme célibataire habitant à Adidogomé avec un enfant à sa charge. Agée de 23 ans, Yawa est une marchande de produits de beauté qui circule dans les quartiers environnant. Yawa fait son approvisionnement deux fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de pommades en vue d’en tirer un maximum de profit afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de son enfant et améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en: Yawa is a single woman living in Adidogomé with one dependent child. She is 23 years old and sells beauty products as an itinerant vendor in nearly neighborhoods. Yawa stocks up twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to stock up on hair gel in order to maximize her profit margin and be able to provide for her child and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy 39 units of hair gel.

loans.name: Reoun's Group

texts.en: Reoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Reoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Muhoto Group

texts.fr: Avec une expérience acquise de ses parents, Séraphin a commencé à cultiver le paddy en 1989 et a constaté que l'activité est rentable. Séraphin reste optimiste malgré que cette culture est butée de temps en temps par les maladies des plantes, la carence d'eau et l'insuffisance de terres arables. Il souhaite acquérir son propre espace cultural, l'élargir afin d'avoir une bonne production qui pourra l'aider à scolariser ses enfants et à améliorer son habitat. Président du groupe MUHOTO, il tient sur la photo un carnet rose.
texts.en:
Séraphin began cultivating his rice paddy in 1989, having learned his skill from his parents. His business is successful and so he is optimistic despite problems with plant disease, lack of water and a shortage of fertile land.

Séraphin would like to obtain his own growing land and expand his business. This would enable him to educate his children and improve their living conditions.

Séraphin is the president of the Muhoto Group and is holding a pink booklet in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and phytosanitary products, and pay for labour to weed and harvest.

loans.name: Bushambale Group

texts.fr: C'est à partir de l'année 2007 jusqu'en 2013 que les membres du groupe BUSHAMBALE ont commencé à cultiver le riz encouragés par leurs familles et amis qui les ont formé en la matière. Butés par l'insuffisance de fonds pour cette activité,ils souhaitent tous, néanmoins, arriver à des bons résultats afin d'améliorer la survie de leurs familles respectives et des autres en général. Gérard en est le président et sur photo, il tient un carnet rose.
texts.en:
Beginning in the year 2007, the members of the group called Bushambale began to grow rice, continuing till 2013, encouraged by their friends and families who taught them how to do it. Brought up short by lacking funds for this business, they all still wish to get good results so as to improve the lives of their respective families and of others in general.

Gerard is the president and in this photo, he is holding a pink notebook.

loans.use: to pay for labor for plowing, seeding, weeding, and to buy lime and other products for healthy plant growth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sand, gravel and cement to provide better quality of living for her family.

loans.name: Victor Luis

texts.en: Victor Luis is 18 years old from Bangad, Sta. Maria, Isabela. His father works as a company driver while his mother is an Avon dealer. With the little income, his parents find it hard to send him to college that’s why Victor wants to avail an education loan of PHP43,000 from the KIVA lenders to sustain his schooling and have a brighter future ahead. He is determined to finish this course even though he finds it hard to be away from his family. He is taking up a 9-month Microfinance Technology course in ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee in microfinance technology

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 22 years old from San Leonardo, Maria Aurora. He wants to finish his studies and find a stable job to help his family but with their family’s little income, his parents cannot send him to college. After 7 years of stopping from school, he decided to go back to school by taking a 9-month Microfinance technology course. That’s why Julius wants to avail an education loan of PHP40,000 to finance his schooling.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee in microfinance technology

loans.name: Ort's Group

texts.en: Ort’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ort makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old. She is a single mother with two children. She has had a salon business for two years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. She has borrowed KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan.

She will be using the loan to purchase salon equipment and beauty items. She also hopes that the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her kids, expand her current business and repay her loan too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a better life with her children.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment and beauty items.

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr: Céline est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant. Agée de 24 ans, Céline fume les poissons congelés en celui fumés et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois  au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Céline sollicite ce prêt pour financer son achat des cartons de poissons congelés en vue d’accroître son stock puis par suite réaliser plus de bénéfices pour faire face aux besoins de son foyer.
texts.en:
Céline is a married woman and the mother of one child. Aged 24, Céline smokes frozen fish turning them into smoked fish. She buys her wares three times a month at the market and resells the fish by going from neighborhood to neighborhood.

Céline is requesting this loan to pay for her purchase of cartons of frozen fish so as to grow her stock and then make more profit so that she can deal with her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of frozen fish.

loans.name: Mohahmmad

texts.en: Mohahmmad is a 26-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah, which is both a city and a refugee camp in the Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw for the past three years. Mohahmmad buys the products wholesale and resells them for a small profit margin. Mohahmmad has taken out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell. He hopes that, by taking this loan, he will be able to improve his family's conditions. Mohahmmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell

loans.name: Nisrin

texts.en: Nisrin is a 34-year-old married woman and lives in a house that she owns. She has had a beauty salon in her home for six years. She has many customers as she does a very good job. With the profits, Nisrin is able to move forward with her family. She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hairpins and other things that she needs. With these items, Nisrin can earn higher profits, thus giving her greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 47-year-old CCT partner from Muntinlupa, Philippines and the wife of Rogelio, a driver. She has been buying and selling fresh vegetables and meat products for two years now, with earnings of approximately PHP 6,000 every month. She is grateful that through her business, she and her husband were able to support their children’s education. She has two in college and the other is in the elementary level.

Though it is difficult to earn nowadays, Marilyn is motivated to save money for their future and make the business grow to earn more profit each day. Being involved in the business really helped her sustain their day-to-day expenses. However, she still needs to have added capital, and that is why she applied for a PHP 18,000 loan to have supplementary capital for buying fresh vegetables and meat every morning.

Despite being busy managing the business, Marilyn spares time to attend CCT group fellowship which consists of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To have supplementary capital for buying fresh vegetables and meat every morning.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is 24 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Donna has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional clothing to sell.

Donna has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en: Vasil is focusing more on the sheep and cattle activity; raising and selling babies of these animals.In the land his family owns, they plant mostly food for the animals such as fodder and corn that they use it for their animals and also beans that they sell. The loan he is requesting is to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep; his activity is raising and selling sheep and cattle

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rosenda works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Rosenda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Boenzemwende Group

texts.fr: Salamata est âgée de  27 ans mariée mère de 02 enfants. Elle exerce son activité de restauration depuis 3 ans.Ce qui fait marcher  son activité c'est la diversité des plats  de bon goût et très délicieux, elle est à la proximité d'une grande voie, son lieu de commerce est très propre et elle même. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 4 sac de riz à 106 500 et les pattes alimentaires 06 paquets à 60 000 F et le reste sera attribué au divers à 33 500 F afin de préparer pour ses clients.l'utilité du prêt de de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà le prêt deux fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME
texts.en:
Salamata is twenty-seven years old, married and mother to two children. She has been running her restaurant business for three years. She is successful because she offers a range of delicious dishes. Her business is based near a busy road and she keeps it, and herself, very
clean and tida.

Salamata will buy four sacks of rice for 106,500 francs CFA, six packets of pasta for 60,000 francs CFA and other items for 33,500 francs CFA. These will be used to prepare dishes for her customers and generate a profit.

Salamata has already received two loans from the field partner, ACFIME, and they were both repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of rice, 6 packets of spaghetti and various other products to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Faustina Felipa

texts.es:
Faustina is a 55-year old farmer in Chao, department of La Libertad, Peru. She grows organic Hass avocados for export. She has raised her children through her work as a farmer.
Faustina is now seeking a loan of $ 1700 dollars to improve her production and quality by purchasing organic fertilizers and other organic inputs. The increased income will help her build the roof of her family's house.
texts.en:
Faustina is a 55-year-old farmer in Chao, department of La Libertad, Peru. She grows organic Hass avocados for export. She has raised her children with her work as a farmer.

Faustina is now seeking a loan of $ 1,700 dollars to improve her production and quality by purchasing organic fertilizers and other organic inputs. The increased income will help her build the roof of her family's house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve her organic avocado production

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Sans enfants, Kafui est une femme divorcée qui habite à Adidogomé. Agée de 48 ans, Kafui est une revendeuse des sachets plastiques qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Kafui demande ce prêt pour commander des colis de sachets plastiques. Avec le bénéfice qui en résultera, Kafui va pouvoir aider son mari à bien s’occuper de ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Kafui is forty-eight years old, divorced and has no children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells plastic bags. She buys her stock once a month from the market and sells it from her home and in the surrounding areas.

Kafui has requested this loan to buy boxes of plastic bags. Her profits will be used to help her husband pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy 25 boxes of plastic bags for sale.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim, a 21-year-old refugee, lives with his parents and four brothers in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. Salim is the eldest among his brothers, who all still go to school, which pushed him to start working to support his parents financially and his brothers' education. Five years ago, Salim started working as a car electrician in his own garage inside the camp after training for several years as an apprentice.

In order to improve his garage, Salim is asking for a loan of 2,057,996 Lebanese pounds. This is his first loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He will use the loan to buy a new scanner, which will allow him to provide his clients with better service.

Salim is an ambitious young man who is always looking for ways to improve his business. His prices are competitive in the area, and he has a very good reputation inside the camp, which helps him attract good customers.

loans.use: To buy a scanner machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel and boards and be able to finish his house and improve his living conditions.
